postInfo: ['Reviewed in the United States on January 1, 2019']
text: This dryer is too big for a traveling :: I bought this hair dryer for travel and our seasonal home. For travel it is way too big and heavy. I also liked the various settings for the heat and blower. Unfortunately there isn't many useful ones. The cool setting and the cool shot button are exactly the same temperature and the warm is only a little warmer. The most useful setting is hot with low blower or hot with high blower. If you are looking for a light weight travel dryer that doesn't take up tons of room in suitcase don't get this one.

postInfo: ['Reviewed in the United States on June 21, 2019']
text: Plenty of power! :: I just tested out the dryer prior to a trip overseas. It worked very well! I m super particular about my dryer and usually pack my t3 dryer (a brand I ve used for 12 years). Sadly my normal dryer wasn t compatible abroad. This has plenty of power and heat. The high blowing setting is too much to be honest. Sorry to say, but the reviewers who say it s not strong enough are probably frying their hair unnecessarily! I have thick, curly, frizzy hair and this worked great for straightening.

postInfo: ['Reviewed in the United States on May 12, 2019']
text: Adaptable Hair dryer a must for foreign travel :: Used this in Italy worked great! You do have to purchase the proper adapter plug to fit over the US one before you go.

postInfo: ['Reviewed in the United States on March 24, 2019']
text: LACKS POWER :: I purchased a different travel dryer last year and left it on a trip - this was teh replacement. I wish i could get the other one back - this one lacks power and is just ok....

postInfo: ['Reviewed in the United States on July 8, 2019']
text: Travel Hair Dryer Must Have! :: I purchased this hairdryer for my two week trip to Europe. It did not disappoint. It is a great hair dryer at a fantastic price. I highly recommend this product for those who travel a lot over seas. It is light weight and durable. You will not be disappointed. Highly recommend!

postInfo: ['Reviewed in the United States on May 4, 2019']
text: VERY Weak :: Looks nice, the size is good for traveling. I have not used it outside of the US so I do not know how this would work. Does not say 60/50 Hz so I do not know if this would work in the country with 50 Hz. Now, the air blow is VERY weak. Just like the one in some of the hotel uses. I guess the smaller the dryer, the weak it is. My wife's dryer is about twice as large and blows lots of hot air. But since this blower is for traveling so I shouldn't be complaining. Hope this works in the country with 50 Hz.

postInfo: ['Reviewed in the United States on April 17, 2019']
text: Surprising power and great for travel :: I never use high power when blowdrying my hair because of frizz. So the power of this on its high setting was perfect for me. It packs super easily and I didn't need my adaptor while in China.

postInfo: ['Reviewed in the United States on March 13, 2019']
text: Great product that can be used in USA and international travel :: like this product for a upcoming trip to Ireland

postInfo: ['Reviewed in the United States on August 16, 2019']
text: So far so good! :: I got this hair dryer primarily for using at home, although I do realize it s a travel dryer. Full-sized dryers tend to be too big and heavy for me, and this product is the perfect size and weight. I was worried that it might be a compact size like other travel dryers, but It s more of what I d call medium sized.Some more pros:- The folding feature allows it to be neatly stored without taking up too much space.- I LOVE the multiple settings: cool, warm, hot for temperature and off, low, high for power. I use it on a warm on high setting according to the instructions that came in the box, and am able to style my hair perfectly every time.- This dryer is supposed to adjust the voltage automatically so you don t have to. (I ve only used it on 110v so far and as soon as I turned it on the first time, the light on 110v turned on as it automatically detected it.)Cons:- There s really only one con I ve found so far, which is that the concentrator nozzle fits very tight and therefore is really hard to turn. I dry my hair with the nozzle turned vertically, but style with it turned horizontally. Every time I try to turn it, I have to turn the dryer off and actually exert some force. I m hoping it gets easier with repeated use.

postInfo: ['Reviewed in the United States on December 20, 2019']
text: Optional Heat Selection :: When my old hairdryer bit the dust, I had to purchase the same brand with the warm setting option.This one runs hotter than my old one did, so I find that the warm setting is not much different than the hot. Plus you have to push the cool button and hold it down in order to cool the warm down to not so hot .I wish this was as good as my old one but overall I m satisfied with this product because there is no other brand hairdryer with the optional heat selection.

postInfo: ['Reviewed in the United States on April 18, 2020']
text: Just what I was looking for. :: It took me a long time to choose a dryer. On almost 80% of the dryers I looked at for this price, they said they melted, caught fire or got extremely red-hot. This ceramic one is perfect so far. No it doesn't get SUPER hot but I like that. It dries my hair just fine. My hair is past my back almost to my butt. Its not that thick but super long. It took me about 10 minutes to fully dryer my hair with this after I towel dried. The dryer itself is lightweight, has a good grip on it for easy holding, and the actual dryer doesn't get hot, not even the head part. This is exactly what I was looking for. Its not quite a full sized dryer though, maybe mid sized. Too big to travel with but perfect for everyday use.*I will update my review in a month or two and let you all know how it holds up*

postInfo: ['Reviewed in the United States on April 3, 2020']
text: Solid performing and attractively finished hair dryer :: One thing to note right up front is there a strong-ish plasticky odor that does eventually fade after a week or two. Other than that, it's a decent option if you want a good value for a reliably performing product. It's not especially notable in any particular way, except for maybe the nice matte white body and the clear nozzle attachment, which makes it blend in nicely to an average residential bathrooms. The (detachable) "rose gold" filter cap is really more of a nice copper. The motor sound is not too loud, nor does it give off any annoying or unusual high or low frequencies. If there was one thing I'm least thrilled about is the power cord could use about another foot or so to its length.

postInfo: ['Reviewed in the United States on January 9, 2020']
text: Conair is the BEST!!! :: I have nothing but good things to say about Conair and their hair dryers. My last hair dryer which is a Conair, still works after 12 years but I wanted one to match my new flat iron. So I found this one. It s light weight, the cord is long enough to where you don t get tangled up in a long obnoxious cord, the hot setting doesn t get super hot which will eventually damage your hair if it s too hot. My hair drys fast with this dryer, my hair stays soft, and I love the Rose Gold and white color. The old dryer will he kept as a back up in storage. Conair will always have a customer with me!!!

postInfo: ['Reviewed in the United States on August 24, 2019']
text: Dries hair fast, great when storage room is tight :: Love this hairdryer. I bought it primarily for use at home. I'm very short on space in my condo so it seemed like a good option. It takes much less room than my old Conair Infiniti dryer. Pleasantly surprised to find that it drys my hair faster also. I have a short asymmetrical cut. It takes less than 5 minutes to style my hair perfectly. Someone else noted in their review that their finger accidentally turned off/ down the dryer speed. If I'm not careful the same thing happens to me. I suspect that we're both left handed. I don't find it to be a problem, possibly because I read about it before purchasing and hold the handle lower than I normally would. Very light weight dryer so that is not awkward

postInfo: ['Reviewed in the United States on July 1, 2019']

postInfo: ['Reviewed in the United States on January 17, 2020']
text: Love this dryer :: Seriously love this dryer. I bought it for home use (don't travel really). It packs away nicely. Compared to my old dryer this one is far lighter, shorter, and more compact. It's much quieter than my old dryer. My hair is naturally curly and this dryer leaves my hair less frizzy than my old dryer. *I've read some reviews about people saying it wasn't powerful. This dryer is plenty powerful enough and the heat settings are great. So happy I finally bought a new dryer!

postInfo: ['Reviewed in the United States on September 8, 2019']
text: Terrific Hairdryer :: I took this hair dryer to Norway and used it everyday for 2 weeks. It worked perfectly and without issue. The only thing that was needed was an adapter (not a converter) which was expected. The dryer displayed the voltage used in Norway as was advertised. When I got back to the States, I used this hair dryer and once again, it adapted to our voltage.This hair dryer had plenty of power and has a folding handle which allows it to be packed nicely into a suitcase. It might be a bit heavier than some customers may want but it delivered what I wanted - dry hair and no need to worry about changing voltage settings. I am more than satisfied with this product.

postInfo: ['Reviewed in the United States on February 20, 2020']
text: A blessing for those who often move back and forth into 220 volt countries :: After years of having to remember to switch a hair dryer from 110 to 220 when leaving The States, here is a smart dryer. Yes, it's more expensive and a little heavier than what's available at CVS and drugstores, but it is sturdy we'll designed, and the arrangement of speed and heat switches is for once logical for users. postInfo: ['Reviewed in the United States on January 1, 2019']
text: This dryer is too big for a traveling :: I bought this hair dryer for travel and our seasonal home. For travel it is way too big and heavy. I also liked the various settings for the heat and blower. Unfortunately there isn't many useful ones. The cool setting and the cool shot button are exactly the same temperature and the warm is only a little warmer. The most useful setting is hot with low blower or hot with high blower. If you are looking for a light weight travel dryer that doesn't take up tons of room in suitcase don't get this one.

postInfo: ['Reviewed in the United States on March 13, 2019']
text: Great product that can be used in USA and international travel :: like this product for a upcoming trip to Ireland

postInfo: ['Reviewed in the United States on August 16, 2019']
text: So far so good! :: I got this hair dryer primarily for using at home, although I do realize it s a travel dryer. Full-sized dryers tend to be too big and heavy for me, and this product is the perfect size and weight. I was worried that it might be a compact size like other travel dryers, but It s more of what I d call medium sized.Some more pros:- The folding feature allows it to be neatly stored without taking up too much space.- I LOVE the multiple settings: cool, warm, hot for temperature and off, low, high for power. I use it on a warm on high setting according to the instructions that came in the box, and am able to style my hair perfectly every time.- This dryer is supposed to adjust the voltage automatically so you don t have to. (I ve only used it on 110v so far and as soon as I turned it on the first time, the light on 110v turned on as it automatically detected it.)Cons:- There s really only one con I ve found so far, which is that the concentrator nozzle fits very tight and therefore is really hard to turn. I dry my hair with the nozzle turned vertically, but style with it turned horizontally. Every time I try to turn it, I have to turn the dryer off and actually exert some force. I m hoping it gets easier with repeated use.

postInfo: ['Reviewed in the United States on December 20, 2019']
text: Optional Heat Selection :: When my old hairdryer bit the dust, I had to purchase the same brand with the warm setting option.This one runs hotter than my old one did, so I find that the warm setting is not much different than the hot. Plus you have to push the cool button and hold it down in order to cool the warm down to not so hot .I wish this was as good as my old one but overall I m satisfied with this product because there is no other brand hairdryer with the optional heat selection.

postInfo: ['Reviewed in the United States on April 18, 2020']
text: Just what I was looking for. :: It took me a long time to choose a dryer. On almost 80% of the dryers I looked at for this price, they said they melted, caught fire or got extremely red-hot. This ceramic one is perfect so far. No it doesn't get SUPER hot but I like that. It dries my hair just fine. My hair is past my back almost to my butt. Its not that thick but super long. It took me about 10 minutes to fully dryer my hair with this after I towel dried. The dryer itself is lightweight, has a good grip on it for easy holding, and the actual dryer doesn't get hot, not even the head part. This is exactly what I was looking for. Its not quite a full sized dryer though, maybe mid sized. Too big to travel with but perfect for everyday use.*I will update my review in a month or two and let you all know how it holds up*

postInfo: ['Reviewed in the United States on April 3, 2020']
text: Solid performing and attractively finished hair dryer :: One thing to note right up front is there a strong-ish plasticky odor that does eventually fade after a week or two. Other than that, it's a decent option if you want a good value for a reliably performing product. It's not especially notable in any particular way, except for maybe the nice matte white body and the clear nozzle attachment, which makes it blend in nicely to an average residential bathrooms. The (detachable) "rose gold" filter cap is really more of a nice copper. The motor sound is not too loud, nor does it give off any annoying or unusual high or low frequencies. If there was one thing I'm least thrilled about is the power cord could use about another foot or so to its length.

postInfo: ['Reviewed in the United States on January 9, 2020']
text: Conair is the BEST!!! :: I have nothing but good things to say about Conair and their hair dryers. My last hair dryer which is a Conair, still works after 12 years but I wanted one to match my new flat iron. So I found this one. It s light weight, the cord is long enough to where you don t get tangled up in a long obnoxious cord, the hot setting doesn t get super hot which will eventually damage your hair if it s too hot. My hair drys fast with this dryer, my hair stays soft, and I love the Rose Gold and white color. The old dryer will he kept as a back up in storage. Conair will always have a customer with me!!!

postInfo: ['Reviewed in the United States on August 24, 2019']
text: Dries hair fast, great when storage room is tight :: Love this hairdryer. I bought it primarily for use at home. I'm very short on space in my condo so it seemed like a good option. It takes much less room than my old Conair Infiniti dryer. Pleasantly surprised to find that it drys my hair faster also. I have a short asymmetrical cut. It takes less than 5 minutes to style my hair perfectly. Someone else noted in their review that their finger accidentally turned off/ down the dryer speed. If I'm not careful the same thing happens to me. I suspect that we're both left handed. I don't find it to be a problem, possibly because I read about it before purchasing and hold the handle lower than I normally would. Very light weight dryer so that is not awkward

postInfo: ['Reviewed in the United States on January 17, 2020']
text: Love this dryer :: Seriously love this dryer. I bought it for home use (don't travel really). It packs away nicely. Compared to my old dryer this one is far lighter, shorter, and more compact. This dryer is plenty powerful enough and the heat settings are great. So happy I finally bought a new dryer!

postInfo: ['Reviewed in the United States on September 8, 2019']
text: Terrific Hairdryer :: I took this hair dryer to Norway and used it everyday for 2 weeks. It worked perfectly and without issue. The only thing that was needed was an adapter (not a converter) which was expected. The dryer displayed the voltage used in Norway as was advertised. When I got back to the States, I used this hair dryer and once again, it adapted to our voltage.This hair dryer had plenty of power and has a folding handle which allows it to be packed nicely into a suitcase. It might be a bit heavier than some customers may want but it delivered what I wanted - dry hair and no need to worry about changing voltage settings. I am more than satisfied with this product.

text: A blessing for those who often move back and forth into 220 volt countries :: After years of having to remember to switch a hair dryer from 110 to 220 when leaving The States, here is a smart dryer. Yes, it's more expensive and a little heavier than what's available at CVS and drugstores, but it is sturdy we'll designed, and the arrangement of speed and heat switches is for once logical for users. Let us now praise this perfect little unit.

postInfo: ['Reviewed in the United States on August 12, 2019']
text: A very good all around hair dryer that can be used daily :: This is a very good choice for a hair dryer,it travels overseas (with a proper plug adapter) and has a nice even heat.This type of hair dryer is good for people with dryer hair and they don t want to over dry it.If your hair is naturally heavy and harder to dry ,a concentrator is included.Shown in my picture is this dryer (White) ,an Infiniti Pro and a smaller travel dual voltage,all three are made by the same manufacturer.The dryer is basically full size with a folding handle,but it is 7.5 ounces lighter than my other full size.This is helpful when traveling as is the automatic voltage change,my small one has a switch you have to do manually.As you can see the wide exit nozzle is the reason some people think this isn t powerful,it is just the air is defused over a bigger surface.This dries my hair extremely well,my hair is dry with waves.It didn t make my hair overly dry or voluminous.Great dryer but it isn t the prefect dryer,a little too big,not too many add inside or a bag for travel.

postInfo: ['Reviewed in the United States on February 6, 2020']
text: Cons Outweigh the Pros :: Pros:LightweightNeutral colorInexpensiveCons:Low air flow and poor drying power - my hair is on the thinner side and my little travel dryer dried fasterShort cord - about two feet shorter than mostButtons too easy to press - if you grip the dryer, you will accidentally change a setting

postInfo: ['Reviewed in the United States on August 13, 2019']
text: Works great at home and I assume it ll work abroad! :: I haven t tested this hairdryer overseas yet. But it s got plenty of heat and power when used here in the U.S.A. So I m sure it will be fine. I wanted it, because I m going to Kazakhstan and Uzbekistan next spring, and none of the hotels I m staying at mention on their websites having hairdryers.Three weeks without a hairdryer is not something I can face. So I m playing it safe by packing this. I wish it were smaller, but at least it s pretty lightweight and folds down to be fairly compact. The instructions caution you not to wrap the cord around the dryer. They re very concerned that you not damage the cord. Reasonable but this could make the dryer a bit awkward to pack.The light that comes on to indicate your voltage is a nice feature (green for 125V and blue for 240V).

postInfo: ['Reviewed in the United States on October 13, 2019']
text: Nice price... :: This is a travel blow dryer; it folds up for easy packing. This dryer has plenty of air power and heat. It has 2 air settings, 3 heat settings and a cool shot button. The dryer has a 5 ft. cord and comes with a concentrator. When traveling no converter is needed; it automatically adjusts to the type of voltage. The LED indicator displays green for 125V and blue for 240V. This is a nice dryer for the price. Ni

postInfo: ['Reviewed in the United States on May 22, 2019']
text: Perfect for traveling abroad :: Went to Italy for ten days. Agonized over what hair dryer to get. Read stories of the 220v keeping the hair dryer from full heat and wattage. Bought this. Took a shot. Perfect. It was easy to pack, sensed the different voltage as promised with a simple plug adapter, had full wattage and heat and treated my very long, color-treated hair really well. I don't understand users who are buying this for every day use or US travel. It's a perfect solution meant to fulfill it's overseas purpose!

postInfo: ['Reviewed in the United States on May 19, 2019']
text: Lacks heat :: This is awful. It replaced a three year old Remington that crapped out. I knew I should have spent the $100 on a better one. The cord is shorter than my Remington, so when I'm trying my hair it wiggles out of the wall socket several times when I use it. And the heat settings are a joke. Warm is practically cool, which is what I use to dry my hair 80%. Withthis dryer I don't even bother with warm. It doesn't exist. I use the hit setting and remove the nozzle. When I'm ready to style I then attach the nozzle to increase the temp. While I appreciate the lower heats because my hair is recovering from bleach, this won't b effective when it's back n fighting shape. I'm just having to dry longer, which is redundant. If heat isn't a deal breaker for you, you may like this one. If I had a pixie it would work fine. But my hair is past my bra strap and I have a lot of it, so this isn't effective for me. It's going to have to do for now though. I find I'm using my Revlon round brush dryer more just to be done.

postInfo: ['Reviewed in the United States on August 10, 2019']
text: Worldwide Model For International Travel -- and Home (5- Stars) :: Although most hotels have hair dryers, sometimes international travel takes you to an apartment or to a private home or to a university dorm room where you have to provide your own. Hair dryers that don't convert can be a fire hazard. This Conair Worldwide Travel Hair Dryer was designed for those situations. It can automatically switch from 110 V to 240 V, and a sidepiece illuminates to tell you what kind of current is flowing through it. Even though you won't need a power convertor, you will need an adapter to fit international plugs.This hair dryer is larger than many travel hair dryers, although its handle does fold to make it more compact. It also performs better than many of its smaller cousins. Likewise, as a daily hair dryer, its blower is not as powerful as larger models. I find, though, that as long as I don't want a wind-blown look, the heat is enough to dry my thick hair on a daily basis at home. It comes with a clear plastic concentrator for more controlled styling.Instead of the controls running up and down, as on most hair dryers, the Worldwide models has buttons that operate side to side, horizontally instead of vertically. I've had to get used to that. I like that it has three heat options and two blower speeds as well as a cool shot button.Although most electronics these days will automatically convert power, hair dryers rarely do. That feature makes the Worldwide model unique. When you order this hair dryer, make sure the correct model is selected -- or else you'll end up with a full-size model that won't convert.-- Debbie Lee Wesselmann

postInfo: ['Reviewed in the United States on August 31, 2019']
text: Dried the kitten very fast. :: I can t explain why, but I ve had the same regular hairdryer for more than 10 years now. It had its day. Now it s old and inefficient.I also own a Revlon One-Step Hair Dryer & Volumizer Hot Air Brush. It s AMAZING although it s large. But there is one serious problem with this tool it does not do well drying a kitten who s just had his bath. (You also can t use it to dry clothing or water spills on the carpet.)So you might be able to imagine my joy when this Conair hairdryer came into my life.It has three temperatures, hot to start with, and warm to finish up. It also has cool so you can cool down if it s too hot to be drying your hair. The kitty likes hot although I don't want to get too close, so I ll switch to warm after a little. It shows the temperature on the side. It also has two speeds, high and low, for varying intensity, which the kitten can really appreciate.Being a hairdryer, it s still bulky, but the folding handle helps a lot in being able to store it. I have no need for a hairdryer when I travel so I can t say much about that.All in all a great dryer for home use for hair and kitten!

postInfo: ['Reviewed in the United States on August 18, 2019']
text: Full size dryer with variable heat and speed settings. Powerful. :: This is a review of the Conair 1875W Double Ceramic Hair Dryer, It is a full size dryer, not a travel one. The dryer is a gun type with a long nozzle. It comes with a removable condenser which is a nice extra. There are variable heat and speed settings which are useful. I start with the highest speed and hottest setting and then I go down to a warm setting that is less powerful. I finish off with the coolest setting.The dryer is not too heavy even though it is full size. It is easy on my hand and arm and dries my hair quickly. I feel the power is almost too much on the highest speed. Like a wind tunnel. But when I use it with variable settings as I said above, my hair looks good and isn't damaged. I have a heated brush blow dryer which I love and use a lot but I need to have a regular dryer as well. My hair is longer and layered and, depending on the style I want, I need to use a real dryer with a round or a paddle bush. This one isn't a rock star of a hair dryer with a ton of bells and whistles but works as it should and doesn't appear to damage my hair.

postInfo: ['Reviewed in the United States on August 26, 2019']
text: Sturdy, VERY adjustable heat and wind :: This is a sturdy hair dryer. I like the diffuser. I like that I can instantly get a blast of cool air. That was a new feature for me. The directions explain a lot about how your old bathroom wiring is dangerous and that it must be refitted with an interrupter circuit. Or you could get electrocuted. The drier did not work when I first tried, until I pushed the red button on the plug, which must have liked my modern extension cord, since it did work for me then. It is a pretty and stylish-looking blower, too. The color might make it seem more girly than general purpose.

postInfo: ['Reviewed in the United States on September 8, 2019']
text: Perfect for international travel :: Using a power adapter doesn't always help with adjusting the voltage correctly. I really appreciate that this small, portable/foldable hair dryer makes that adjustment (although still needs the power adapter) so it works the same no matter what the power supply is. I really like the cool shot -- cool air rather than just heated air -- which not only helps set your style, but cools you down too after a session of hot air blowing on your head. It's lightweight and easy to hold. THe cord is about 5 ft long -- wish it were just a little longer, but its still great.

postInfo: ['Reviewed in the United States on January 7, 2018']
text: Comb attachment wont stay on the dryer :: Let me say this before i go off into a rant. I stand by Andis products, always have and always will. They make great dryers and im overall satisfied but THIS parricular product is frustrating. The comb attachment doesnt screw into the dryer, it just sits in there and comes off with a half sneeze. I have fairly thick hair but its manageable overall. This comb attachment design cant handle the job. I will comb my hair to get all the kinks out before i blow dry it and even then the comb attachment pops off if my hair even thinks of kinking up then to put it back on while the dryer is steaming hot is not only a burden but a hazard. Every time...every single time i dry my hair, i have to chase the dryer comb around the bathroom numerous times because it pops off, falls, and bounces away. With me being the person that i am, i began to take it personal. Blow dryong my hair has become a frustrating chore simply because the comb attachment will not stay on the dryer under no circumstances, for any types of hair whether straight, kinked, wet or dry. I bought the dryer in october and its january and ive had enough of frying my hands chasing a rogue comb attachment that refuses to stay on the dryer that it was designed to attached to. Sorry Andis i love you but THIS product design is flawed. I suggest to spring for the more expensive one.

postInfo: ['Reviewed in the United States on July 18, 2017']
text: Update!!!! :: I go through hair dryers often......you buy them in the store and take it home and then hate it. Too much hassle to take it back so it sits in a drawer. I am buying a second one since I travel a lot and have to fight with my spouse over who gets to use it! Andis is an excellent manufacturer!****update: I ve gone through 3 of these in about a year and a half. It s a love / hate relationship! Best, hottest, perfect airflow of any hair dryer I ve used. #1 issue is they only last a couple months (daily use by 2 girls with med hair / 15 min ea of us) before they start acting up. Motor switches to cool mode and back numerous times throughout the 25 minutes. Eventually it s so often that it takes much longer to dry our hair. However, I can t find any other dryers we like better. So I m stuck buying multiple dryers per year! Need to upgrade motor quality!!! I d pay $50 or more for exact dryer with better motor!!

postInfo: ['Reviewed in the United States on September 10, 2016']
text: Ergonomic Hair Dryer, Best for hair styling :: First thing to note is that this hair dryer fits very comfortably in the hand. Love the texture of the ceramic casing as it has a very soft smooth feel to it.The buttons are positioned very well as one finger can control a section of the blow dryer without having to slide your hand:Index finger controls the boost featureMiddle finger, temperature controls: cool, warm, hotPinky controls basic settings: off, low and highAs for the hair dryer itself, it's only good for styling and not for a quick blow dry after a shower. If you want the later I recommend purchasing the Reminton ProAir 1875 as it will dry your hair in seconds and ideal if you're a night shower person and want to get to bed quickly.Now back to the product at hand. All settings low, high, cool, warm and hot and very distinguishable and perfect for those who want the right temperature at specific sections of your hair. This is further helped by the two included attachments. I wish the two attachments are ceramic also, but unfortunately they're just plastic.The back of the hair dryer is removable for easy cleaning if there were some dust that are filtered through that section.Overall very good design for a hair dryer. postInfo: ['Reviewed in the United States on September 2, 2016']
text: Great hairdryer :: I own the Andis fold-n-Go and love it so when I was offered this hairdryer to review I gladly accepted it. This hairdryer is excellent but in case you are trying to decide between the two models I will somewhat compare them.Let's start with this one. The pro's are:1) It is lightweight at 21.25 ounces without any attachments2) The handle is slim and feels very comfortable in my hand, and actually makes it seem considerably lighter than the fold and go, due to being less bulky3) It is quiet for a hairdryer, and is quieter than the fold and go.4) It get's super hot super fast, for a very quick dry5) There is a distinct difference in temperature settings if you need that (hot, medium, cool).6) The fan settings, even when on low dries quickly (low, high)The negative of this model is the toggle settings. While I didn't accidentally switch them, I feel like it makes me hold it differently.How does this one compare to the fold-n-go?1) Well it is pretty much identical in weight and size (see attached picture).2) It is quieter and feels more comfortable in my hand.3)They both dry quickly and this one has different temperature setting with two fan settings, vs the fold-n-go which only has one temperature setting but three fan settings.4) This one seems to get hotter on the hot setting than the fold-n-go, but the fan is not as strong (hence why it is quieter).5) Obviously the fold-n-go folds up and stored the cord in the handle, which makes the handle bulkier.6 ) This one has toggle switches rather than slide switches. I personally strongly prefer the slide settings on the fold-n-go over the toggle settings on this oneThis is a really nice hair dryer and for me the only negative is the toggle switch, otherwise it offers more settings than the fold-n-go and dries just as quickly, with less noise.

postInfo: ['Reviewed in the United States on April 25, 2020']
text: Buttons get pushed accidentally :: Pros: Low noise. One of the quietest I've ever had.Con #1: When gripping the handle, I wrap my hand around it. I am forever making the toggle buttons switch their settings, often without even noticing. I just suddenly have warm air and not hot, etc. This happens all the time. The toggle switch is way too easy to move and the slightest bump switches it.Con #2: I've decided it's not my imagination. It tangles the ends of my hair. I think it has a cyclonic whipping around motion or something. I have long hair and turn my head upside down to dry. I have broken ends in the sink after brushing out the tangles. I switch to my old dryer and it doesn't happen.Con #3: The cord is VERY STIFF and doesn't want to change from the shape it had while folded up in the box. I can hardly get it to stretch long enough from the outlet to dry my hair. I'll try putting it outside on a hot day in the sun to see if it helps, but I have my doubts. It will probably still be too stiff, even if not as crinkled.

postInfo: ['Reviewed in the United States on May 8, 2019']
text: Very frustrating :: This hair dryer is ok, I have never had an issue with the attachment coming off so I wonder if some people are getting knock offs .. what my issue is and it s so annoying that I stopped drying my hair to write this , when u put on the low setting to blow out your hair it switches back and forth between high and low ... WHY ?! If I wanted it on high I would put on high ! So I have to wait for the high power to switch back to low before I continue. I would not purchase this one again

postInfo: ['Reviewed in the United States on April 2, 2015']
text: great wind force :: Bought 3/31/2015 elsewhere for $3 more ! I am male 70 yrs old, and have missed having a hair dryer around for multiple uses. Specifically picked this one to blow leaves from small garden of several plants with mulch bedding below. Want this forceful wind speed which does this job wonderfully. I will infrequently use for hair drying though, as hair rather short-does do fine job though, and short burst button for cool air anytime is nice if you feel your head is getting too hot, suddenly ! Max positions produce plenty heat and wind speed, although less setting might be better for other hair control options. Motor description appears great for long lasting use. End can easily pops off to brush screen filter, which worked great to brush off fine leaf dust particles after that use. Really light and easy to hold. I did not use any wind diffuser for additional wind force - just regular end worked fine for my little leaf blow job. After research online, this unit recommended often. Love it, and seems to fluff up my small amount of hair. no need to dry hair here in Florida before going outside, but used dryer often in Illinois bad weather. Even dried out engine parts, when got stuck from damp weather & car would not start. Anyway, just wanted to say about the great wind speed it has and great motor description. Try one !

postInfo: ['Reviewed in the United States on September 1, 2016']
text: At Last, a Hair Dryer That My Wife and I Both Like :: I am a guy with relatively short hair. I like a hair dryer that is relatively light and blows a lot warm, but not scalding hot, air. I turned the blower on this dryer on HI and temperature setting to WARM and this dryer fit my requirements perfectly.My wife, on the other hand, has longer hair and runs the fan on HI and the temperature setting on HOT and reported that she also really liked the dryer. It is lighter than the ceramic dryer she previously used which is Remington AC2015 T|Studio Salon Collection Pearl Ceramic Hair Dryer, Deep Purple. She likes the rubber like non-slip texture of the finish on this Andis dryer, since she frequently sets the running dryer down on the counter for a few seconds while grooming and drying her hair.We also like that the screen on the air intake grill is removable and can be taken off and easily cleaned. We use this dryer without either of the two attachments, a pick and concentrator. The bottom line is that this is the only hair dryer that each of us would consider our primary go to hair dryer and highly recommend it.

postInfo: ['Reviewed in the United States on September 20, 2016']
text: This is quiet and powerful. Not a bad dryer at all. :: This is a nice hair dryer for the price. Other users have commented that it isn't very hot. I didn't find this to be the case. It is plenty hot and if it were hotter, I can't imagine it would be good for your hair.The toggle style switches are a little bit of a pain, because they can be bumped when changing hands.The hottest setting is down, which is smart, because if was the coldest setting I would be constantly bumping the temperature down when switching hands. Although the toggle switches are easy to us, I find them a little frustrating because of how much I bump them.This has a good amount of power, and I feel my hair dries faster with it than with other dryers.I wish the loop for hanging it up was bigger. It works for a small hook, but not if you have a big wooden peg for a hook.Overall, I think it is decent for the price. It's quiet and powerful.

postInfo: ['Reviewed in the United States on September 1, 2016']
text: Average. :: Most of the time, I just let my hair curl, run my fingers through it and call it a day. Now and then, I have to blow dry to get out of the house in a hurry. To be honest, I rarely dry my own hair. I gave it a go today, because I wanted to give a review of the Andis Ceramic Tourmaline 1875 Watt Hair dryer. I do, however use a hairdryer often to blow dry my hairy dogs. I do tend to have hairy dogs. My last dryer is on it's last legs, so this seemed like a good item to try.This dried my short curly hair quickly, blowing out most of the curl. It isn't too heavy, and that's a plus. Who wants to be trying to hold a brick above your head for 20 minutes to blow dry. There is a nice comfortable grip. Big problem, short cord. That means I need to use an extention cord if I want to get all the way around my Newfoundland. Definitely not a plus.

postInfo: ['Reviewed in the United States on September 10, 2016']
text: My wife REALLY LIKES this hair dryer ! :: My wife REALLY LIKES this hair dryer. It has interchangeable nozzles to target the area you are drying or styling. The screen can be removed for easy cleaning. It is light and easy to handle, has responsive temperature control, and feels good ergonomically. She says her hair has less frizz and more body than with her old hair dryer. I used it to dry my short hair this morning, mainly because my wife pointed out that as a VINE Review I was supposed to try the product. My conclusion is that men with short hair can get the same results with a towel in about the same amount of time.Bottom Line - - - This hair dryer works very well on long hair without fatiguing the hand or arm.

postInfo: ['Reviewed in the United States on September 12, 2016']
text: Pretty for a Hairdryer! :: I needed a new hairdryer, ours would only work on the high setting! Straight out of the box, the Andis Ceramic is a nice rich suede black, it comes with two accessories...a pick and a concentrator (I never use these things) It is NOT as light as I thought it would be and its advertized as such, it has some weight to it, BUT its so soft and the handle is curved so it fits in my hand so comfortably. I have had issues in the past with poorly designed hairdryers that put all the buttons in a place where when I am drying my hair, I turn it off, turn it down or hit the "cold" button all the time. THIS one does not have that problem. The back comes off easily to clean the filter as well. BUT does it dry? IN RECORD TIME! it does, wow...does this leave my hair dry and not frizzy!

postInfo: ['Reviewed in the United States on September 22, 2016']
text: Nice, light, and balanced :: Hey it's a hair dryer. But a nice one. I've seen other reviews that it isn't as hot or powerful as some, but I find it dries well without overheating my hair. Perhaps that's one reason my hair feels good after using it.It would be nice if the cord retracted, but that's just a preference. Overall a great hair dryer.

postInfo: ['Reviewed in the United States on January 27, 2013']
text: Keep looking :: On the plus side, the dryer is light and fairly quiet.On the minus side, The dryer does not put out enough heat. If you switch it to high, it is equivalent to medium on a good dryer. Another thing that is a pain is the switches; they are reversed from what the rest of the industry has. Intuitively one would think that switching up would increase the heat or air volume. Instead they are just the opposite.I had my wife try it. She likes that it is lighter than her dryer but she says it is "wussy" - it does not have enough heat to dry her hair. It is OK for me (with short fine hair) but with her medium-length heavier hair it is a waste.Bottom line - keep looking.9/13 updateThe dryer has gotten very noisy. It sounds like the motor and fan have plastic bearings that quickly get loose and make more noise as time goes on. The switches for heat and fan are counter intuitive. They are reversed, like turning on a light in your house by flipping the switch down.Don't bother with this one.

postInfo: ['Reviewed in the United States on January 8, 2020']
text: Not for personal use... :: I like the way this dryer looked, it's fairly quiet and does the job BUT if you are purchasing this for personal use, BUYER BEWARE. I have found that the handle on this dryer is meant to be held as though you are drying someone else's hair, not your own. I bought this for personal use and it is VERY uncomfortable to hold. When you are drying your own hair, you naturally need to hold the dryer at more of an angle with your hand more to the side of the handle. It is nearly impossible to keep the dryer from slipping into a straight position, which then is pointing away from your hair. The dryer itself has a slick black surface and to make matters worse, the buttons are the ones that flip, not flat ones that slide. I have yet to dry my hair without my hand slipping onto these buttons, constantly turning the dryer off. There is nothing to brace your fingers onto to keep it steady so the whole time you are fighting the drying angle while trying to avoid the buttons. It s a terrible design for personal use and for the price, I would not recommend it at all. I am going to try putting some grip tape on the sides to see if it helps but I seriously doubt I keep it.

postInfo: ['Reviewed in the United States on August 31, 2016']
text: Works well. Comfortable to use. Switches seem "upside down". :: Best features are that this dryer is relatively lightweight and quiet compared to other dryers. Other plus features include: Ionic, tourmaline, and ceramic technologies (claim to promote faster drying, frizz control, and better styling hold). I like the soft touch feel. A removable, cleanable filter cap. 1875 watts.The controls are like those of my other dryers: a coldshot button, a three level heat selector, and two speed fan selector. A do note that (as another reviewer described this arrangement), the switch selection arrangement is counterintuitive compared to other products and models I'm used to -- The fan "Off" position is full up. The heat "Hot" selection is full down. It's opposite of what I'm used to but I image I'll adapt.Finally - have you noticed that other dryers are promoting their AC motors. That is because that design lasts longer (or theoretically it should). This one has a DC motor. The upside is that it's lightweight and powerful. The downside is that DC motors are more likely to die a spark-filled early death than their AC counterparts. I'll concede this dryer does have a 5 year warranty (but I hate making warranty claims on small inexpensive appliances).Includes pick and concentrator nozzle attachments.

postInfo: ['Reviewed in the United States on October 16, 2016']
text: A relatively quiet and light hair dryer :: The Andis Ceramic Tourmaline 1875 Watt Hair Dryer has a black matte finish that feels smooth and cool to the touch. We were satisfied with the dryer output in heat and air. As hair dryers go, it feels light, but a cord will always feel like a drag on the weight. A big plus is that it is relatively quiet, around 59/60 dB, with the measurement taken by the ears of the one whose hair is being dried. That s the equivalent of normal conversation; compare that to the reading on our previous dryer of 65/66 dB. (That might not seem like much of a difference, but 60 dB is half as loud as 70 dB.) Of course, the noise level may change over time as the machine gets older. We didn't find the black plastic extensions very useful.Overall, this Andis hair dryer is a good product, one that we would recommend without reservation.

postInfo: ['Reviewed in the United States on September 1, 2016']
text: does a great job of drying hair without too much heat :: Okay, first, am impressed with how light this thing is. Second, how it doesn't seem to fry my hair. Third? How fast it dried my hair. Considering that I dye and bleach my hair for coloring effects... yeah, those last two are very important. This really worked well to help dry my hair without appearing to do much damage to it, which is fantastic. Didn't notice much of a problem with the cord, and there's two attachments, one with a comb nozzle (honestly, can't figure out how to use it) and another nozzle that worked better with the round brush.New favorite hair dryer.

postInfo: ['Reviewed in the United States on January 18, 2017']
text: It has a nice ergonomic feel and is fairly light :: This is a decent hair dryer. It is quiet, it works relatively well, though it is probably a bit underpowered in comparison to its (louder) competitors. It has a nice ergonomic feel and is fairly light, making it easy to work with. Sadly the attachments aren't as easy to work with as they continually fall off and are generally useless. If I cared more about the attachments, that would likely make my rating go down.All in all, it is a perfectly nice hair dryer for a reasonable price. It is a good everyday item.

postInfo: ['Reviewed in the United States on September 4, 2016']
text: Best of the new fashioned dryers :: I still like my old fashioned hand held hair dryers with an attached comb or brush to dry out my hair as the dryer blows. The new style dryers shaped like this one just blow and the last ionic dryer I had got hot as a stove top. This one works fine for me and I like the pick that acts as a comb (somewhat).This is also not heavy as my other ionic dryer was and it is quiet where other dryers that have been made in recent years sound like miniature jet engines.So for the new style hair dryers for this old fashioned lady this one is fine.

postInfo: ['Reviewed in the United States on September 12, 2016']
text: Attractive but not powerful :: I am not absolutely thrilled with this dryer. It is quiet, but not as strong/powerful as I would like it to be. Seems to take me longer to do a normal hair dry when compared to my previous dryer (Remington). On the plus side, it is attractive/modern and looks great on my vanity. It fits well in my hand (ergonomic) and as I mentioned runs quietly. I think this would be best for a person with shorter/thinner hair. But, with my thicker shoulder length hair, I am returning to my previous dryer and moving this into the guest bathroom.

postInfo: ['Reviewed in the United States on September 11, 2016']
text: Excellent as a travel companion :: Excellent dryer for home and travel use because of its size and very light weight. You get 2 speeds and 3 heat settings. Actually, the velocity of this dryer is impressive, and it provides 40% more airflow than conventional hair dryers.This product has a companion app (surprise! what would you need it, though??), an outstanding 5-year warranty, and it is made in China.For this price, this is a no-brainer. Get it!

postInfo: ['Reviewed in the United States on September 23, 2016']
text: Dries hair faster, just like it says :: The Andis Pro Dry boasts the three magic words in hair-drying technology ionic, tourmaline, and ceramic all aimed at drying your hair faster and with smoother results (less frizz). This unit also features a high velocity, hyper DC motor that, according to the box, generates 40% more airflow than a regular dryer. I definitely think this product dries my hair a few minutes faster than my previous hair dryer, so that s a huge bonus in my book. It s also lightweight and relatively quiet. I was surprised to feel a stream of cool air escaping from the base of the unit, where the cord attaches. It s not bothersome but I wasn t expecting it. The Andis Pro Dry comes with two attachments, a pick and a concentrator. Heat settings include cool, warm, and hot along with a cool blast button that turns the hot air cold for as long as you push it, setting your style. I would recommend this product to anyone who s looking for a well-designed and powerful hair dryer for everyday use.

postInfo: ['Reviewed in the United States on June 11, 2020']
text: Worked Great for Four Uses and then Died :: Got this hairdryer to use with my little 3 lb Yorkie. I didn t use it initially when I first received it, so it sat in the box for the first 30+ days. When I finally did use it, it worked great. On the fourth use, the dryer no longer would turn on. I pushed every button, plugged it in into different receptacles, I could not get it to turn back on. Bad part is it was outside the time you could return it, so I had to get another one.Understand, this dryer worked good up to that point.This dryer is light, colorful and compact. It did a great job drying. It was a bit loud, so my little Yorkie was terrified. This dryer has two heat settings. The first is a cool heat and the second is hotter. Believe me, this hot setting will burn you if you keep the dryer still. No problem if you keep the dryer moving back and forth. Point is, this dryer has plenty of power to dry your hair. Price wise, it was worth the money if it worked past the fourth use.

postInfo: ['Reviewed in the United States on June 26, 2019']
text: Works great, love the size! But is too powerful to use in Europe :: This is a great size and works very well in the US. Perfect for saving space when traveling. It is powerful enough to dry my hair in a timely manner. Only problem was I bought it for a tour in Europe and it was too powerful for the outlets. The coils turned bright red immediately and smelled like smoke, so I turned off immediately and did not try again. This is not the manufacturers fault tho, it is a good hair dryer in the US. Just good to know if anyone is buying for a trip to Europe. Luckily, all the hotels we stayed in had hairdryers. I only bought this because we stayed at 5 different hotels and I was afraid some might not have them. But I will still use for US travel!

postInfo: ['Reviewed in the United States on December 16, 2018']
text: Far Infrared and Ionic Technology :: I received this JINRI SALON DRYER in exchange for my honest review. Let me start by saying I currently have a Baby Bliss salon hair dryer and have owned or used other salon brand such as Chi and Paul Mitchell. In comparison the JINRI SALON DRYER is much heavier but in all fairness the other brands do not have the FAR INFRARED Technology. The dryer does exactly what it claims to do! I take care of a women with Alzheimer's and the fact that I can dry her hair in have the time is beyond fantastic. I Love that we can get her hair dry now before shes ready to be done with the entire beautification situation! As for the other reviews talking about the controls on the handle easily being changed such as turning of the dryer or changing the heat settings, I did have this happen the first time using it but I did not find it difficult to adjust the way my hand holds the dryer to be able to use it successfully.

postInfo: ['Reviewed in the United States on November 16, 2019']
text: Great 1875W hair dryer! :: My favorite hair dryer was slowly dying so i decided to give this one a try. I have long, fine hair but i have a lot of it. I look for very specific things in a hair dryer: 1875W, multiple speeds and heat levels and cold shot. I always want one that isn't going to eat my hair lol So far, this one is great! It took me a few uses to get used to location of the heat and speed controls but that's everytime I get a new dryer because they are all different.This did dry my hair fast but didn't make it a frizzy flat mess like some fast dry hair dryers do. The infared light is a neat addition. Overall, it's a very nice hair dryer for the price and size.

postInfo: ['Reviewed in the United States on October 17, 2018']
text: If my wife is happy I'm happy :: So the other morning my wife's hair dryer finally broke down. of course with my credit card in hand I told her wait let me shop around and find something you may like at a reasonable price. I looked at wattage and features and came across Jinri brand. It was not a household name however I had all the features that my wife's old dryer had plus some more. after a few weeks of use she loves it and her hair is dry static-free. I'm happy because I saved myself probably 40 to $60. Would buy again

text: Worth the price :: The temp can get really hot but only if you have it on highs and since my hair is kinky I prefer it this way. My only issue is the buttons. postInfo: ['Reviewed in the United States on April 18, 2019']
text: Reliable and high quality :: I ve had several hair dryers before and have always searched for one that would perform like those in a salon- quick drying, light weight and safe on my hair. This product has proved to be all of the above. My dry time has been drastically cut down and I don t feel like I m damaging my hair in the process.This hair dryer has a blue light on the top indicating that it is on, and an infrared light inside of the hairdryer indicating that the heat setting is on, which I find very helpful and just love the look of it. Some times, even with other brands I would not realize I was holding down the cold button, so this infrared light helps me make sure I m not doing so. The color is a matte black which I find very pleasing. It comes with several attachments that suit any drying style. Lastly there is a nice Velcro strap that keeps the cord wrapped up nicely. I would highly recommend this hair dryer.

postInfo: ['Reviewed in the United States on December 4, 2018']
text: Blows air :: It's a good blow dryer. Does what it should. Control buttons are a bit harder to maneuver than my last one (toggle as opposed to slide)My only real comment about this is that I was EXTREMELY alarmed when I turned it on for the first time: it has a bright orange LED INSIDE the chamber, and I thought it had caught fire. Why do we need this? The blue light on top is good enough to let me know it's on...but also the fact that it makes a hair dryer noise and blows hot air is a good indication as well. Sorry, but the orange light inside the nozzle is insane. Design fail. Face-palm. What were they thinking?I mean, MAYBE if the color changed to blue when you push the cool button it might make sense? As it is, it's hard to get used to.

postInfo: ['Reviewed in the United States on January 9, 2020']
text: Very lightweight, lives up to it's claims :: I believe in transparency but I hope you will keep in mind 2 things when reading my review. First, if you look at my profile and my other reviews, you will see I have never reviewed an item for any incentive before. I'm not one of those Vine reviewers who always says something is great because they got it for free and you get it and it's garbage. Second, you will see I rate items honestly. If it's garbage, I will say so, if it's great I'll say so.Ok, now to the point. I did have to buy this item first. I have shelled out my own money and will not get reimbursed until after I review. I get my money back regardless of my review so I have nothing to lose. That being said, this hair dryer actually lived up to it's reputation. I've had it for a little over a week now and use it every day. I am at an age where hormones are wreaking havoc on my hair and I have to wash it every day. That means drying every day.What I noticed right out of the box is how lightweight this dryer is. It has a silicon type feel so it's not slippery hard plastic. That means it's easy to grip and won't crack. Next, the buttons are sideways so while gripping to dry, you won't accidentally change your settings. The accessories actually snap in and they work! My current dryer has accessories but they often don't fit right and really don't work, especially the diffuser. This diffuser works incredibly well and I don't even have super curly hair! It helped my sad waves and gave my hair body and volume, something I sorely need now that my hair is thinning. :(Regarding the claim of drying faster. I would say yes, a bit faster for sure but the more important thing is healthier. I can use a lower heat and airflow setting with this dryer and yet still finish in slightly faster time than my old Revlon dryer. What is the best is it isn't making my hair fly away! With my current dryer I can have static on a seriously rainy day. That is not cool. With this one, no static. Not on rainy days and not on dry winter days. That's HUGE!Lastly, I believe this dryer has been much healthier for my hair. The ends don't feel as dry, my hair definitely lays smoother, no flyaways, no frying, just silky soft.So, I didn't have to leave a positive review but I am happy to do so. I believe in giving credit where it is due. If something happens to this dryer and it burns out long before it should or whatever, I will update this review. I do follow up my reviews if necessary.If you need a dryer, give this one a whirl. It's a great product at a fantastic price. I would definitely say it performs as good as the ones my hair stylists use.

postInfo: ['Reviewed in the United States on May 3, 2019']
text: I'm impressed :: Let me start off with saying, this blow dryer blows... Like no blow dryer I've ever owned. It seriously dries your hair super fast. I was a little put off by the bright light that omits from it, but I believe that's why it dries your hair so fast. I'm not versed in the whole science behind it. I chose this brand because I had bought their straight iron and after looking around for a new blow dryer because mine was throwing sparks (yikes!!!), I figured what did I have to lose? The cord is nice and long. The unit itself is heavier than my old dryer, but feels solid, quality. It came with these attachments, but, I haven't tried them to see what fun they do. It has a cool button, highs and lows on both temperature and speed. Overall, I really like this dryer. But don't take my word for it, try it! I recommend!

postInfo: ['Reviewed in the United States on December 31, 2019']
text: Much better than a standard hair dryer :: I am pleased with my purchase.This dryer is extremely powerful compared to my old hair dryer. It is rated the same 1875 W, but it is much more powerful and delivers a much better range of heat and coolness. The dryer is easy to use and the matte finish feels nice and smooth. postInfo: ['Reviewed in the United States on December 6, 2019']
text: Does the job, but nothing fancy. :: I was a little disappointed with this dryer. It had great reviews and fancy features (an infrared light) so I thought it would do something more amazing than the standard Conair & Revlon dryers I was buying at Walmart but alas, it turns out it's just a regular dryer. postInfo: ['Reviewed in the United States on January 29, 2020']
text: Super disappointed :: I bought this product because I needed a hair dryer with attachments so that I could straighten my hair and because of the great reviews it had. Unfortunately, I don't love it. The attachments fall of CONSTANTLY. Plus, they get really hot, so when they DO fall off and blow across the room, when you pick them up and put them back on they are scalding hot and burn your hand. It sucks. Also, all the setting buttons are switches on the handle. The handle that you hold. So, it is super easy to turn it off by accident while you are holding it. Yeah, that happens a lot. I am super disappointed.

postInfo: ['Reviewed in the United States on January 7, 2020']
text: Powerful hair dryer! :: Bought this one for our second bathroom because we had guests staying over for the holiday and I was tired moving the one we have in the master bathroom back and forth.I have to say I wasn't expecting much at this price range even though it had many good reviews but was pleasantly surprised at the quality and how fast it gets the job done. It wasn't very big so while you cannot fold it,I wouldn't mind taking it on trips with me if needed. The output of the air is also very strong when it is set to high..I would say this dries my hair in less time than my fancy Panasonic one..I now preferred this one over the other one because it gets the job done quicker.Definitely would recommend this one and buy another one if I need more than 2 around the house.

postInfo: ['Reviewed in the United States on May 31, 2019']
text: Decent blow dryer. :: This blow dryer blows pretty strongly. It does dry faster however it kind makes my hair frizz out a lot more than normal. Aside from that little bit the dryer is loud which doesn't bug me. It is heavy though.All in all I would give this blow-dryer a 6 out if 10. It is nice to have for my daughter who absolutely hates how long it takes to blow her hair dry. So that's a plus that it is like a jet engine and gets the job done in less time.

postInfo: ['Reviewed in the United States on February 18, 2020']
text: Salon Approved! 100% :: This hair dryer is amazing and that s coming from a guy. Let me tell you, when something says salon approved it really is. I would say this equipment is very professional and I would recommend for your daily hair needs.PROS:-Dries your hair super quick, just like a salon-Multiple switches, to control different options-The attachments are amazing she says!CONS:-I wish it had more attachmentsOverall, I can say this is a product I can recommend and I don t recommend every product. postInfo: ['Reviewed in the United States on January 8, 2020']
text: I would purchase again! :: I ve been really pleased with this purchase. I needed a hair dryer with a diffuser that would stay on. My last diffuser just kept falling off. postInfo: ['Reviewed in the United States on May 31, 2019']
text: Great dryer :: I was sent this hair dryer to give my honest review . I have to say I am thankful to get this .. I have been wanting a dryer with a diffuser for a while now. postInfo: ['Reviewed in the United States on January 24, 2020']
text: No More Wet Heads! :: I was excited for my new hair dryer to arrive. I looked around for awhile before I settled on this 1875W Salon Dryer by Jinri Paris Professional. I love that it comes with the 3 different attachments, has speed and temperature settings, and a cold shot button. This hair dryer has a heavy duty 9ft cord complete with a hanging hook and a Velcro wrap to keep the cord together for traveling or storing. This dried my long hair in no time at all. I did find a few things that I wasn't 100% thrilled about. This unit is a little bit heavier than I would like and it takes some elbow grease to get the attachments on and off of the dryer. All in all this is a quality hair dryer that should be found in every home.

postInfo: ['Reviewed in the United States on January 4, 2020']
text: Perfect Sized Dryer For All The Curly Girls Out There :: Love the size of this dryer, especially with my very large black orchard diffuser!! So I just HAD to have the expensive brand name dryer that goes with the diffuser, but of course I ended up loving/hating it!! Lol I really wanted to find a dryer with comparable features & quality, just in a smaller more comfortable to use size. This professional salon hair dryer absolutely NAILED IT!!!It is the perfect size with all the same features I loved such as a powerful 1875W motor, 3 heat & 2 speed settings, negative ion technology, multiple attachments, & cool shot button. With the size/weight of this dryer, I'm able to completely dry my hair without my arms feeling like they're gonna fall off!! The difference it makes just not having to hold my arms awkwardly so far away from my head is crazy!!I also tried the diffuser that came with it, and if I didn't already have my other one I wouldn't mind at all. It's a good size diffuser and worked great on my curls. Honestly, my hair looked the exact same with both diffusers!!I'm sure it's just as comfortable with the other attachments for all other hair types. So if you're looking for a dryer with brand name quality that doesn't hurt your arms you won't be disappointed!!(I attached photos of both dryers/ diffusers for reference & size comparison)

postInfo: ['Reviewed in the United States on January 16, 2020']
text: Right buy at the right price :: I ve been wanting a new blow dryer. I think I had my previous dryer around 20 years. There was nothing wrong with it, but it was just old and gross.The flip side is that I rarely blow dry my hair, but when I do, I want something lightweight and quick. So I didn t want to spend a lot on something I might use once a quarter.Would I take it for travel? Probably not. It s a little big, plus most hotels have them in the room. I already overpack as it is.A friend of mine recommended this blow dryer, and I m so happy she did. I have used it once, and worked just like I hoped. It was the right buy at the right price for me.

postInfo: ['Reviewed in the United States on January 6, 2020']
text: Quality dryer at a reasonable cost! :: I was previously using a VERY old dryer and was looking for something to speed up the process of drying my thick, wavy hair. When I'm not in a hurry I like to use medium or low, just to keep my hair from becoming dried out or brittle. If I'm in a hurry though, it gets hot quickly and definitely takes less time than my old dryer. My favorite attachment is the diffuser, which works well to keep my waves defined and not frizzy looking! If you are in the market for a versatile hair dryer, without breaking the bank, I'd definitely say give this one a try!

postInfo: ['Reviewed in the United States on November 4, 2018']

postInfo: ['Reviewed in the United States on February 20, 2020']

postInfo: ['Reviewed in the United States on January 13, 2020']
text: Dries hair quickly with less frizz! :: LOVE MY JINRI 1875W PROFESSIONAL SALON DRYER ! I have curly/wavy thick hair. I like to blow out my hair but it usually takes a very long time. postInfo: ['Reviewed in the United States on January 30, 2020']

postInfo: ['Reviewed in the United States on February 7, 2020']

postInfo: ['Reviewed in the United States on January 20, 2020']
text: It'll Blow Your Mind..and never burn a hair on your head. :: Ok, in all reality, to be completely honest here, off top I really didn't think itd be worth spending 1/3 of a days pay on a blow dryer. Seriously. But, it wasn't for me, and the thought of ruining a woman's birthday with the thought of damaged or burned hair ISNT something ANY guy should take lightly. So, when I compared the cost of this JINRI 1875W Hair dryer to the other name brands ive heard of before, it suddenly wasn't so expensive afterall. (She swore it was over 150 after her first time using it though). To quote "OMG!!! This thing HAD to cost at least $150, At Least! I mean, this babys working waaaay better than my Chi & I paid close to 150. I Love It! Where did you get this from? Don't tell me, this is one that those hairstylists use for the moviestars and big time Hollywood girls isnt it!" I watched her dry that semi-coarse, curly, "not just anybody can touch my hair" hair, and not one time was this dryer put down, or touched to see how hot it was. Before using her Chi, was the Revlon, that constantly got too hot and damaged her hair. I would literally see strands of hair with quarter to half an inch split ends when she finished straightening with that old blow dryer. So, when the Chi was bought, out went the other as fast as garbage on trash day. (& That's where it went too) I'm glad that I bought the JINRI because its dried her hair at the roots, WITHOUT DAMAGING it, and apparently thats something that was impossible to do with the old really cheap blow dryer. "My Chi wont even do this good without burning my scalp a little". I didn't believe her, so she pointed the JINRI at my head (my head's close shaved) and said "I'll prove it". It stayed aimed in the exact place on the hottest setting as i clenched in preparation for a scolding. It never got too hot to withstand. IM VERY IMPRESSED!!! She has relaxers every 2 months from the salon, so straight (or at least manageable) roots for the whole 8 weeks is mandatory. This dryer has made her hair so soft, that even I can't stop trying to run my fingers through it. A few days later, I see the Chi become the Revlon. I asked if it was broken or something. Her reply, "Nope, its just that now when I wash my hair I don't hate drying n straightening it cause my hair doesnt feel "hard" or dry since Ive been using that new high class probably cost a quarter grand hairdryer u got me." She's glad she TRIED it. I'm LUCKY it didn't hurt one strand on her head. postInfo: ['Reviewed in the United States on January 6, 2020']
text: Professional quality infrared hair dryer! Not your mother's hair dryer! :: I've been on the hunt for a new higher end professional hair dryer and this one exceeds my expectations.-First of all, it came packaged nicely to protect the box (if you were giving it as a gift, this is greatly helpful). It also has multiple attachments. The standard concentrator is to focus on one area of hair, but it also includes a straightening comb and a diffuser like my hair dresser uses. I will comment that the attachments are a bit tight, and take some pressing force to get them on and a bit of brut strength to pull them off. However, I suspect they will losen in time. My last hair dryer, the attachment failed to fit after time, so I prefer these are bit on the tight side, as they will "stay put" for years to come. So, I see this as a bonus, provided they losen in time, as I suspect.-The hair dryer itself is a matte black finish and looks expensive like a high end salon expensive dryer! oh la la!-Next, the mechanics of the dryer are fantastic. It is not loud like my old dryer and it heats up quickly and dries twice as fast. The box even says 50% faster, so I timed it with my old one that I know always takes me 11 minute, this literally was less than half that at 5.25 minutes!-It has 7 settings: 3 heat (low, medium, hight) and 3 velocity (low, medium, high) and a cool button. The buttons are easy to use and in the correct position for 1 handed styling.This dryer is truly a stand out. I know "it's just a hair dryer" you are saying to yourself, but this is one of the best hair dryers I've ever used.

postInfo: ['Reviewed in the United States on December 29, 2019']

Annoying.)Original review: Jan 2020.This is a good hair dryer. It dries really fast, works great for straightening your hair, and comes with various attachments. postInfo: ['Reviewed in the United States on January 8, 2020']
text: Beautiful Hair Dyer :: This is a really nice hair dryer. New to the infrared technology as my old (now dead) dryer was 10+ years old. I do have fine hair so it has always dried quickly, but I find it to dry much faster with this hair dryer and it definitely has noticeably less frizz afterwards! The dryer itself is really soft to the touch. I like whatever material they used on the housing. Really nice. It did come with the 3 attachments, but I have straight, fine hair so I have zero use for the diffuser. However, I really love the comb option. It helps to detangle and smooth while I dry my hair. It also acts as concentrator, blowing the air in a concentrated stream, so I don't need to switch attachments. I just wish it had a soft plastic coating because the ends of the comb scratch if it hits your neck or where ever. The way I use the comb is by holding the nozzle of the dryer, flipping my head over, and combing through the back of my hair. This helps to give volume too! Would highly recommend!

postInfo: ['Reviewed in the United States on February 26, 2020']
text: Great for curly hair! :: This is a nice, mid size hair dryer. postInfo: ['Reviewed in the United States on January 25, 2020']
text: Leaves hair soft and silky :: I never use a blow dryer because it makes my hair look like garbage - little stray whisps at every length looking like I have the most damaged hair when in fact it looks great if I let it air dry or put in a wet bun to dry. I gave up. So when offered by JNRI (via Instagram) this dryer free for my honest review I thought, "why not". Well folks, I finally have a hair dryer that makes me hair look NICE. As though I just went to the salon. It dries quickly and my hair feels so soft and luxurious, I didn't know a hair dryer could DO that. My sister has a super expensive Conair one and even that makes my hair look like garbage. I tried both with and without the shave heat protective spray and same beautiful results. I'm only putting 4 stars because the buttons are black and are positioned different than I'm used to - they are not obvious as to what they control upon first glance, and there is a light inside is red or red orange when it is running.... Which brings me to this: let me first say idk how to tell if something is using infrared tech, or what that even means for my hair, but I do know infrared is invisible to the human eye, so is the red LED a gimmick? I wouldn't know. But it does leave my hair nicer than anything else I've ever used in my years on Earth and still shocked my hair FEELS so nice. Something is working here. For the price and how well it works, I would highly recommend to anyone especially if they have struggled with hair dryers.P.S. also lightweight, not heavy and tiring. And the texture of the dryer is velvety so it even feels nice to touch and hold.

postInfo: ['Reviewed in the United States on January 2, 2018']
text: decent dryer for the price :: I had another Remington dryer that finally died after 5 years of daily use. This one seemed similar so I thought I'd give it a try. It is lighter than the one I had before, which is nice. I noticed it doesn't get as hot as my old one though, even when I turn it to the highest heat setting. My hair is fine and wavy/curly so that actually works out for me. I use the diffuser attachment and it snapped onto the end of the dryer with a satisfying click. It seems like it will stay on with no issues. The sound isn't too loud. I think it's a fine dryer for the price, but if you have long or thick hair, you might need something a little more powerful.**EDIT: After using this for a week, I decided to order a different dryer. This thing just does not get hot enough. I'm spending a lot more time drying my chin-length hair than I would with my old dryer and I'm still walking about of the bathroom with an almost wet head. The temperature switch does almost nothing between cool, warm, and hot. The low fan speed is too low and high is too much. My hair has been feathery and weird all week. I only spent $11 on this, so I'm going to keep it as a backup dryer.

text: Not for Curly Girls :: I have used this hair blower regularly for about 10 months.Pro's:+multiple fan & heat speeds so I can get what I need+love the purple color+comes with a diffuser (the only way I'd use a hair blower to dry my curly hair)Con's:-the diffuser doesn't have much to screw onto the blower so it now (10 months later) falls off very easily._____________The Bottom Line_____________For general use, this is a great hair blower. If I was to buy a hair blower again, however, I would not get this one. I'm a curly girl who needs a good diffuser. I'd look for a diffuser that had a stronger attaching point to the blower (my old blower's diffuser slid on with about an inch of overlap that never gave me trouble).

postInfo: ['Reviewed in the United States on March 3, 2018']
text: not a good dryer :: Had my last dryer, a Revlon, for three years which I think is fine for low-priced dryers. I don't know why I gave the Remington a shot when I love the Revlon. The Remington gives inadequate heat and has poorly positioned buttons. My hair is normally soft and shiny, fine with nice volume -- this dryer took forever to dry even though I use an accelerator, and when it finally dried (using the same products I always do) this "damage control" dryer created damage! For the first time I now have little broken hairs on top of my head!. Never before has a blow dryer done that to my hair. Another Revlon 1875 volumizing turbo will be here tomorrow, and I can't wait. I would not even blow my hair with the Remington yesterday or today. It's not worth the energy to return. Lesson leanred: Stick with what I love.
