postInfo: ['Reviewed in the United States on January 5, 2015']
text: GOTTA HAVE THIS ONE! :: It's hard to believe a hair dryer could make a big difference but this one absolutely DOES. I'm sooo thrilled with it! My kinky/curly fine/thin hair has dried much faster than usual (even though it's the same wattage as my previous dryer) and so smooth, soft, shiny and healthy looking (getting that without a flat iron also means that it gets to stay fluffier looking instead of flat and stringy). -- I found it cheaper at Walmart, but it says it's a LIMITED EDITION so if you can't get it there, get it here. But GET IT -- it's great!One thing I have to have on my driers is separate controls for the heat and for the air - this does - and it has the cool shot button as well. The really nice thing if you use the end attachment that condenses the direction of the air flow, is that this dryer has a round end (not oval) so you can turn the attachment when you need to instead of holding your arm/wrist in awkward positions to blow at a certain angle. Yes!What this Amazon site does NOT show you is all the info on the side of the box, so I'll take a minute and copy it down here for you.MICRO-CONDITIONERS: Get smoother, healthier hair. Say good-bye to heat damage and say hello to an enhanced healthy shine! This specially designed dryer features a grill that is infused with microscopic conditioners. These micro-conditioners release into the dryer air flow, and are transferred to your hair, helping to prevent damage and increase shine and hair health.IONIC TECHNOLOGY: Negative ions are activated by the heat of the dryer to heal heat damaged hair as you style. The ions reduce drying time and infuse vital moisture into the hair, resulting in reduced frizz and static.CERAMIC TECHNOLOGY: Infrared heat is produced by the ceramic coated grill to help prevent damage to the hair and allows for faster drying time.TOURMALINE TECHNOLOGY: This semiprecious gemstone works in conjunction with the ceramic technology of this dryer, producing far-infrared energy which protects the hair cuticle from over-heating, preventing brittleness and cracking.What else do you need to know -- it honestly does what it says - and I LOVE IT! Get one while you can!

text: Magic Brush :: I was persuaded to buy this brush by the reviews from white mothers of mixed race children. I care for my two and four year old mixed race granddaughters, and I am not very good at combing their hair. When this brush arrived, I told them it was a magic brush that wouldn t hurt, to persuade them to let me comb their hair without a bribe. The effect was amazing. The four your old insisted that she and her sister both get big hair, and danced around the room singing, Oh yeah! We look like movie stars! No tears at all from the older girl, and only a small complaint from the younger one, who has tighter curls. The next day, they asked their mom to use the magic brush, too. So it s a success. It doesn t fix every hair-combing problem they are still little girls but it virtually eliminates one of the toughest.

postInfo: ['Reviewed in the United States on April 2, 2020']
text: The BEST diffuser for a curly girl! :: I usually don't write reviews, but this is the absolute best product I have bought on Amazon. If you have wavy or curly hair, you need this hair dryer! I have 2b-3a waves and curls, and so I wanted to get a diffuser because my low porosity hair takes FOREVER to dry. I spent hours researching what the best hair dryer was, and what diffuser attachment I should buy. I was pretty skeptical when buying this product because you receive the hair dryer AND two attachments for under $20. There are two speeds and three levels of heat, and the "cool shot" option. This hair dryer has cut down my drying time drastically, and my curls are much more defined and shiny, (when I use the right hair gels/mousses). The only problem I encountered with this dryer was that the diffuser was a little difficult to secure on, but it hasn't budged at all since I got it. Other diffusers left my hair frizzy and damaged, but the air flow on this one is incredible. I have used this dryer multiple times and it shows no sign of wear, and it continues to work amazing! This is a MAJOR GAME CHANGER if you want to wear your hair curly!!!

postInfo: ['Reviewed in the United States on June 4, 2019']
text: SUPER SCIENTIFIC DEVICE! :: Hi there.Always nice to report another Amazon winner after many recent returns for devices not-as-advertised and some having failed within days and even hours after use.Initially I thought, here we go again with another dryer that super-performs at all high-settings but flops when reducing the air-flow which also reduces the temperature on high-heat setting.Parallel to the 1st. law of Thermodynamics, blow-by heat should become more concentrated & thus intense with lower / laminar flow.On all high-settings, this unit dried, relaxed, silkened & firm-set my leave-in conditioner dampened hair quicker than I could brush through all of it while wet.Also, it produced a bit more heat with low flow than the one I returned. Therefore, I decided to retain & try it on all settings as I did with the previous unit.AMAZINGLY & unlike the dryer I returned, it very-quickly imparts - relaxation, silkiness & varying degrees of set via flow selected even-though the air-flow seems to be lukewarm @ best on lower settings... EXTREMELY IMPRESSIVE!

postInfo: ['Reviewed in the United States on December 6, 2016']
text: HOT = Warm & WARM = Lukewarm :: This is basically a very good hairdryer for the price. I like the two speeds and usually use the lower speed when drying my curly hair with the diffuser which works well. However, the highest heat setting, I assume is "High Heat", is no more than warm air, and the next setting for "Low Heat" is lukewarm air at best. It's okay by me because I guess my hair won't get fried as it might at a higher temperature, but if you need HOT or 'High Heat" to dry your hair, you might need to look elsewhere for a different hairdryer.

postInfo: ['Reviewed in the United States on June 20, 2016']
text: New to using hairdryers? This might be the one for you! :: I'm a newbie when it comes to hairdryers. I just shopped around amazon to see what looked good and this one does the job nicely! This is my first hairdryer and it takes me about 10 minutes to completely dry my hair with it. I have very thick shoulder length hair. I travel a lot and this fits in my luggage with no hassle. It has your basic options of hot/cold air with low, medium, high settings. Simple and the purple color is lovely.Does it do what it says? Yes. Dries my hair and doesn't make it frizzy.How hot does it get? Not very hot; I can almost always store it right after using it since it doesn't get really hot.How loud is it ? It's pretty loud, but I live in a dorm so anything in a dorm sounds 100 times worse. However, on the medium and low settings its not loud at all.Travel Friendly? I'd say so. I've seen smaller hair dryers but this one fits in my carry-on, too.

postInfo: ['Reviewed in the United States on December 12, 2015']
text: Great Dryer in this price range. :: Remington D3190A Damage Control Ceramic Hairdryer: I have had this about a week and have medium length, think and curly hair. So far I like this, except that the heat difference between medium and hot is too great. The medium just feels a bit warmer than the cold, and the hot is too hot to stand direct contact. It does a nice job with both the concentrator and diffuser on medium heat and my hair turns out great. I just takes a little longer. It is a little heavier than some other models, but it feels sturdy and I am hoping it will hold up. I have purchased 4 blow dryers this year (other brand) so far and all have broken within a couple months. Some reviews have complained that the buttons are too easily hit while using, changing the settings. I have not experienced and would have to be gripping it very hard, then move my hand to make one of these switch. The attachments take a little to figure out how to put on, but I am getting used to it. Overall I am pleased.The only reason for the 4 stars is the lack of heat in the medium setting.

postInfo: ['Reviewed in the United States on September 29, 2017']
text: Doesn't Do What I Expected :: I am kind of disappointed in this hair dryer. I gave it 3-stars because it is only "OK". I had an old hair dryer that I purchased a long, long time ago that had more air flow and dried faster than this one (and the old one didn't seem to harm my hair either). I feel like digging that old blow dryer out from wherever I put it and start using it again, instead of this Remington! The Remington doesn't have the air flow strength that I was used to, so even though I have fine hair, it takes longer to dry it with this product. I can't tell the difference in hair quality between my old one and this one, which states it provides damage control. It is not that this is a bad product, it just didn't meet the quality criteria I had expected.

postInfo: ['Reviewed in the United States on December 29, 2016']
text: Not what is claims! :: The power and noise are ok. Blows a lot and is not a noisy hair dryer like others in the market. I am a fan of a Remington Brand it last long and love the heat levels. This specific one it was disappointing. I had the orange color one and it was better and of course $10 more in price. This one I truly dislike it! The blow is warm not hot doesn't matter how you change the settings you will feel warm only. I have lots of hair and is long, course and I apply live in spray before blow drying and the same procedure normally takes 30 minutes max to blow dry my hair, and this hair dryer did longer 50 minutes. It does not sound to me it claims to dry faster when you experience yourself. Here is my perspective: It no hairdryer can claim "fast dry" because hair differs from being short, medium, long, thick, thin, course etc... it truly all depend on your hair. don't fall for that. If you don't have too much hair then you can go ahead and purchase cheap hairdryers. I believe this hairdryer of the low cost will only help for short hairs, thin, and hair that is easier to manage. Hairs like mine would only get a quality job with an expensive hair dryer probably over $30's. If you have hair like mine I do recommend getting something over $30's. I am returning the product and definitely going to get something at the store, because ordering online takes time and if doesn't work you easily exchange or return.

postInfo: ['Reviewed in the United States on January 23, 2017']
text: Much more than I ever expected in a hairdryer! :: I have never written a review on Amazon but I really want to let you know how much I love this hairdryer. My daughter has very long and extremely thick hair. She is 11 years old and cannot handle a hot heat setting. My current dryer only has 1 heat setting and it's hot even for me. I have to hold the dryer far from her head to dry it and it takes about 20 min to get it 75% dry. This Remington dryer has 2 heat settings ( and a cool) and 2 blower speeds. I use the low heat setting and high blower and I am not kidding when I say it takes 5 min to blow her hair completely dry now! I don't style it except for running a brush thru it a little as I dry. She flips her head over and I dry the bottom. Her hair is way less frizzy now too! I am buying me this same dryer. I did not benefit in anyway for writing this review. I just really like this hair dryer that much!

postInfo: ['Reviewed in the United States on January 27, 2017']
text: My hair's pretty fine but I have a lot of it :: I had been using my old blow dryer for YEARS (We're talking probably since high school and I'm now 27, you do the math), and was always so frustrated that my hair took forever to dry. My hair's pretty fine but I have a lot of it, and it's about mid chest length to give you an idea. This blow dryer is amazing, it has cut my drying time down to 5 min tops, which makes me feel a lot better about using heat on my hair- instead of frying it for 10 minutes I'm only using it for maybe 5. It's really powerful and I love that it has three different blast settings as well as three different heat settings, I like to be able to control the temperature. Love it!

text: Durable :: So far so good! Even threw it on the floor once and it's still going. Also, the hair dryer says 'damage control' in the product description. So, for those of you leaving reviews about it not getting hot enough, that's kind of the idea of damage control. It dries your hair without getting too hot, thus not damaging it. I've had to buy a new hair dryer just about every year because they always seem to have the heating element get to hot and break apart. Then the hair dryers only blow cold. This is my first Remington and I hope it doesn't do the same as the others. My husband has had his for several years, which is why I decided to specifically buy a Remington. He swears by their products.

postInfo: ['Reviewed in the United States on February 13, 2017']
text: So far so good! :: This dryer is actually quite efficient at its job. My other dryer took very long to dry and that may be also due to the fact that on the highest heat setting, it would burn your scalp, but I can get a start on drying my hair with the highest setting with this dryer without issue, and then switch to medium heat after my hair is somewhat dry, in order to not damage my hair so much. The only drawback with this dryer is that it is somewhat heavy. I did not realize quite the extent until I had blood drawn and could not hold the dryer with that arm that evening, as I kept feeling like I was holding a 5-pound weight. My arm went numb and that is when it dawned on me that the dryer is somewhat heavier than I am used to handling. Still, it's a small price to pay, considering the rest.

postInfo: ['Reviewed in the United States on August 9, 2015']
text: This hairdryer has it all! :: (UPDATE 10/13/16 Blow dryer just quit working)I got this thinking it would not top my Revlon hairdryer I have which I had loved. How wrong I was. This hairdryer is about the same size as my other one and has the same 1875 Watts of power, but it's got a lot more options! Cool, Warm and Hot, and High, Medium, Low air speed as well as the coveted cool shot button that I like. The Remington's cool shot button activates faster than my other hair dryer. It seems to take no time to get the cool shot on this one! It also comes with two attachments, the one that I use for "fluffing" when I want to keep my hair curly and the other one that I use to help "straighten" when I'm going to flat iron.I also like that the hanging loop on the end is nice and large so it hangs well on the hook in my bathroom. Some hairdryers don't even have that or have one so small it won't hang on a peg.I found that I was able to blow dry my hair quickly with this dryer and I appreciated the control I had, being able to switch between heat settings and air flow speeds to get the perfect look.UPDATE 9/13/15 I still love this hairdryer as much as I did on day one. I have relegated my other Revlon dryer to "back up" status, for emergencies or if my son needs one for his hair. This will be my primary dryer until something happens to it. I'll update my review if anything changes.UPDATE 10/13/16 - The hairdryer just quit working yesterday. Could not get it to work again, not sure what happened!

postInfo: ['Reviewed in the United States on February 21, 2019']
text: Lasted just 3 weeks :: Pros: very quiet yet powerful, light weight, pretty color; 3 speeds + 3 settings (cool/warm/hot)Cons: first time using the hottest setting on medium, it stopped and burned out. postInfo: ['Reviewed in the United States on August 25, 2015']
text: Dries my thick, wavy hair quickly and thoroughly :: I've owned like 3 or 4 blow driers in my time. I'm not so good about consistently using them because I'm lazy. Well, I also know how harsh blow-drying can be on hair (particularly colored like mine), so I tend to avoid it. But every so often (more so in the winter), I find I need to dry my hair quickly instead of waiting. My last hair dryer died in a blaze of glory - well, actually it more or less fizzled and refused to turn on. So when this popped up in my Vine selection, I selected it.This Remington hair dryer comes with attachments - one, a diffuser, that looks like an alien product (apparently used for curly hair), and a funnel appendage that reminds me of an airplane wind tunnel. I don't have curly hair so I didn't bother with the diffuser (I really wish it had not been included because all it does it take up valuable drawer space), but I did test out the Wind Tunnel (much as I like pretending it's a wind tunnel for miniature airplanes, I would like to know, what is this thing called really?).I love all the settings! My last hair dryer pretty much had hi-lo, hot-cold and that was it. This has 3 heat settings and 2 speeds along with a cold blast setting, allowing for a more controlled drying experience. I found it really dried my thick, wavy hair well (another reason why I hate drying my hair - it usually takes 30 minutes for it to be all dry) and relatively quickly. The Wind Tunnel also helped to ensure nice, smooth, straight hair - the way I like to style my hair.Overall, I'm impressed and pleased. I wish that the diffuser hadn't been included because I have no need for it and the space it takes up BUT I know that those with curly hair may appreciate it.UPDATE 09/18/16: While I still like this product, I have since received a Bio Ionic from Vine, which I like more. The Remington's Cool Burst is far too easily activated when I am drying my hair, a problem I don't have with the Bio Ionic. Therefore, I am taking away 1-star to show this.Brought to you by:*C.S. Light*

postInfo: ['Reviewed in the United States on August 8, 2015']
text: Nice dryer :: This is a great dryer once I got used to having a full size dryer again. I bonked myself in the head the first couple of times I used it because I m used to a mini-travel-size blow dryer that is about thirty years old.This dryer comes with an attachment for curly hair and a diffuser, two things my travel dryer doesn t have. The blow dryer also has dual heat and air controls, and seems so deluxe compared to my other dryer, which is very basic and only has a switch for hi or low.I love the snappy purple color too, but this dryer isn t small and actually takes up a lot of space, however, it does cool down quickly so can be put away without worry of it being too warm.Featuring ionic technology, this dryer helps to keep hair moisturized and dries it faster. My hair is long and dries quickly without frizz. This dryer leaves my hair nice, soft, and fluffy, which is a very good thing when you have fine, limp hair. I want to try the curl attachment and do a scrunching style on my hair, but I haven t played with that yet.I didn t know Remington made hair dryers. Overall, I m very satisfied. I think if any of you need a new hair dryer, this would be worth trying.

postInfo: ['Reviewed in the United States on August 12, 2016']
text: Love love love love love :: Love love love love love! I bought this for myself for my birthday because my old one was really crappy and smelled "hot" if you know what I mean. It worked but it had nothing special about it. This one, on the other hand, is fantastic. It dries my hair so much faster, my hair looks and feels smoother after drying, and it's really cute too! I don't use the attachments (not coordinated enough for that, haha) but I do like that it came with them. They're a nice perk for the price.I have really thick hair shoulder length hair and this dries my hair in about 5-7 minutes even in a warm, humid bathroom. I let my hair dry a few minutes wrapped in a microfiber towel and then let it down to try with this. Works great and I don't have nearly the amount of frizz that I do if I let it dry naturally. Definitely recommend if you need a blow dryer in this price range.

postInfo: ['Reviewed in the United States on August 19, 2015']
text: Variable heat and speeds -- Excellent safety features. :: Excellent hair dryer with some good features. Some of these features seem to be from a marketer's mind rather than real. It won't fix damaged hair...whatever that means. It won't make your hair shinier, healthier, or improve your already good looks. However, in real world day-to-day use it is very capable and effective at drying and styling.It feels solid and well built without being too hefty. It has very solid cord connectors and circuit breaker protection built into the plug...excellent safety features! The handle and controls are very well placed for ease of use. They stay cool to the touch during use. It has 2 speeds and 3 heat settings. Low speed and low heat works best for us. It puts out a huge amount of hot air at high heat and high speed. It has a cool air blow feature which is good for finishing the drying process. It has a couple of attachments, a concentrator and diffuser, which you may find useful. It definitely is not portable though it is transportable if weight is not an issue.Hair dryers are a commodity and there are a lot of choices. This unit stands out in a crowded field and should work for almost all hair drying and styling situations and requirements.

text: Good Hair Dryer :: This hair dryer is slightly smaller than the Goody Heat dryer I currently use. It is not, however, a dryer that is easy to carry around. It feels well-made; it s a little heavier than my Goody Heat dryer despite being smaller. It is also quieter. We have three puppies and they react very differently to the Goody Heat and the Remington so I am not the only one to think the Remington is the quieter dryer. As far as accessories go, the concentrator and the diffusor are comparable to what you find in other dryers. The heating speed too is comparable. I have shoulder-length fairly thick hair so perhaps there is a noticeable difference with longer hair but there isn t with mine. I did notice that the Remington does not seem to be as hot which is probably better for hair overall.All in all, this is a good hair dryer, especially for the price range. I recommend it.

postInfo: ['Reviewed in the United States on August 13, 2015']
text: Was a winner until the heating element gave out too quickly :: I m always in search of a hair dryer that can blow dry my thick, curly hair as well as my stylist does. (I know I know it s the person not the tool.) When she dries it, she barely has to touch it up with a flat iron. When I dry it I have to do a little more work to straighten out the wavy stragglers.This review compares the Revlon 1875W Tourmaline Ionic Ceramic Dryer, Remington T|Studio Silk AC Professional Hair Dryer, and this one (Remington Damage Control (DC) Ceramic Hair Dryer).All of them have: * Same wattage * Three heat settings * Two speed settings * Cool shot feature * Diffuser and concentrator attachments * Ionic technology * Ceramic technology * Hanging loopThe Revlon does not come with a removable filter, the two Remingtons do. (The TStudio doesn t say it on the box or description. Company website confirms it.) Revlon and Remington Damage Control have tourmaline technology, the TStudio does not.The Revlon s concentrator attachment stays on. The Remington s fall off often. If I put the dryer down to adjust my hair, it comes off some of the time. It's hot to put it back on.All three take about the same time to dry my hair. I may have gotten slightly better results (less wavy) with the Remingtons than with the Revlon. I say may because the difference wasn t large enough to be clear. Some days I do a better job than others. Human error, you know.The Damage Control felt like it took less effort and the reason is most likely because it s the lightest of the three. The shell of the DC and Revlon are plastic while the T|Studio uses better quality materials. But it could be the better quality materials that make it heavier.I can only assume the DC is cheaper than the T|Studio because of its plastic shell even though it has tourmaline technology, which the T|Studio does not.I ve yet to try the diffusers. Whenever I wear my hair curly, I let it dry naturally. That s the whole point of going curly not having to do any hair drying. As for noise I can t answer which one is quietest because I m deaf. It s not a good idea to wear hearing aids while drying wet hair. :)The winner? The Remington DC because it takes the least amount of effort to use and produces the same results as the others. The T|Studio is just too heavy and the Revlon doesn t perform as well as the DC.Update November 16, 2015: I downgraded the dryer from 5 stars to 3 stars because the heating element is giving out. It has been getting as hot in the last couple of weeks. When I switched back to an older dryer, I could see a big difference. Lasted only three months.

postInfo: ['Reviewed in the United States on January 24, 2017']
text: Watch Out :: This dryer was fine while it lasted. It was relatively quiet and did a nice job of drying hair without a great deal of heat.Unfortunately while drying my hair tonight, the dryer components inside the dryer disintegrated. That's right, right in the middle of drying everything inside broke apart and was clanging around. I have never seen such a thing in all my years. Sparks came out first followed by smoke as I was yanking the plug out of the outlet, followed by relief that none of the parts broke out and hit me in the face. I was also happy that it didn't burn down the house.This dryer was only used occasionally and had no mistreatment whatsoever. There was also no dust or hair buildup of any kind on the intake end of the dryer. It looks exactly like it did when it came out of the box. But, if you move it around you hear all the internals bouncing around. This was very disappointing.

postInfo: ['Reviewed in the United States on April 17, 2017']
text: I'm not sure if the plug is going bad or the surge protector is going bad :: I've used this dryer since Nov 2016 almost daily during the week. I use the dryer between 12 - 20 minutes on high heat/high speed. I keep the dryer plugged into a surge protector as I have with every blow dryer I've ever owned. Up until about two months ago I noticed the dryer wasn't as hot as it used to be. Then about a month ago the dryer would shut off after about 10 minutes of use and trip the surge protector. I'm not sure if the plug is going bad or the surge protector is going bad. Keep in mind, I've never had a surge protector trip or go bad in the 20+ years I've used them. However, this is the first time using this brand hair dryer. The surge protector I'm using is: Belkin 6-Outlet Commercial Power Strip Surge Protector with 6-Foot Power Cord and Rotating Plug, 720 Joules (BE106000-06R) https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B000JJI6XA/ref=oh_aui_search_detailpage?ie=UTF8&psc=1I am purchasing a new hair dryer tonight as I feel like the issue is the dryer, not my surge protector. A hair dryer should last a few years, at least the ones I've always purchased. This one in my opinion is, Egh! Move on. Spend a few extra dollars for something more expensive. You get what you pay for. When I looked tonight, the dryer is $19.84 with a $4.00 coupon.

postInfo: ['Reviewed in the United States on March 9, 2017']
text: This is a great hairdryer. I love the attachments that came with ... :: This is a great hairdryer. I love the attachments that came with it as well, the thin one for concentrated heat, and a wide mouthed comb one for teasing volume or just lifting the hair so that the air can really get in there. I have thick hair so it's usually hard to dry in a short amount of time. But with that wide attachment, it took less than 10 minutes.

postInfo: ['Reviewed in the United States on December 11, 2017']
text: Won t last :: I loved this hair dryer while it worked! A little background on me- I literally blow dry my hair at most 2 times a month. I bought this hair dryer a year ago, it stayed in the box for at least 4 months before I even used it, and now it no longer blows hot air. So let s see... that means after I have used it probably no more than 16-20 times it no longer heats up! I am so disappointed because I really loved the dryer! However, if it can t last through 20 blow dries it s not worth a penny. I m a bit peeved I can t get a refund, too.

postInfo: ['Reviewed in the United States on February 11, 2020']
text: it truly helps your hair :: I love this hairdryer. It truly helps...yes I said HELPS my hair.I have naturally curly/frizzy/ wavy hair so I get a fly away frizzy mess on my head if it's not taken care of.The best part of the Remington D3190 Damage Protection Hair Dryer with Ceramic + Ionic + Tourmaline Technology is it doesn't just blow air at the same temperature the entire time. It heats and cools on its on as it's blowing so as not to fry or burn your hair.My hair is much softer and more shinier than when I started. It comes with an attachable diffuser and a flat edge attachment to isolate the air so you can dry or concentrate on hair parts.I couldn't believe the price of this dryer was so low, considering how well it works and how much nicer my hair is after I use it. It is very light-weight and It travels well.

postInfo: ['Reviewed in the United States on May 11, 2019']
text: Awkward! :: Although this hairdryer does what it was intended to do (dry my hair), I find it to be VERY difficult to use! The 'handle' contains all the controls: on/off, heat settings, and fan speed, controlled by 3 different toggle switches. I'm having trouble using the hairdryer without inadvertently hitting the toggle switches, thereby changing the settings or turning the hairdryer on and off. The switches take up most of the handle space and I find it awkward to hold the hairdryer in a different location. It's relatively heavy, making even even more frustrating. I'm happy I didn't spend more than $20 for this one!

postInfo: ['Reviewed in the United States on January 16, 2020']
text: Great drying power, helps stop the frizz, and comes with added attachments just in case :: I actually tried and returned two other blow dryers before ending up with this one. One of the dryers I returned was even $30 more expensive than this one and didn't work as well either. I found this dryer to be the best for anything with a similar price point. text: Decent for the price :: It s a hair dryer. It s nothing fancy. It does the job. postInfo: ['Reviewed in the United States on April 27, 2019']
text: Good quality for the price :: My last hair dryer was a Revlon Radiance travel dryer. My mom originally bought it for her back in... 2000? Maybe earlier. It lasted about 20 years, and I loved it. It was compact and did a great job.Sadly, it wasn't getting as hot as it used to. If Revlon still made them, I'd buy another. But they don't, so I bought this one. It had the most reviews and was rated over 4 stars.I just used it, and I think I really like it! Other than the fact that the barrel is about twice as long(which I'm just gonna have to get used to) and it's not as compact as my old travel dryer. Its not terribly loud, and it dried my hair pretty quickly. I have thick, short hair and it dried it in about 5 min, give or take a minute or 2, on the highest fan and heat setting.

postInfo: ['Reviewed in the United States on June 3, 2018']
text: Pretty good, realistic expectations. :: Pros: direct flow nozzle reduces frizz. I haven t used the diffuser so I can t comment on it. The options of heat and air flow is what I expected. Does it dry hair faster than my previous hairdryer? I use a heat protectant spray which always helps decrease the time to dry.Cons: it s heavier than I expected. I think that has more to do with my lack of normal muscle strength, lol. The grip: yes, because the buttons are the primary real estate of the grip, you ll have incidents of clicking one of the buttons higher-lower or off. I wouldn t exactly call this a con since you ll get used how to hold it without this happening. If you have a travel hairdryer, hold on to it as this one will take up double the space in your luggage.Overall: thumbs up.

postInfo: ['Reviewed in the United States on January 6, 2018']
text: Good product, nice settings :: Works great. Have had it for about a month now. My old hair dryer was a Bella Beauty 3 heat, 3 speed with cool shot and I wanted something similar to replace it.This product works very well. Some people complain that it's too loud, I don't think it's any louder than what should be expected. It's a hairdryer lol. The heat and speed settings plus cool shot are wonderful. Better for damage control so you don't have to have high heat the whole time. I love the purple color.I like that the filter can be taken out, cleaned, and put pack in.The attachments look nice, but I don't really use them.

postInfo: ['Reviewed in the United States on October 13, 2018']
text: Not bad...but not hot enough :: I bought this hair dryer in hopes it would be like my last Remington one that lasted for about eight years. While the amount of air blown from the dyer is a lot and I appreciate it, for some reason this one just isn't as hot as my last Remington one. I also noticed that the button for the cold air is really easy to press while using the hair dryer, which definitely adds to the fact that I never think the dryer is hot enough. I had to keep pressing the cold air button a few times to make sure I was only getting hot air. And even when I was only getting hot air from the dyer, it didn't seem to be enough. Maybe my last dryer was more powerful so I feel the difference in the heat. I don't think this one is a super terrible hair dryer though and I am a loyal customer of Remington products, so I'll definitely be trying out a different Remington one and see how that goes. It was just ok for me.

postInfo: ['Reviewed in the United States on March 18, 2018']

postInfo: ['Reviewed in the United States on February 28, 2018']
text: Great features and nice diffuser, works wonderflully, but has what I consider a design flaw in switches on the handle :: I bought this hairdryer because I needed one with a diffuser, and I liked all the technical specs. It works great and the diffuser is exactly what I needed for styling. BUT, this dryer has a design flaw that I have encountered on some hotel room dryers and that I find really frustrating. The buttons that regulate the air speed and amount of heat are rocker buttons, and they are located on the handle right where you grip the dryer. That means that if you shift your finger position at all on the handle, you often accidentally squeeze a button and change the air speed or temperature without wanting to do so. My previous dryer had slide switches on the handle that you had to slide from above or below, NOT by just pushing, so I NEVER changed air temps or speeds on the old dryer without meaning to.

postInfo: ['Reviewed in the United States on November 10, 2016']
text: Professional Quality at an Affordable Price!!! :: I have very long, delicate blond hair which is easily prone to damage, tangling and split/end flyaways. My old hair dryer finally kicked the bucket so I chose this based on reviews and I could not be happier with my purchase. This hairdryer cost 3x less than my old one, works just as good and is actually better because it's not as heavy and the diffuser end kind of clips on so I know it will stay on where my old one just slid on, and would frequently slide off.Pros:-Very Lightweight-Powerful-3 Heat Settings. The coolest one is cool, the hottest one is hot but not burning/kill your hair hot-Awesome Price-Not crazy loudCons:None to mention thus far!I highly recommend this purchase for anyone including professional hair stylists because of how light it is to hold.

text: Great hair dryer! :: Love, love, love this hair dryer. And I know, you may be asking yourself, Self, why would someone love a hair dryer? Well, because it s just that good! I m not one to usually boast over inanimate objects, but this hair dryer has got me feeling all the feels. First, it s lightweight, which if you are like me and have thick, long hair that takes a while to dry, that is a GREAT thing. Second, the settings are nice, with two speed options. The diffuser attachment works great, doesn t add a lot of weight. Overall, I am just completely satisfied with this product, between the price, easability of use, look, and quality. I would definitely recommend this to anyone!

postInfo: ['Reviewed in the United States on April 2, 2016']
text: I am so happy that it is so lightweight and the buttons are ... :: I have long, thick straight hair that is the envy of many. I am very particular with the products I use on my hair. I use expensive salon brand shampoos and hair care products. I have been using Remington hair dryers for years and I sing their praises! The last one I owned broke after 2 years and so I was recently in the market for a hew hair dryer. I figured I should try a different brand just in case Im missing something out there. I found a high end brand and a cheap affordable one. But they all have one thing in common among reviewers- They either spark or catch fire! Why would I go through that stress and trauma when here I have a brand I know I can trust. So I found this new Remington D3109A. Soon as I got them in the mail I immediately washed my hair and tried this baby right away! I am so happy that it is so lightweight and the buttons are strategically placed where you don't accidentally change settings while you're drying your hair. The temp was just right to dry my hair without frying it and the air pressure compensates for it. My hair felt so soft and glossy when I was done. Thank you for Remington. Never failed to deliver!

text: Great dryer, great price :: I love this blow dryer! Okay, so here is a little about why I picked this one specifically.1. I have natural hair. I researched which blow dryers were best for natural (curly) hair.Apparently ionic dryers have a technology that makes your hair dry faster, therefore requiring less heat, thereby causing less damage to the cuticle.2. It's a Remington. I've never bad a bad experience with this brand.3. I liked that it has 3 heat settings and multiple speed settings as well. Sometimes I want my dryer to blow on high, but with medium heat. I can make that decision with this dryer. Many only have the option to adjust the speed.3. It got great reviews... always check the reviews

text: Works great, good price :: I am quite happy with this dryer. It seems to dry my hair more quickly than my old ionic dryer. I've also noticed there is less heat coming out -- less heat + faster drying makes me very happy. I think the dryer may also be a bit more quiet than the dryer I had in the past. As other reviewers noted, the buttons are in an awkward location (right under my finger tips when I hold the dryer). I occasionally turn the dryer off or move the temperature setting. Over time, I've been able to learn how to hold the handle and avoid the buttons, so it hasn't been too annoying. Hopefully there will be a design improvement for the next version.

The first use I could tell it could be a keeper and after using this for a while I can safely say I can really tell the difference. postInfo: ['Reviewed in the United States on December 10, 2016']
text: Crazy powerful blower makes this dryer almost unusable :: I've been using blow dryers for 40 years and never before have I encountered the stupid engineering of this dryer, It does sort of work so I'm keeping it for now, but only until I can find one that's better designed.The blower is too powerful or, at least, too powerful for a 2" opening. It's impossible to style hair even on the lowest setting, and the highest stetting might be better suited to clearing leaves from the yard. The only way I've been able to manage was to put out another $20 for a brush styler and use that once my hair is mostly dry.The heat setting seems to work on high only when the blower is on high. So it takes a long time to dry even short-ish hair.The 5 ft cord is barely long enough to reach from the plug to the other side of my head. An extension cord would solve the problem but that's not a good solution in a bathroom.I'm so glad this dryer has ionic damage control technology. I've been drying and styling my hair just fine for 40 years without it but I'm sure the manufacturer hopes that little bit of advertising makes up for an almost unusable product.

postInfo: ['Reviewed in the United States on November 23, 2016']
text: Best dryer I've ever had :: Perfect! I've had it three days and from day one I was amazed. I have short light auburn hair. Redheads have lots of "hairs" but they are very, very fine. My previous dryer was a Hot Tools with supposedly nano ceramic and ionic technology. It took at least 20 minutes to style my 3-4 inch long hair on medium, plus the heat made my head sweat. As I styled it would dry out the ends which then wouldn't behave. After all the work I was rarely satisfied with the results. So very frustrating. This Remington, on medium heat setting it's not hot, just a bit warm but the ceramic technology dries my hair quickly and brings out the gold and shine and sets the curls well. If I don't want to fuss too much I can be finished in about 5 minutes. Full style 10 minutes. No more sweating!

postInfo: ['Reviewed in the United States on February 1, 2016']
text: Flimsy attachments fall off constantly :: Since I have a Remington hair straightener that is super amazing, I figured I'd buy a hair dryer made by Remington too. I liked this dryer at first - it dried my hair without the burning smell that my old hair dryer used to produce. I had minimal frizz afterwards and my hair felt smooth and soft. Success! - or so I thought.I decided to try out the attachment that came in the box, hoping it'd help dry my hair quicker. Mid blow-dry, I knocked off the attachment with my hair brush and it flew off. The tiniest hit detached it! It's made of a flimsy, plastic material that doesn't lock on to the hair dryer well. It didn't bother me initially, but after a week or two I started getting annoyed. The attachment would fall off every few minutes and that prolonged my drying time. Eventually, I gave up and bought a Conair Infinito Pro instead; much better!

postInfo: ['Reviewed in the United States on May 8, 2020']
text: High quality :: CONFU PROFESSIONAL IONIC HAIR DRYER 1875W AC MOTOR SALON BLOWDRYER FAST DRYING LIGHT WEIGHT LOW NOISE HAIRDRYERS WITH DIFFUSER 2 CONCENTRATORS 3 HEAT 2 SPEED SETTINGS COOL SHOT; MODEL HAIR DRYER PRO KF-9897 Yes: This unit is VERY aesthetic Looks Great! Yes: This unit will get VERY hot (or moderate or cool if you prefer). - I wanted & received one that can be set to a VERY hot temp and this does this [or as cool as you would prefer as well] Yes: The air flow is VERY abundant (or you can turn it down to a lower air flow of your preference). No one will find fault with its air flow. CONTROLS: will get you the desired temp, & air speed. CABLE: The cable length is VERY generous and is slightly over 7 feet long and very heavy duty. SAFETY: This power cord also has the proper safety shut off on the plug to protect from dropping in water. [If using close to water, you should still use a GFI receptacle of course] The unit s BODY is Heavy Duty construction, high quality materials. WEIGHT: Yes: Being high quality & heavy duty quality results in this unit being heavier than other units; but is satisfactory for me. [I do not have long hair, so I do not hold it shoulder height for long.] This is NOT some mini-sized light weight unit that would be preferred for traveling. [Since I do not use it for travel, this is not a concern of mine.] I wish that its shipping/storage box (which is aesthetic) would be redesigned to make for a better storage container. The instructions advise to hang it with power cord not bent. But I would prefer to keep it in the nice aesthetic product box and store it in my bedroom walk-in closet on a shelf [because I only use in occasionally perhaps unlike most other users]. However, the box is not so tight that you cannot store the unit within it as I am doing. But I would prefer it had a contoured saddle fit. [If they provided a better structured box for storing it, I would have given it a 5-star rating.] Their tiny instructions pamphlet [mostly regarding safety], should be made available as an internet download to save within my computer.

postInfo: ['Reviewed in the United States on August 15, 2015']
text: Nicely Designed 1875 Watt Blow Dryer That's Super Lightweight and A Great Value! :: This is a very good blow dryer. It has three heat and two speed settings, and a cool shot button to help set your style. It's 1875 watts- so it's nice and strong though not as powerful my professional hair dryer that does dry my hair faster. But my hair has been getting split ends and damaged, so I love that this dryer is designed to protect against heat damage. Only time will tell if that feature works, but I sure need it. This also has the usual attachments that I never use but they look the same as what typically comes with a blow dryer. My biggest problem with blow dryers is the motor dies from not regularly cleaning the lint filter (which draws in dust and causes the motor to overheat). So one great feature is this Remington has a removable filter for easy cleaning, and that will definitely prolong the life of the hair dryer if the filter is cleaned out regularly.My hair comes out smooth and nice with the Remington. My favorite part about the design is it's comfortable to hold, the controls are placed well for comfortable use and most of all it's super lightweight. Also, this dryer is not as loud as most others. It looks great in purple too. I do wish the cord was a little longer. It's long enough for plugging into a high outlet in a bathroom, but if I need to use a lower outlet in another room then the cord is too short for me to stand and dry my hair (though adequate if I sit down). I'm used to a longer cord, so others may not mind the cord length, but I'm taking one star off as I think the cord should be at least a foot longer. Overall, however, I definitely recommend this hair dryer as it has great features, works very well and is such a great value!

postInfo: ['Reviewed in the United States on August 23, 2015']
text: Great hair dryer for the money. :: This is a very good hair dryer for the price. I am comparing this hair dryer to the Remington AC9096 I purchased this past Christmas.At 1875W for both models, they both heat up quickly and put out a LOT of heat. The motors are both reasonably quiet with the D3190A having a slightly higher pitched sound to it. Not louder per se, but just a little more trebly.Functions wise, both have 3 fan and 3 heat setting and a separate "cold shot" button. The 9096 has a more positive click to the cold shot button but both work well. Both come with the same accessories, a diffusor and a flat nozzle. Both have ceramic and ionic technology though only the 9096 has the ionic "on" led light. I'm not sure if you're getting more ions with the 9096 or if that light just for show.Other differences are the intake and output nozzle of the 9096 are smaller so the heat is more directed while the direction of the buttons are reversed (up vs. down being on/off, hotter/cooler. Not really a big deal I suppose.)Lastly, the 9096 is heavier and more back heavy while this 3190 is more balanced meaning it doesn't want to tilt up in your hand. All in all this is a very nice hair dryer for the price while the 9096 beats it in fit and finish ever so slightly - but I suppose that should be expected for the roughly $10 price premium.In summary, it all depends on whether any of these differences are meaningful and whether the small price increase is justified. Either way, both should be solid choices.

postInfo: ['Reviewed in the United States on September 29, 2019']
text: Bought mine from Walmart/same blow-dryer. :: The last week it started making a weird noise and produced a burning smell. Finally the blower stopped working. Husband took it apart and part of the housing holding the motor had broken away and was down in the motor. Had to throw it away. Will never buy another Remington.

postInfo: ['Reviewed in the United States on September 16, 2015']
text: Works well, but doesn't get as hot as most blow dryers :: I am happy with this blow dryer. It does a good job of drying my hair without getting overly hot. The one issue with this blow dryer is that it doesn't get as hot as most. This can be a good or bad thing depending on your hair and what you want. Drying my hair at a lower heat setting seems to make my hair look nicer. It takes a bit longer to dry my hair with this blow dryer than my other dryers though.I like that this blow dryer is light and easy to hold. The purple color is fun and reminds me of the '80s. I'm not that impressed with the build quality though. It feels flimsier than my other hair dryers.This is the first hair dryer I have owned that came with a diffuser. I like to dry my hair straight, so I am using the diffuser after bathing my dog. It seems a lot less scary to my dog to the air diffused a bit instead of a straight shot of air blown in one spot.Overall, I recommend this hair dryer. It works well and the additional attachments included make it a good value. Just be aware that it doesn't get as hot as most hair dryers.

postInfo: ['Reviewed in the United States on August 15, 2015']
text: Great working hair dryer at an economical price :: This is a great hair dryer at a fantastic price. It contains all the elements I have in my older and much more expensive hair dryer. It uses ionic ceramic toumaline to help reduce frizz and static that occurs from blow drying your hair. It has three heat settings and two blower speeds. I generally use the medium heat and the high blower, but I like to have the option to do a quicker dry with high heat when needed. It also includes the cool shot button which allows you to quickly cool the dryer down in the midst of drying and styling.It has an easily removable filter, which is a huge plus. I once ruined a dryer because I didn't realize I needed to clean the filter. Now I periodically take the filter off and blow the "wrong way" through it to clear dust that accumulates through time. I do this about one a week or so and it helps keep the dryer running well and from burning out. I have placed a towel hook next to my bathroom sink and I hang the dryer on it. It keeps it off the counter, saving room and keeping it within easy reach.The dryer comes with both a concentrator for when you are styling your hair or trying to focus the drying effort as well as a diffuser. The latter is important for me as my hair has a lot of wave and curl and blow drying it without the diffuser turns it all to frizz instead of curls.I'm very pleased with this dryer and recommend it as a good and fairly inexpensive choice.

postInfo: ['Reviewed in the United States on July 24, 2018']
text: Good air flow on high!! :: I love this dryer, especially for the price. As a woman with long hair, I've gone through quite a few over the years and I have high hopes for this one. It has 3 settings for heat (hot,warm, cool) and high and low air flow. Let me tell you, the high air flow is really high. It blows really hard! I personally love that because my hair dries so much faster. It's light weight too so my arm doesn't get tired. Only slight downside, which I don't mind at all, is that on the high air flow setting, it's a little loud - nothing crazy, just a tiny bit louder than most. Still, I love it!

postInfo: ['Reviewed in the United States on August 23, 2015']
text: Slightly Smaller and Lighter than its Predecessor. Quick Drying, No Fly-Away Hair. :: I have been using an older model Remington hair dryer, and, while that model has held up well with daily use for over 3 years, this newer model is lighter weight and slightly smaller yet produces the same results as the old model.This Remington says that it has micro conditioners to prevent heat damage and increase hair shine. It also says that its ceramic technology prevents hair damage and dries hair faster.Since using the Remington hair dryers (daily) my hair (untreated and treated) do not show hair damage at all - no split ends, no dry/brittle, no fly-away. Whether this is attributable to the dryer or my hair product (changed when I started treating my hair), I cannot say. I use shampoo & conditioners about every other day and dry my hair every day.Dry time is fast. The new model doesn't seem to have a faster dry, but the dry time is pretty quick nonetheless. I do not use either attachment. This dryer comes with a diffuser (Remington caught flak with the last model not including a diffuser) and a directional blower. Both are standard plastic.Overall, this Remington dryer works well, dry well, and should last a number of years if it follows in previous models' footsteps. Very happy with the feel and results.

postInfo: ['Reviewed in the United States on November 12, 2017']
text: Love it so far :: I've had this blower for a few weeks now and got it on a special Amazon discount. For the price point that i paid and its performance, i have to say that i'm very satisfied. Using it with the diffuser has managed to really help dry and define my curls. I've had no issues with any of the attachable parts. And i like the settings. There's a low, medium, and high, and even the highest setting doesn't burn unless you have the nozzle near the edge of your face, Because i have a lot of long curly hair, it takes me about 20 mins to fully diffuse my curls, but i'd much prefer to do that than let it air dry. Can't imagine being without this useful tool now.

postInfo: ['Reviewed in the United States on August 11, 2015']
text: great price for a well made hairdryer :: This is a nice basic hairdryer. We have a big family and own several Remington hairdryers. This one is in the kids bathroom. With its smaller grip it's a good size for older kids and teens to use. It dries hair fairly quickly, on par with most other dryers we've owned. We keep it on a command adhesive hook above the outlet to the side of the sinks. The cord has a good sized built in loop for hanging.I was really happy to find that it comes with both a wide, flat nozzle for straightening as well as a diffuser for curly styles. My fancy high end dryer didn't come with a diffuser and it took forever to find one that fit. I also like that it has a cool button, no need to slide a button up and down to set a style with cool air.My one complaint is that this dryer is a bit noisier than the other Remington dryers we have. It's not so noisy that it consider it loud for a hairdryer but if you're searching for a quiet model know this one is average to slightly above average as far as noise goes.All in all I'm impressed with this hairdryer. It's a fantastic value at this price point. All our other Remington's have lasted years.

postInfo: ['Reviewed in the United States on June 11, 2017']
text: GREAT HAIR DRYER!!!! :: This blow dryer helps my hair with frizz and dries my hair quickly. Its not too heavy which is important to me because I have small hands. The noiselevel is not too loud, seems to be like the hair dryers I have had in the past. The cord is 5' long, which works well for me. The concentrator is a littletricky to get on and off but if you'll look at how it goes on and take your time with it there's no problem. The outside of the dryer is made of plastic and doesn't look expensive but that's ok with me. My hair looks better than it did, real problem with frizz until I started using this dryer. I would buy again because its a great dryer and its in my budget!!! THANK YOU REMINGTON !!!!

postInfo: ['Reviewed in the United States on August 16, 2015']
text: Blowing in the Wind :: This is a nice blow dryer for the price, and it is more lightweight than my trusty Revlon/Helen of Troy model that's still ticking even after numerous drops on my bathroom floor.Like the numerous dial settings, BUT this dryer does not that hot. But maybe that's to be expected because this is a "damage control" blow dryer, and heat - along with chemicals like peroxide and ammonia - is one of your hair's biggest enemies. Have always dried my hair on the lowest heat and speed settings, and the cool shot should be highly distinguishable from a warm setting. On this hair dryer, you can barely tell them apart. All heat settings feel relatively the same.The verdict is that, using this dryer, it took a LONGER time to dry my thick hair. However, my hair did come out nice and shiny.

postInfo: ['Reviewed in the United States on August 21, 2015']
text: Dries Fast No Frizzies :: Remington blow dryers may be a little heavier than you re used to, but they are made well and made to last. text: Ok for a backup or basic hair dryer :: This is a decent hair dryer, and we usually buy the less expensive ones because they seem to last as long, if not longer, than more expensive ones. On this one, the handle doesn't fold, which is kind of a pain for storing, and it only has two heat settings, which my wife found to be either too hot and not hot enough, so she went back to her old one. The removable filter is a simple plastic screen that screws off of the back so it can be washed. It's nothing special, but it's a nice touch that you can remove it vs. trying to get all the gunk out while wrangling the rest of the dryer. We don't use the attachments for curly hair, so while they were included and seem durable, we'd not be able to say how well they work. At any rate, it's a good dryer we'll keep in the guest bathroom and can serve as a functional backup.

text: Love the "cool shot" feature and that the filter is cleanable! :: Let me start with the removable filter which allows you to clean the dust out, my previous dryers did not have this option and the filter would clog diminishing the airflow and the drying ability. That is why this is such an important feature to me,you would think all hair dryers would have it!Now to its features: it has 3 heat settings and 2 power settings (*wish there were 3!) annnd a "cool shot" which Iove, Love, LOVE! I have very thin, fine hair and when I set my hair with heat rollers I use the "cool shot" feature to speed up the "set" and my curls stay in longer as the hair is more cooled down before I take the rollers out so the curls don't fall out as quickly as they used to, my set lasts longer.I use the concentrator but have no need for the diffuser but if you are naturally curly it is a nice attachment to have.It has the heat protection "ionic technology" that helps keep your hair frizz and fly away free, dries hair fast (I have long hair) and doesn't tangle it up when just doing a blow dry and not setting my curls.It has a 2 year warranty and is at a GREAT price for what you get. I would recommend this dryer.

postInfo: ['Reviewed in the United States on December 21, 2019']

It takes me about 20 mins to get my hair 85% dry. Hair this heavy can t have volume. This dryer dries faster than any other blow dryer I ve had. For the first time ever I can achieve volume. My hair looks smooth not fried (due to my wavy hair). I could never master the big round brush blow drying. This dryer makes is as if I ve finally mastered it. I ve tried pre-drying my hair to almost dry with a regular blow dryer, and then switch to this dryer to finish but found my hair was frizzier that way. If you have thick hair get it you won t be sorry.

postInfo: ['Reviewed in the United States on August 25, 2019']
text: DO NOT BUY! Mine died after using less than 2x/week for 5 months :: I wanted to write a glowing review; while this dryer worked, I really loved it. I loved how soft and silky my hair felt after using it, and once I realized that by pre-drying my hair with my regular blow dryer about halfway THEN switching to the brush dryer, my drying time was considerably shortened and I *thought* I'd extend the life of the brush dryer by not using it for 15 minutes at a time to dry my just past shoulder length hair.Cut to yesterday morning: I went to use the dryer for the first time in a week (during the summer, unless I have a client meeting, or somewhere special to go, my hair is towel-dried then put in a ponytail), and I heard it crackle a little when I started it. I looked at it, everything seemed ok, so I went about finishing drying and styling my hair. About 2 minutes of use on the high setting later, I heard several crackle, pops and fizzing sounds, then smoke started pouring out of the top. I immediately turned it off, unplugged it and put it in our tub in case it started burning. The smoke died out quickly, but there is no way in heck I'm plugging it in to see if it works.I've looked all over this site, and did a Google search; good luck finding a website to claim your warranty. I foolishly just tossed the box it came in about 3 weeks ago (argh!!!!), so I'm SOL. If anyone has the warranty still and could share the website/phone number to contact this company, I'd really appreciate it.I can't recommend purchasing this dryer. I didn't expect it to last forever, but certainly more than 5 months with 2x/less use per week!! I'd give this zero stars if I could. BUY ANOTHER COMPANY'S PRODUCT.

postInfo: ['Reviewed in the United States on April 24, 2020']
text: Attachments No Longer Fit :: As far as drying power, this little dryer is great. But for functionality, something went wrong about a month to a month and half of use.As shown in the photos, the attachments no longer sit flush with the dryer nozzle to snap in place. It s like the dryer has been pushed from the inside of the nozzle lip out, making it too big.The dryer hasn t been dropped, and even if it had been and it fell onto a hard surface on the nozzle, it would dent in, making the opening too small, not push out like it is making the opening too big.I m not sure what happened, but we only use this dryer with the attachments (Textured/curly hair. Comb attachment to straighten hair for cornrows and diffuser for drying curly roots) and it s proving to be useless now that we can t use the dryer for the intended purposes, and I m outside of the return window.I will also add that the design of the buttons placement could be re-evaluated as I turn the unit off or change the settings multiple times during use just from gripping the dryer.

postInfo: ['Reviewed in the United States on December 10, 2019']
text: Tangles Hair Terribly! :: *UPDATE-This dryer tangles my fine hair terribly. I have never had any hair dryer do this. My hair has knots in it after I dry my hair. I am purchasing a new dryer to replace this one.This hair dryer held some surprises for me. I was surprised at how heavy it is. It probably weighs twice what my most recent (broken) dryer does. The second surprise is that it is infrared, which the description does not note. I was surprised to turn the dryer on and have a bright red light shooting in my face. Infrared lights are damaging to the eyes so I feel the need to use caution with this dryer. While I was drying my hair my face was lit up bright red the entire time. The dryer is a great deal and included several attachments. One reviewer mentioned an included hanging bag but mine did not have this. I like the long, professional type cord. Although the dryer works well, I would not buy it again nor recommend it based upon the weight and infrared light.

postInfo: ['Reviewed in the United States on June 12, 2020']
text: Great product :: Very nice hair dryer set. All pieces were there and self explanatory. I used it and it dried my hair great. The diffuser will be great for my girls curly hair while the other attachments are great for my straight hair. I love the heat adjustment settings and how easy it is to switch between them and off/low/high. The handle is a nice finish which makes it easy to grip and not hurt your hand, but still prevents it from slipping out of your fingers. Its a good size, not too small and not too large.I only have 2 downsides, but they aren't enough to take away a star. 1) the red light is BRIGHT. 2) the attachments don't all attach the same way. The diffuser you put in, and twist while the other 2 you have to completely pop into place. Popping them into place is a pain but it works. I wish all 3 pieces were a twist into place like the diffuser.Overall, a great product!

postInfo: ['Reviewed in the United States on March 13, 2020']
text: Good hair dryer but switches are too loose :: This dryer is lightweight with a good drying temperature and air flow. They need to be a different type of switch or placed in a location where your hands don't touch them during use. My hand begins to cramp because I have to hold the dryer on the edges of the handle to avoid this problem.

text: don t buy this dryer. :: I m really disappointed about my dryer. I bought my 2000 babyliss pro march 20th. When I originally bought it I turned it on after I assembled my dryer to test and see if it worked. It worked. I never touched it again until today. I wanted to do a roller set in my hair. I turned my dryer on and it does not work. I never used it and it already does not work. The last day to return the dryer was April 19th. I gave it one star but I honestly do not know because I never got to use it.

postInfo: ['Reviewed in the United States on November 23, 2018']
text: Changed my life :: I am so not a morning person, and my chin-length very thick very curly hair takes at least 45 minutes of drying on high with my head upside down just to get to the damp stage so I can go to work and keep my curl pattern intact. No more! Now I get out of the shower, sit under this baby for 20 minutes while I check email and drink my coffee and voila - ready to go, perfect curl pattern and hold. My cat loves it too - she sits on my lap and basks in the warmth. It's very quiet - I can have a conversation even with my head under the bonnet. And the cool function gives a good finish to curls and keeps them shiny.

postInfo: ['Reviewed in the United States on June 4, 2018']
text: Quiet and Effective! :: I love this dryer! It is very quiet and the auxillary input jack allowed me to connect my computer and watch videos while sitting under it. My hair dried quickly under the warm heat and high fan settings without burning my ears. Also the dome is deep enough to dry even the bottom of my hair. The only negative - and it's not really that bad - is that the base is huge. This made it challenging to move between the door frames. Other than that, my only question is why I waited so long to get this dryer.

postInfo: ['Reviewed in the United States on May 20, 2018']
text: Returned it..... :: Purchased this upgraded model to replace a babyliss standing dryer I had for years, but finally failed. Couldn t find the exact one but was happy to find a babbyliss because their standing dryers come with 2000 watts, which tells me it gets good and hot. The dryer got nice and hot but the fan didn t work, didn t blow the hot air around inside the hood it just got hot. The air wasn t moving/circulating around my rollers. I think it was defective so I returned it. Purchased another one,different brand from a beauty supply store as this dryer is much to big and combersom to keep packing up and returning. Big disappointment.

postInfo: ['Reviewed in the United States on November 10, 2019']
text: Updated Review :: This seems well made if only it had a quality switch. I received it today and it would not even turn on! Returning.I m editing my initial review since the problem was due to operator error. After going out and buying another type of dryer at Sally s the same day I received this and thinking that one didn t work either, my husband read that you have to put the front visor part down for it to turn on. So, I unpacked this one again and it works. I will be trying it tomorrow and will review again.

postInfo: ['Reviewed in the United States on April 27, 2018']
text: Disappointing, uneven drying. :: So far, not so good. I usually do a wet set with pin curls overnight, which works great, but requires about 8 hours to dry. I got this in the hope I could wash and set my hair in the morning. I ve used it once, with small and medium Velcro rollers, and after sitting under it for 45 minutes on hot/high, half of my head was bone dry, and the front and sides were still wet (I don t mean slightly damp - I mean wet). And the hot setting is HOT! I don t think you re damaging your hair less by using this thing instead of a hand held dryer. I m going to give it one more shot with my pin curls, to make sure it wasn t the rollers. If it fails that test, it s going back. So disappointed this far!

postInfo: ['Reviewed in the United States on May 12, 2019']
text: The dryer did not work, and their customer service was not helpful. :: This dryer arrived looking fine, and assembled easily despite lacking instructions, but it did not work when plugged in. It just never turned on.When we spoke with the company's customer service and warranty department, they told us that we did not provide them with the proper model number (despite giving them numerous letter and number combinations on the packaging and dryer). They informed us they could not help, despite them being able to pull up the product on the website and see that their company sold it. Amazon let us return the dryer.This really felt like a failure on the part of the company (Con Air), and was a frustrating experience. I get that sometimes products arrive defective, but this came in a big box that is difficult to carry, and un-assembling it and returning it was a pain that took up a few hours of my day.

postInfo: ['Reviewed in the United States on April 25, 2019']
text: WARNING: YOU WILL WASTE $200, THE DRYER WILL QUIT, AND THE COMPANY WILL NOT HELP :: I wanted to like this dryer. It had tones of features. I purchased this dryer on September 23, 2018 and by April 2, 2019, the dryer quit working. This dryer was NEVER dropped or damaged. It just quit working. Contact Conair and I was told to send it back to them at my own expense and it may or may not be repaired without charge. So I ve lost $200. Buyers beware.

postInfo: ['Reviewed in the United States on July 3, 2019']
text: Best purchase for curly hair :: I have a LOT of hair so this baby makes me dread my wash days much less. I usually diffuse for a little to remove excess water and encourage curl, and so hair doesn't turn out super flat. Then I just sit back and relax with under this hooded dryer. I can work and use my laptop meanwhile. For me, I don't expect to have my hair 100% in one hour, I have way too much hair, but it makes it way faster and I don't have to waste time and energy with a diffuser. Also this will create a very good gel cast (which you can break later), so hair will turn out basically frizz-free. 100% recommended.
