postInfo: ['Reviewed in the United States on January 3, 2017']
text: And back it goes... :: If you read enough of the reviews you will find they have a problem with their switches, which are cheap and fail too soon. On mine the on/off switch froze solid in the on position at about 10 months (37 hours of run time). At the same time, it started shutting off at various angles and a sparking noise could be heard deep in the bowels of the machine. So back it goes at my expense. Might as well count on $9.50 every 10 months for shipping until the 5 year warranty is up. It's only $5 more just to buy a new one, but it's the principle of the thing. They know what the problem is, they don't change the materials or design of the switch, they've just baked the problem into their business model. Ok, fine, they get it back then.I do like it when it works though. It's one of the few dryers left that don't have the hair limpening/flattening tourmaline ceramic ionic stuff feature.**Update 10/30/19*** The warranty replacement unit broke today. The on/off switch froze on, and it started sparking and smoking.....so, back it goes. This one lasted 34 months, which is over 3 times as long as the first one. Maybe you get a better one if you go the warranty replacement route.

postInfo: ['Reviewed in the United States on November 6, 2017']
text: Good while it works! :: I am having the same problem as other reviewers. I love this dryer as it s one of the few basic dryers left on the market, the new kind with those ionic or tourmaline features do the opposite of what it s supposed to do and makes my hair staticky and fly away! So I have been happy in the past as this one usually hast about two years and then starts to rattle a bit and overheat, so for the price I just replace it with a new one. However the last one only lasted 7 months and then the on/off toggle switch got stuck on and then broke completely. I did order a new one as I didn t want to wait with the hassle of getting it fixed under the warranty and pay the shipping etc. so if this one doesn t last my expected 2 years I will not replace it.

postInfo: ['Reviewed in the United States on July 22, 2017']
text: Great hair dryer if you clean the vents. :: I've had 2 of these hair dryers. They generate plenty of heat, they're incredibly light, and they have functioned properly for many years. However, please note: periodically you must remove the lint that accumulates around the vents, otherwise, the hair dryer will overheat. To clean the vents, I just use the hose from my vacuum.

postInfo: ['Reviewed in the United States on December 29, 2016']
text: Great hair dryer :: While on vacation at a resort in the mountains, this was the dryer provided in the bathroom. My wife commented about how well it worked and how much better it was than her larger, bulkier one. She used it instead of the one she packed and she NEVER uses hotel hair dryers and packs her own because "they're always junk". Figured I'd look it up and was surprised at how inexpensive it was so bought it. I've always had a military haircut so know nothing about hair dryers - assumed they all blow warm air and are all the same. Apparently not and being much more powerful AND smaller to pack AND lighter to hold is a big plus for a hair dryer. I like the 'old school' flip switches and color coding. Very intuitive to use. Not that any could be very hard to figure out how to operate, but you just glance at this and in 1 sec are an 'expert' on how it works. Been in use daily now for several months and still works great. This is much better than the typical ones you see at large retailers.

postInfo: ['Reviewed in the United States on December 26, 2015']
text: Good while it lasted-- but it didn't. :: I ordered this after my similarly-styled over-25-year-old Conair finally died. I used another Conair for two years until it also died. This one lasted only 14 months before the power switch developed a high resistance contact, heated-up, and melted the ABS plastic lever. The switches seem to be of poor quality. I actually fixed mine, though it took me probably a couple of hours to take it apart, unsolder the switch, take the switch apart, melt the ABS plastic with my solder reflow hot air gun (the hole had elongated), redrill the hole for the springed metal pin which activates the contact strip, and re-assemble everything. That took way too long, but I did not spend any of my taxable earned income. I learned a couple things, but I didn't cross anything off my honey-do list that Saturday. If it happens again in fourteen months, I'll probably replace it with a non-matching but electrically overrated similar switch. Sorry, I should have taken pictures! I really wouldn't expect normal people to be willing or able to fix their hair dryer, so it may be best to avoid this model. Ergonomically, I like it a lot, but hairdryers in general may have contributed to my not being able to hear frequencies above 9.7 KHz at age 55, although that frequency seems quite high enough to me...

postInfo: ['Reviewed in the United States on October 2, 2013']
text: Much better than the others :: Update: Aug 24, 2019 -It's about 2.5 years since replacement and another six months since last update. It is still going strong. Thanks Andis!!!UPDATE: Jan 29, 2019 -We got the replacement from last update (Mar 2017). The replacement works very well for the duration: close to 2-year. We lost our confidence from the failed unit. But the replacement rebuilt our confidence in the brand. Good Job, Andis!! And thanks.UPDATE: March 7, 2017 -After 3 and half years, the switch failed. Contacted Andis to inquire warranty service about a month ago. Defective was delivered to Andis on Feb 16. Cost me 10 bucks. Received replacement on March 1st. So far so good.Originally reviewed on Oct 2, 2013:We bought this because the old hair dryer died.The old one was noisy and felt flimsy although it was cheap.Size -It's compact and not as big as the others. While it's not as compact as folding hair dryers, it's not much bigger.Construction -It feels sturdy and stronger, not flexed. It's very well constructed. It also feels like it can last a lifetime. :)Noise -It's so much quieter than other high power hair dryers. You don't have to shout to be heard. :)Button Layout -All the buttons are in the right place. Easy to understand and easy to use.I don't like the others that you can push a button to get temporary cool air. It's confusing and requires extra effort / finger to use.Usage -When we got the new one, we tried it out and we like it very much!! It's much better than all those high power hair dryers.Yes, the max power output (wattage) is less than other 1850. But it's plenty for my thinning hair and wify's full hair.As far as longevity goes, we only have it a few weeks. With the solid construction, I feel it's going to last for a long time.

postInfo: ['Reviewed in the United States on August 4, 2015']
text: Love! :: Like a lot of reviewers said, I first used this hair dryer at a luxury hotel. I loved it so much that I immediately ordered one when I got home. This thing packs a punch for how small it is! I have thick wavy hair that is almost to my lower back. It used to take me at least 45 minutes to dry my hair (I use a diffuser) and it was still damp underneath because my dryer sucked my hair up like crazy, it was horrible. It takes maybe 20 now and I can actually dry it all over, even with my head upside down! Hasn't sucked my hair into it even once. My diffuser fits really well because the barrel is shorter, it helps focus the heat much better than my old one. It's also really lightweight, which is great because of how much hair I have, my arm doesn't feel like it's gonna fall off. I am so happy I bought this.

postInfo: ['Reviewed in the United States on February 8, 2020']
text: Switches fail :: This is a Great hair dryer EXCEPT..... I purchased 2 of these at different times and probably left a good review when I made the 2nd purchase in April 2019 as I loved the first dryer so much. It is now 10 months after the 2nd purchase and the infamous off/on switch has locked up. My 1st dryer lasted for years before the off/on switch failed. I only got 10 months out of the replacement, so sorry - won't be buying this one again. It's a shame because I loved so many things about this dryer: the air flow and temperature of the dryer was great for my baby fine, straight hair. Too bad they don't wise up and put quality switches in this product!!!

postInfo: ['Reviewed in the United States on September 4, 2015']
text: I would never buy another one like this. Burned my hand and I felt lucky ... :: I purchased this hair dryer on April 21, 2014 and it died on Sep 3, 2015. I was drying my hair when the handle became red hot. I tried to turn off the dryer, but the on/off switch was stuck in the on position, so I had to pull the cord from the wall to get it to turn off. The switch was still stuck on "on" when I threw the dryer away. I would never buy another one like this. Burned my hand and I felt lucky it did not catch fire while I was holding it. To clarify, it never smelled hot or burning and I did like the size and (light) weight features. I always used it on the low setting. But in the end, one minute it worked fine, the next it just burnt up.

postInfo: ['Reviewed in the United States on February 28, 2019']

postInfo: ['Reviewed in the United States on August 9, 2012']
text: I had three of these. They averaged about 6 months each or $42 (3x13.99) for 18 months of use. :: This is a basic somewhat compact blow dryer that worked well in the beginning. As described it has two blower speeds and two heat settings and that's it. The cord is a decent length without being too long or too short. If anything the high speed blower setting might be too fast, but it's not a big problem. However, I have had three of these , so read the updates.Update#1: After 3 months the first one is still blowing and going. Came back and ordered another. Nothing but good things to say about this little hair dryer.Update# 2: June 17, 2013: The first of two dryers I bought like this one stopped working today. It lasted about 10 months before the off/on switch smoked and went limp. It flops back and forth completely useless. Not as much of a bargain as I thought at first. But, I am ordering another and writing this bad switch off as bad luck. My 3rd one is on the way.Update #3: In less than 4 months the second hair dryer quit. That is 2 of the three we own. I am not buying a fourth one.Update #4: The third dryer has quit. Not one of the three lasted more than 10 months. It is not worth the hassle to return these cheap hair dryers. The cost of shipping both ways is more than buying a new one. Three hairdryers in just over a year all bought here on Amazon. The one I used the longest lasted 10 months. Andis is not a quality hair dryer in fact to me it is the definition of "too cheap to be true" junk.

postInfo: ['Reviewed in the United States on April 30, 2014']
text: Good value at ~14 bucks for the white one :: Small and light weight. Quiet, relative to our old one which was loud through the bathroom door. On low fan speed, it's very quiet, especially with the bathroom door closed. Good value at ~14 bucks for the white one. Black one is 22 bucks for some reason.UPDATE: After ~14 months, the on/off switch started to malfunction. It's sticky and engages sometimes but mostly doesn't. Knocking off a star from 4-star to 3-star. This apparently is a common complaint. I took it apart to see if anything can be done but the flip switch itself needs to be replaced and I haven't found a suitable replacement since no part number is indicated. For the price, I'll probably just buy another because it's what works best for us in terms of power, quiet and weight.

postInfo: ['Reviewed in the United States on October 8, 2018']
text: Good hairdryer but didn't last :: I bought my Andis Prostyle 1600 hairdryer in January 2018. And liked it. It was quieter than my old one and dried my hair quickly. Oct 1st, 2018, nine months later while using in a hotel, I smelled smoke, turned it off and used the hotel's dryer to finish. When I got home, it seemed to work on two speeds, (as before), but the high speed was more like a 'medium' speed between the original low and high - too low to be useful. And it makes a funny, little rattle noise I don't believe it had before. And the price has gone up almost 50 percent. I'll probably buy one more but if it, too, doesn't last a year, I'll be looking elsewhere.

postInfo: ['Reviewed in the United States on May 9, 2016']
text: Worthless Junk. Save your money and buy something that will last more than a few days! :: I've never left a one-star review on this site before, but there's a first time for everything! And the trust is, I'd give it zero stars if that were possible.This dryer got exactly three uses. Count'em: One, Two, Three. And on that third, the motor went kaput, never to return. postInfo: ['Reviewed in the United States on March 6, 2019']
text: LOVE this hairdryer. :: I used one in Aruba on vacation and it works great! It dries fast and blows. once hot air and cool air, low and full blast. I find it better than the $200 high end dryer I was using, so I sold the on Ebay.

postInfo: ['Reviewed in the United States on February 17, 2014']
text: One of Two Great Hair Dryers in Existence :: I had the same hair dryer for over a decade, and it was the best, until one day it finally stopped working, and after so many years it no longer exists, so I couldn't buy another one.I have long hair that takes forever to dry. I needed something powerful with a long barrel.(Short hair dryers suck stray strands of long hair into the side and then snag and shred the hair.)I found two hair dryers that looked like they might be as good as my old one. I bought both, hoping that at least one would work. Then I could return the other. To my surprise they both worked. So I decided to keep both of them, and in another decade, when one breaks, I will have a spare.The two hair dryers are:Andis 40055 Pro Style 1600 Watt Hair Dryer andHelen of Troy 6094 Turbo Styling Dryer.

postInfo: ['Reviewed in the United States on January 8, 2013']
text: Great hair dryer and a great price :: We picked this hair dryer when the old one died because this one has three heat settings instead of just two. Most other hair dryers have only really low power (~400 watts) and full power. Well nowadays the full power setting can blow breakers in places where there is only 15 amp service. It is so nice to have a medium power level in places where you aren't sure if you won't blow a breaker (or when you don't want to fry your hair) but you also don't want to spend forever drying long hair on low power. Well this one has three heat settings.The switches on this are very easy to use while you are drying your hair.This pistol style is a little large but it is still pretty easy to handle. And it doesn't seem to overheat like our older, smaller sized unit used to (probably the reason why it eventually just burned out.

postInfo: ['Reviewed in the United States on November 19, 2011']
text: Best hairdryer I have ever owned. :: I have finely textured, shoulder-length hair, but a lot of it, so it seems to take forever to dry it. My old dryer was pretty heavy, so much so my shoulder would begin to hurt before I could finish. This past August, I stayed at the Courtyard by Marriott while moving my son into his college dorm. Having to pack lightly for myself, I counted on using whatever dryer the hotel provided. When I saw how small the Andis Pro Style 1600 dryer in the hotel room was, I was skeptical of its power. I was pleasantly surprised! In addition to being lightweight, it was very effective. I remarked to my husband at how quickly I was able to dry my hair (even with the Florida humidity) and that I wanted one of the dryers. Since I could get it on Amazon for $13.99, I thought what the heck, I won't be gambling too much if it doesn't work.I have been using it at least 3 times a week for the last 9 weeks or so without any problems. My dogs did not like it when we used the old dryer on them after a bath, but it is almost as if they like this one! Of course, I do wonder how long a $14 hairdryer will last, but my hairstylist told me Andis is a very reputable brand. Regardless, it has been worth every penny. Highly recommend!

postInfo: ['Reviewed in the United States on September 23, 2019']
text: It is what it is :: Like others, I ve owned 2 of these in the past, and each failed within about 1-2 years due to overheating and then switch fail. My bathroom outlet can t handle more than 1600 Watts or it trips the breaker. For a lower wattage dryer, nothing else compares to this one. It s powerful, fast, and compact - easy to handle and travel with. This time around, I ll try to be more responsible and keep the vents cleaned regularly.

postInfo: ['Reviewed in the United States on March 26, 2011']
text: Still excellent after years of use :: This is an excellent dryer! It is dependable and delivers the temperatures I expect, but the main reason I chose this model is that the classic squirrel-cage blower produces great air flow. I was never satisfied with the wimpy blowers on most of the other styles.I bought two of these from Amazon a few years ago. Two, because I thought such an inexpensive dryer might not last long very long and buying the pair was a better bargain because the order qualified for free shipping. The second one is still in the box awaiting its turn; the first one hasn't failed yet.I see several comments here about travel. While this dryer is more compact than many of the bulky styling dryers, it is neither dual voltage (switchable) nor universal voltage (auto-converting), so pack a converter if you carry it overseas. I use a smaller, folding, dual-voltage model for travel (then find that all the hotels have built-ins anyway).

text: Worth it.. :: I have been using this product for nearly a month now. From a guy perspective I think this product is really great. I use this product since my hair is quite long and for some personal reason I don't like to dry my hair using my towel. Anyway, the best thing about this hair dryer is that it dries my hair really fast and also produce low noise. Well, if you use the high air mode, the noise is quite loud but much tolerable than other products I have used. Basically I just used the low air mode since the noise is low and it isn't too hot.Furthermore, when you first use this product, it will have a burning metal smell (like soldering smell). However, after 3-4 times of use the smell will be gone. The smell won't stick on your hair though, so it isn't a big deal. This hair dryer is light which I think is a plus.

postInfo: ['Reviewed in the United States on October 5, 2013']
text: Works well but doesn't last :: I've owned two of these hair dryers. I like their performance, and the fact they're not as noisy as others.The first one lasted quite a few years, and eventually died when it overheated because the air intakes got clogged with hair and lint. I'll take credit for that failure.The second one I bought in July of 2012 and it just died (October 2013), NOT because of anything I did. For a while now the handle has been getting hot, and yesterday some smoke came out of the handle and now the heat hi/lo switch is stuck in the "hi" position. It's clear the switch has failed, at least partially, and I don't feel the unit is safe to use.So I'm ordering another one and we'll see how it goes. If it only lasts a year I'll be looking for a different model next time.UPDATE 3/2015: The new one failed too at the ripe old age of a year and a half. Same problem, a switch quit working. I've got to think most of the people who rate these things highly haven't owned them for very long as they just don't hold up. Which is a bummer because they're decent hair dryers when they work!

postInfo: ['Reviewed in the United States on October 27, 2019']
text: Could be a great dryer if manufacturer would make a few modifications :: I think that this dryer is basically very good. As with other customers, I discovered it while staying at hotels. I figured they must have researched it enough to know it would last. Not sure how it is working out for the hotels, be I figure mine last about 3 years. I purchased my first one about 6 years ago, it broke and was replaced by the manufacturer (under the 5 year warranty). Unfortunately, the replacement didn't last more than 3 years, so here I am purchasing a replacement. Again, as other customers indicated, the power switch failed in both units. In the first one, the dryer just wouldn't power on. The second one was a little more dramatic with heat and smoke. My final point is a "pet peeve" that I have with blow dryers in general (and this one is no exception). In my opinion, all blow dryers should have a 3 position heat switch (cool, warm, hot) and 3 position speed switch (low, medium and high) in addition to the power switch. I would even accept an "off, low, high" speed switch (which remove the need for a power switch).

text: love, love love this blowdryer! :: I tried this blowdryer at Kimpton Hotels in San Francisco-- forgive me -- it blew mind!!!! I have long curly hair that I straighten as I blowdry using a large metal brush. Normally, this is a 20-30 minute painstakingly long process. This blowdryer reduced my drying time to 7 minutes!! 7 minutes!!!! The hot air is VERY HOT, the high speed is VERY HIGH. I loved this product so much I texted myself the name of it and bought it when I got home. Can't say enough... It does overheat, so if you turn it off between sections of hair or something... you might have to wait until it cools a little. But to save 15-20 minutes of my life from blowdrying hell, it's worth it!!

postInfo: ['Reviewed in the United States on December 6, 2015']
text: but I'd like to think it's slightly less damaging than turbo blasting ... :: I bought this about 18 months ago. I'm not too particular about hair dryers. I just expect them to dry hair when I want them to. Ours doesn't get much use, maybe 4-5 times a month. It seems to take forever to get anyone's hair dry, but I'd like to think it's slightly less damaging than turbo blasting hot air at my head. I kept using it, just being mildly annoyed at how long it took compared to my $20 Conair that kicked the bucket, forcing this purchase. If I would have reviewed this last year, I probably would have given it 4 stars.But now the stupid thing will work until you shut it off and then won't start again until it cools off for 10-20 minutes. It's obviously going to croak. I'm not sure if there will be flames. I'm anxious to see how it plays out. Obviously this isn't ideal, but even if it wasn't in the midst of dying, it now adds an extra hour to blow dry my 3 daughters' hair before bed. I'm searching for a replacement and it won't be another one of these.

text: Made for quick use. :: I like the compact size and being able to have high heat with a low blower speed. That said, this is not a robust dryer. It is made for short hair styling. If you run this on high consistently it will die. I still love it, I just have to keep my wife s hands off it.

postInfo: ['Reviewed in the United States on August 29, 2015']
text: Love the soft grip on this dryer. :: I originally used this dryer in a hotel when we were visiting Savannah, GA. I tried to buy it from the hotel but they did not have them for sale. After my dryer died, I found this on line. Funny though because there were limited numbers of them out there, which makes me think everyone who has tried one, has been buying them.I would say I love it but when I turn on the dryer it makes a noise, as if something has broken loose in the dryer and is rattling around. Always just worries me that one day it'll just take a poof and die on me. The other negative is the air "return" where air is sucked in ... tends to suck my hair in and it tangles in the fan itself. postInfo: ['Reviewed in the United States on March 4, 2013']
text: Just What I Wanted :: Notice how your favorite blow dryer always croaks at an inconvenient moment? I needed something small, something with less than 1800 watts, and I needed it quick. I was skeptical at first, but I ended up liking it a lot. Note that it does not come with a concentrator attachment. I would recommend this product.Follow-up: I bought one for me, then another for my dog. It gets five stars for the first few months only. Both dryers now have stuck switches, and you can't change the temp settings. They have a very short life. Now, I have to go find two more dryers. I think I will stick to a name brand, and just pay a little more. I would not recommend this item if you expect it to lasts reasonable period of time.

postInfo: ['Reviewed in the United States on August 18, 2009']
text: Light, Compact Dryer with High Velocity Output :: I bought this hair dryer after using the same model at a hotel recently. What I like best about this dryer is that it puts out a high volume of air, not just super hot air. This unit uses the 'old school' style of blower like the dryers of the 1970s and 80s. I'd forgotten how much more air this kind of dryer puts out and it seems that the higher velocity of air dries my hair much faster than the more modern style of high heat / low velocity dryers commonly found now. It's also nice to have the option of controlling both the blower speed and heat level. The dryer is very light weight and easy to handle and control. My chief complaint is that the unit I received seems to have considerably more vibration transferred to the hand than the unit I used at the hotel. Overall, I am pleased with the product.UPDATE September 2011: About six months ago, after about a year and a half of use, the dryer still works but started making a loud squeaking / grinding sound when the motor runs at high speed. The noise is in conjunction with the excessive vibration I reported 2 years ago when it was new. While the dryer still technically works, it's unpleasant to use as the noise is annoying and quite loud. Because of questions regarding the durability of the product, I am lowering the rating.

postInfo: ['Reviewed in the United States on July 11, 2016']
text: Very nice hair drier :: I purchased this hair drier for my wife about two months ago, I waited to be sure that it was up to her standards. My wife is a retired hairdresser and is extremely fussy when it comes to her hair tools; she wouldn t hesitate to pay more than $100.00 for a pair of scissors.Her reasons for choosing this product:1) Compact size, easy to hold and maneuver.2) She feels that its 1600 watts is the ideal power level for a handheld hair drier.3) Another higher powered drier was purchased a few months ago, she hated it.4) She used similar driers in the past and was satisfied with them.After 2 months of use:This hair drier has met or exceeded all of her expectations. She is very happy with the purchase.

postInfo: ['Reviewed in the United States on March 13, 2015']
text: Good snow machine preheater :: I don't know why they call this thing a hair dryer... it is a snow machine preheater. Used it last night outside at around 0 degrees. We have had some warmer weather just before some -20 weather that caused some condensation in the fuel. Placed this under my cowling pointed at my carbs, closed the cowling and about ten minutes later had a smoothly running machine. Granted, the cord is not a cold weather cord and became rather stiff, but so far I am very satisfied. Those of you who want to dry your hair outside in the winter... this will do the job.

postInfo: ['Reviewed in the United States on September 13, 2012']
text: Works good so far :: I purchased two of the hairdryers on Aug 12th, and today is Sept. 13th so they are only one month old. I have been careful to sort of break in the first one by using low power for a minute before going to high power and then to switch to low power when I am finished before turning off. I was concerned since several reviews stated that they had problems with the unit failing after using it only for a short time. So far I am very pleased with my purchase and am considering buying two more to keep as reserves. It is almost impossible to buy 1600 W dryers now and even harder to find dryers than have the side mounted motors and fans which I like. The new 1875 W dryers can cause circuit breakers to trip and I don't feel we need that much heat on our hair. We must all remember that in this economy everyone is trying to cut costs, and that pertains to hairdryers as well as everything else. Anything we can do to reduce the shock to a new appliance can possibly lengthen the life of the product. Nothing lasts as long as they used to as we have found with clothes washers and dryers, refrigerators, dish washers, AC units etc. However, so far, I am extremely pleased with this hairdryer. Hopefully that will stay the same for months ahead.

postInfo: ['Reviewed in the United States on March 5, 2020']

postInfo: ['Reviewed in the United States on March 18, 2015']

postInfo: ['Reviewed in the United States on December 21, 2011']
text: Really great little hair dryer :: I got this to replace a broken cheap Conair. I was torn between getting another Conair with retractable cord or this one. The airflow is a little less than my old one (on high) which means that I have more control. I would rate the airflow on high as somewhere between a medium and high on most hair dryers, and I like that speed. It seems to dry my hair relatively fast. I am not sorry I bought it. Also, it got here REALLY FAST! I love Amazon Prime.

postInfo: ['Reviewed in the United States on September 15, 2008']
text: from a cosmotoligists point of view :: I am tired of paying 85 dollars and up for a "professional" hairdryer that never seems to last more than 9 mos, is heavy with a bulky desighn and never fails to trip my breaker(usually more than once) while blow drying a client.(p.s, stay away from hot tools, ive had 3 of them in 2 &1/2 years)the shipping was FAST, and although the dryer itself is of a smaller scale,it has more blowing power than I expected for its small size, its nice and light and easy to handle, it has yet to trip my breaker at work, its perfect for young girls who are just learning to manuver a blowdryer,and of course, the price is gReat, at this rate I could go through 3 a year and not spend what I normally would on another............DOWNSIDE is that the cord is short, its just a touch noisier than I would prefer, and I have dropped it once and the seam eria where the blowdryer is put together has come apart a little, BUT ITS STILL RUNNING!! THIS IS A GREAT PRODUCT FOR THE MONEY, i WOULD BUY AGAIN!

text: Terrible! :: I ordered this Hair Dryer after I fell in love with one at a hotel that said Andis 1600. Obviously, this wasn't the same hair dryer. text: Going to order a second one. Because I'm now walking too far to use this one. :: I'm pretty lazy. I will avoid excess walking at most costs. postInfo: ['Reviewed in the United States on October 5, 2013']
text: Great dryer, poor quality :: I first used one of these dryers in a hotel while on vacation and liked it so well I ordered one on the spot on my laptop. This was December 2012. I used the dryer without problems until August 2013 when the handle started getting hot while I was drying my hair. This continued for about the next eight times I used it. The last time the dryer handle heated up so much you couldn't comfortably hold it. I shut it off, and pulled the plug from the outlet. The on/off control had frozen in the off position and the dryer was inoperable. I contacted Andis, and they sent a replacement dryer. I took delivery of the replacement dryer September 15, 2013.I used the replacement dryer about three times and the handle started heating up, same situation as the last one, the on/off switch froze and the dryer was useless. I just sent that dryer back for a replacement. I give the dryer one star, Andis Corporation five stars for customer service. They have a five year warranty on these dryers and they sent the first replacement quickly. They will send a second replacement at no cost to me (the first return cost $10.00 to send the dryer back). Hopefully the second replacement will last a couple of years. I am suspicious though because the same problem developed in the second dryer, only quicker. My concern is that if one would leave the dryer turned off, but plugged in to the wall outlet, would it overheat on its own and start a fire? Oh, and FYI I don't have thick waist length hair. It is shoulder length and average thickness. These dryers were getting light use when they malfunctioned.

postInfo: ['Reviewed in the United States on November 7, 2017']
text: Lasted 7 Years--Solid Otherwise :: I really like this hairdryer. I'm not sure how it seems so different than most hairdryers, but It is a good dryer. I like the way the blowing nozzle is fairly narrow and forceful. Of course, you can turn it down if you want less force. The hi and lo heat and fan combinations are helpful for that. Also, it is not an overly bulky unit. My dryer lasted almost 7 years before the switch broke. Otherwise, it was still in really good shape and worked well. 7 years might seem like a long time, but considering my parents still have a hairdryer from over 30 years ago, I don't consider 7 very long. It is a shame for a nice unit to die simply due to a cheap switch. But we do live in a disposable, not very green, society. And I will be purchasing another...but then maybe that's the plan.

postInfo: ['Reviewed in the United States on June 14, 2010']
text: PERFECT! The best hair dryer EVER :: I encountered this hair dryer at a luxury hotel. I (AND a friend who was staying at the same hotel) fell so in love with it, we both immediately bought one. Here's why:1) POWERFUL. Dries your hair quickly when on top speeds.2) Great speed choices: you can easily switch between high and low for both air and heat.3) Nice size---not too heavy, nor too big and cumbersome to pack along.4) Dries my hair more smoothly and nice than ANY other hair dryer. Seriously, I can TELL the difference between using this hair dryer and the one in my second bathroom---or any other one, for that matter.5) Has yet to overheat (I hate waiting for cooldown for the dryer to restart!) nor trip the electrical breaker.6) Reasonably quiet (quieter than my old one, anyway). You still won't be able to hear people talking to you unless they shout.7) THE PRICE! All this for under $20!Why would you want to spend more, with all the great reviews on this hair dryer? I've had mine for 4 months now so I can't tell if it will last long-term, but I expect it will last a few years, like my last one (with a little bit of care, such as cleaning the dust off the intake occasionally)---and even if it doesn't, who cares? It is soooo worth the $20!FIVE-MONTH FOLLOWUP: Still love this product---I have noticed when I use other blow dryers my hair doesn't look as good. No problems at all--highly recommended, a real deal for the price.ONE YEAR FOLLOW-UP: I bought a second one of these for my second home. As others have pointed out, it has a short life. The one I bought on Nov 27, 2010 died on Sept 10, 2011---less than a year of service. It just quit mid-dry, one day. That being said, it is such a great blow dryer, and so inexpensive, that I bought another one immediately.

text: BEST BLOW DRYER ON THE PLANET :: I swear to god I spent two weeks researching blow dryers before I settled on this one. I just used this thing for the first time today and shower to straight with a brush took me 6 minutes. I am so beyond pissed at myself for not buying this thing sooner. For the last 10+ years I have been struggling with my hair and this thing knocked it out of the park. I shouldn t be this excited about a hair dryer but dang this thing is a game changer. postInfo: ['Reviewed in the United States on May 19, 2019']
text: Didn t work for me and I couldn t return :: I was trying to find a hair dryer that would work very fast because I have to wash my hair every day and it is such a pain to dry. I was willing to spend extra money for a really good dryer so I decided to give this one a try. Positives: seems well made, has a strong cord and is very hot at high setting. Negatives: it s very heavy and the air tip is too narrow to diffuse well for overall drying so it ended up taking more, rather than less, time for overall drying for me. Despite the reservations noted, I decided to give the dryer a try for a month or so to see if I would get used to it and how to better use it. I kept all of the original packaging for return, which I assumed I could do within the 90 day window of Amazon returns. Ultimately, I found that the dryer was just too heavy for regular use by my 64 year old arthritic hands, despite its overall quality, I was dismayed to find that, unfortunately, this product has a 30 day return period. I will check the return policy more closely in the future as this dryer just doesn t work for me and so it was a costly waste of money.

postInfo: ['Reviewed in the United States on December 2, 2018']
text: Salon quality & quiet for its power! :: {disclaimer: reviewed by my wife}While I always love the way the salon professionally dries my hair after a cut/wash, I always think to myself: "no way I have time for this regularly."The strength of this dryer makes that salon blow-dry a reality! Truly saves half the time!I never treated myself to a quality dryer before, so I really appreciate the nozzle-heads included: one for styling, one for smoothing, and the diffuser. The diffuser is what I start with at the roots of my damp head of hair.I have thick long asian hair & put their advertisement to the test. And I actually could dry majority of my hair (combing in sections, using the smoothing nozzle) in 6-7mins!In addition to the time saved, I'm impressed that the power of this dryer (2200 W, 110v, 60Hz) is quieter than most. The motor isn't blaring in my ear while drying. I also LOVE the air temperature control! (so that my face isn't sweaty after I'm done blow-drying).Bottom-line: worth it!

postInfo: ['Reviewed in the United States on October 26, 2018']
text: Fast drying, extra large diffuser :: This hairdryer is amazing. What used to take me 10 minutes to dry my hair has been decreased to around 5 minutes. My hair even seems to be shinier and less frizzy. I have curly hair so I like the large diffuser adapter. It lets just enough air out to dry my hair without making it frizzy. It also has 2 other attachments but I don't use them. My husband used to complain about how loud my old hairdryer was. This morning he didn't complain at all or wake up from the noise. I also like that there is a cooling button so when the hairdryer gets too hot, I can push the button and then it's instantly cool. I was surprised how light it is. Whenever I opened up the box the hairdryer was rather large but when I picked it up, it was light. The cord is pretty long so you don't have to be right up against the wall trying to dry your hair. You have room to move away from the wall. I recommend purchasing this hairdryer!!!

postInfo: ['Reviewed in the United States on May 15, 2019']
text: Best hair dryer I have ever used! :: Better than so many other home and salon hair dryers I have used!!! Even though some hair dryers say they have the same wattage, it doesn't mean they have the same blowing power. I am so glad I bought this Sabuy hair dryer, which can dry my waist-long hair within minutes. Not to mention it's so much quieter! - Its 2200w motor is so powerful that I don't want to use any home used hair dryers. I threw away my Revlon 1875w dryer away immediately, and I was not happy with my Revlon one-step airbrush, as it doesn't give as much shine as this blow dryer can to my hair. - Better than John 2200w hair dryer (~$60). Their features are almost the same - same motor wattage, same blowing power, but the Sabuy one came with more concentrator/ diffuser. Also, the John one is super loud, and the vibration of the motor makes my arm sore when blow drying my hair.- As good as my Solano Supersolano 3600 Ion (~$229) and the Sabuy one might be slightly quieter. Everything else is pretty similar, but the Sabuy one is just 1/6 of the price.

text: Buy it :: Do not waste time reading reviews just buy it. The size, weight, strength, color, added tools! It has it all. It's a deal for the price. Works very well I have thick long hair and it works drying it out, and the comb attachment helps straighten my curls out.

postInfo: ['Reviewed in the United States on October 24, 2018']
text: Love this! :: You never know how bad something is until it breaks and you have to replace it! I had the same hair dryer for 7-8 years and it finally died. I had a moment of silence for it... it did a good job. I ordered this one based off the reviews and based off of knowing the "Conair" name. It didn't disappoint! Its so much lighter than my old one, my oldie was as heavy as a brick it felt like. My hair is thick and below my bra strap, it dries it completely in just a few minutes! The cord is short but long enough for me and where I have to plug it into. VERY, VERY happy with this purchase!

postInfo: ['Reviewed in the United States on December 2, 2014']
text: A good moderately priced blow dryer :: I wanted to correct some misinformation that has been posted in other reviews. This blow dryer has two speeds and off not three speeds as some have reported. It does have three heat settings so you don't have to hold in the button to get the cool setting. This is a big advantage for me over other dryers that only have two heat settings. It has good blowing power without being too noisy. I have been using this dryer for over a year and have not had any problems with it. There is a removable filter that is easy to take off and clean.

postInfo: ['Reviewed in the United States on March 27, 2018']
text: Works great! :: This is on the small side for a full size blow dryer, but that just makes it easier to store. In the photo I ve shown it compared to my daughter s full size and a small, travel size dryer. Regardless of size, this Conair dryer works great. It blows a good amount of air and gets the job done. I do wish it were a little hotter on the high heat setting, but honestly, I feel that way about most hair dryers, since my hair is wavy and thick. I just couldn t feel much of a difference between the warm and hot settings. I am still able to dry my hair relatively quickly with this. I like how the control levers are right under my thumb, so I can quickly change a setting or turn it off without looking. Also, I LOVE how this dryer looks! The high polish chrome and the black with a touch of glitter are very sleek. I would definitely purchase this hair dryer again, especially since it only cost around $20!

postInfo: ['Reviewed in the United States on September 27, 2017']
text: Good replacement for me :: I always use Conair hair dryers and have noticed that the weaker air flow models dry my hair faster. I m not sure why that is, but it s proven true with three different models. I had the Infiniti Pro model that I just accidentally dropped the plug into the toilet so I decided to replace it with this one. All the reviews saying it s not very strong is true. The other model has the some output numbers but blows harder, but not as hot as this model. It dries my hair quite a bit faster than my old one. I have pretty long hair so the faster it dries, the happier I am. I m pretty happy with it. It s also a lot lighter than my old one, which is nicer to my wrist. Not a deal breaker or anything, it s just a nice bonus.

postInfo: ['Reviewed in the United States on July 29, 2017']
text: I liked this hairdryer :: I liked this hairdryer, it worked well, it only for 1 year. After 1 year it wasn't strong at all. We called the company, it has a 2 year warranty, however I'd have to pay to send it back and also pay for shipping of replacement. I only paid $18 for it, so i was not going to pay $10 for shipping fees. Very disappointed!!

postInfo: ['Reviewed in the United States on May 8, 2017']
text: Already died :: I bought this less than 2 months ago. It literally died on me already. Went to plug it in and it wouldn't turn on. Tried different plugs, the reset button, nothing worked. This thing does not last. And I missed my "return window" by a week :(

postInfo: ['Reviewed in the United States on July 4, 2016']
text: Almost the perfect dryer! :: I'm used to the hot setting being just a little hotter, and am not able to adjust it. I honestly cannot tell the difference between the hot and the warm temperatures. But I LOVE that I can adjust the speed separately from the temperature, and I don't think I can ever be satisfied with anything less. Weight is not too heavy, and it's not too large to pack in my suitcase. Goodbye dinky travel blow driver!

postInfo: ['Reviewed in the United States on May 25, 2018']
text: Classic Conair! :: Was in search of a new hairdryer as the one I had (a Conair) for a very long time finally stopped working. I've used Conair products for many years and was partial to select another Conair product, but open to see what else is on the market; any new, contemporary products. Eventualy narrowed it down to 2 choices. I'm very satisfied with this product I selected; an ideal choice! Hairdryer is sleek, lightweight (relatively speaking), powerful, stylish, easy controls, very efficient and effective! I've even started using the special 'cool' buttont for enhanced styling/setting. This product is also reasonably priced. I highly recommend for yourself and/or a gift to family member or other! Happy hairblowing days ahead! Enjoy!

postInfo: ['Reviewed in the United States on February 10, 2019']
text: ALCI safety feature, test & reset buttons function very poorly :: First time I used this, after reading instructions carefully & several trials & errors, turned on & worked well. Next time (several weeks later, no change in conditions, stored safely), I've been unable to get it to turn on at all. Instructions say to unplug, reset, test & try again, but no matter what combination of moves (just reset or test & reset, or sockets I use, unplugging & replugging each time, power won't come on. This is apparently a problem for other people, too. Instructions then just say to return it to an authorized dealer. I've gone back to my 35 year old GE super-pro.

postInfo: ['Reviewed in the United States on March 11, 2019']
text: Great dryer for the money BUT......... :: Since I posted below, Amazon has graciously shipped me a new one after having horrible customer service by Conair. I m hoping it lasts much longer. Thanks Amazon!Well, I loved this product at first. It was lightweight and dried my hair fast. However, it has been less than two months and it has stopped heating completely. Only cool air blows and now I can t return it because I am passed my 2/9/19 window for returns according to Amazon. I am so mad about this purchase.

postInfo: ['Reviewed in the United States on September 21, 2017']
text: Really works. I'm shocked. :: Wow. Just wow. I have long hair down to the middle of my back and it's wavy and thick. I have, for years, either allowed my hair to air dry up in a ponytail or I would blow dry it and then flat iron it. It took FOREVER. I used this dryer for the first time today and my hair was silky, smooth and pin straight with no flat iron. I can't believe it. Love it!!!

postInfo: ['Reviewed in the United States on September 7, 2019']
text: Good Budget Hair Dryer! :: PROS: Black color has a nice glossy, aesthetic look Lightweight and has a comfortable handle Dedicated cool heat setting switch as well as a manual cool button for versatility unlike other hair dryers with only a cool button that has to be held Good blowing power without being too noisy Smaller than average hair dryers, making it easy for travel storage Concentrator nozzle snaps on and takes off easily Easy removal filter (push in and twist) to cleanCONS: Small heat difference between warm and hot settings Power cord is shorter (5 ft) than other average sized hair dryersUSEFUL INFO: 3 heat settings: cool, warm, hot 1 dedicated cool button for momentary cool air Lower the expectations, and don't expect a budget priced hair dryer to provide the same powerful airflow as a normal sized one

postInfo: ['Reviewed in the United States on January 5, 2014']
text: FANTASTIC !!!!!!!!!! :: I have had Conair dryers before and loved them and have had $100-$200 ones and I would pick the Conair every time. I saw some people say it was not as powerful as they would have liked and I don't know if they were using a leaf blower to dry their hair or what (LOL) but this blow dryer is fantastic. I have long thick hair and I love the 3 speed/3 drying temps and it dried it very fast with plenty of power, Also like the facts that it is lightweight, easy to handle and has the removable lint option. I would give it a 10 out of 10. And for the price you can't beat it ;)

postInfo: ['Reviewed in the United States on May 28, 2018']
text: Only 3 stars because of a short cord... otherwise it could have been 5 ***** :: Has a nice sleek look. Even a "pro" look because of the black and chrome color scheme I suppose........The multiple heat settings are most assuredly a nice feature also..... BUT THE CORD....... DAMN THE SHORT CORD, LOL The cord for this dryer is hardly 5'. I did not measure.. .. I dont need to measure exactly for me to know I wish it was longer. And no swivel. Honestly not sure if hair dryers normally do swivel, but I do know that would have made the cord length less noticeable.As usual, I didnt keep the packaging, so I'll be using a SHORT CORD for my foreseeable future... (my luck, this dryer will last 5 years, haha!)

postInfo: ['Reviewed in the United States on August 21, 2017']
text: Stopped working after 6 months :: Currently writing this review with wet hair at 1 a.m. feeling extremely unhappy :-) I bought this blow dryer six months ago to replace an old Conair dryer I'd had for years and years. The old dryer started giving out and the inside would light up with a bright, fiery ring. So, it was time for a new one. I was very pleased with this blow dryer since I've had it, but now tonight it randomly stopped working! The dryer that I've had for SIX MONTHS did the same exact thing as the blow dryer I had for 5+ years!!! I turned it on and it made a wheezing sound like it wasn't fully powered. It instantly smelled smoky. I looked inside the dryer and sure enough it was lit up with the same fiery ring that my old one did. Please note, this is NOT normal and has not happened once since I've had this dryer. The fiery ring gets so hot it can melt plastic, which surely means it can melt your hair. I tried to reset and test both the blow dryer and the outlet, tried different outlets and the blow dryer continued to do the same thing one or two more times and then eventually just died. It will now not turn on at all. So now I am stuck here at nearly 1 a.m., exhausted with wet hair thanks to this POS hair dryer. Maybe I got a lemon, but I will not be buying another Conair hairdryer. So frustrated and disappointed. Seeing that I've had it less than a year, I feel like there should be some kind of warranty, but I don't see any info on the product page. Sigh

postInfo: ['Reviewed in the United States on April 16, 2019']
text: Proven Conair product but with a design glitch :: In my opinion, Conair makes solid hair dryers period. I've had couple that didn't fail. I had to give them up because they've gotten too dirty over 10 years of use.However this particular item seems to have minor glitch that bothers me.First of all, the front air flow part keeps falling off 2 out of three times as I use. My wife got so irritated and we almost returned it.I'm not sure why because it feels it's very tightly attached, but whenever I pick it up to use, the part keeps falling out.the handle has nice glossy look, but after shower, it grabs moisture in the air very quickly and it's slippery sometimes, and I feel it very uncomfortable handling a wet dryer.Otherwise, it has all the basic features, easy to use and does its job.

postInfo: ['Reviewed in the United States on May 15, 2020']
text: Full-size dryer is fairly quiet and powerful :: In the age of covid19, my hair was getting a bit long and was taking too long to air dry. (It gets wavy and unmanageable when I let it dry by itself when it is long). Doing repair/maintenance work at a vacation home, I wanted to dry my hair better so that it wouldn't bother me while I was working. Had a hair dryer at home, but didn't want to lug that one back and forth. Ordered this one after looking at many reviews of hairdryers. None of the hair dryers get unanimous good reviews. This one had mixed reviews, like the others. But, it seemed to float to the top.The hair dryer does work well. No complaints. It is relatively quiet -- not super loud like those small mini-blow-dryers. The larger full-size dryers should always be expected to be quieter than the small ones. That's why I wanted a full-size dryer. The blower power seems perfectly adequate, and dries my hair quickly. Not too hot, but hot enough for the job. Didn't want to spend a lot of $. This fits the bill. Recommended.(By the way, the one I have at home is about 30 years, maybe 40 years old! It works perfectly. Westminster brand. Made in Japan! That's how old it is! Made in Japan!)

postInfo: ['Reviewed in the United States on April 26, 2019']
text: Does what it is supposed to do... :: If there was a 4 and a half stars I would have entered that. It's a blow dryer, it blows hot, warm, cool and in two speeds. My previous dryer had more oompf but not the multi temps so one loss and one gain. Cord is a reasonable length.If you are buying it for the sparkle finish (I didn't), don't get your hopes up. If you were thinking it would show up as this burst of sparkle awesomeness in your videos, you may be disappointed. There is glitter in the plastic part but it does not show up well and not at any distance. Again, not an issue for me since I didn't buy it for the sparkle finish. I only mention it in the spirit of full disclosure.I do have an issue with the plug not fitting tight in the wall socket. If I move around too much it pulls out of the socket. I tried giving the prongs a pinch with my fingers to see if I could make it fit better but they are pretty stiff so no luck there. I will probably give them a little pinch with a pair of pliers.So bottom line, it works, it has temp adjustments (nice) and it gets my hair dry.

postInfo: ['Reviewed in the United States on April 27, 2020']
text: Great little dryer but . . . :: I owned an older version of this model that worked great for nearly 15 years before finally dying. This one works well so far but the cord is much shorter.I'm 6 feet tall, try to dry your hair with your hands over your head with a 6' cord. Works fine if you have an outlet that's waist high or better but not in a conventional wall outlet. The cord on the old dryer was at least 8 feet, I'd pay a couple bucks more for the longer cord if I had to do it over and I may do just that.

postInfo: ['Reviewed in the United States on March 29, 2020']
text: It s great! :: This is an excellent blow dryer! I have hair past my waist, so drying it is time consuming. I don t like a huge dryer and this one is a good medium size. With the concentrator on it s not too big for me to manage. My hair dried quickly and wasn t fried. My one and only complaint is that the cord is SO SHORT!! Sooo short! But whatever. Take the good with the not so good. For the price point and given how well this works it s a total win!

postInfo: ['Reviewed in the United States on March 23, 2020']
text: Good overall but misadvertised :: I kind of like it even though it s a complete mismatch with what I needed and what was in the description. So I m returning it.It will serve good for traveling I guess. But it is NOT full size and it is NOT a professional tool as well, as the stream of air is really weak.

postInfo: ['Reviewed in the United States on March 20, 2019']
text: Well...I m sold! :: I stopped using blow dryers for quite a while because I didn t wanna damage my hair, and because my hair always felt...frizzy after use.I decided to give blow dryers another shot and this one is a GAME CHANGER. I was sold after the first use. Let me start off by saying I have long, very fine hair. So naturally I worry about heat damage (or really any damage). I started off with a nice heat protectant spray, and used this dryer with my head upside down to get the volume I don t naturally have with fine hair. The finished product with this dryer is spot on. My hair has volume and a wonderful softness, without any frizz. My hair is down to about between my shoulder blades and it had it completely dry in 7 minutes.It has the perfect amount of power and a good amount of heat. It s not overly heavy and it s nice and compact, while still packing a punch with its power. Plus it sits at a great price point. I highly recommend this blow dryer!

postInfo: ['Reviewed in the United States on December 9, 2019']
text: Multiple settings with well-thought-out button placement at a nice price! :: If you like drying your hair on less than the hottest setting, this dryer is for you. I have thick hair but prefer the medium setting. The last dryer I had, the buttons weren't buttons but a sort-of flip-tabs, right where I held the dryer. I was constantly accidentally flipping tabs to a different (unwanted) setting. I don't have that problem with this dryer. The buttons don't seem like they will move by accident and they haven't so far. I really enjoy this dryer.

postInfo: ['Reviewed in the United States on March 1, 2018']
text: Upon hearing how well our visitor liked it, I tried it after her leaving :: This was purchased as an additional hairdryer for a guest bathroom. Upon hearing how well our visitor liked it, I tried it after her leaving. It is much better than the hairdryer I have been using! The heat is adjustable, not just the low, medium, high setting. Not to mention, the high-heat setting is actually hot - not just somewhat warm. I'm no stylist, so I'm not super picky, and don't have much reference to what makes an excellent hairdryer, but this is the best I've used!

postInfo: ['Reviewed in the United States on June 12, 2017']
text: Cheap hair dryer with weak air flow :: I've owned a Conair Infiniti for many many years and it finally stopped working. I bought this Conair as the replacement and was not impressed. The air flow is nowhere even close to to my old Conair. It feels just like a hotel hair dryer. I've since purchased the Conair Pro Infiniti which I should've done to begin with as that is the updated version of my old hair dryer. Both hair dryers are 1875 watts, but the Conair Pro Infiniti is so much more powerful. Buy that one instead.

postInfo: ['Reviewed in the United States on June 1, 2018']
text: destroyed my hair :: I was looking for a slightly cheaper ionic hairdryer to replace my other conair ionic that was ceramic and around $35. I moved and was limited on suitcase space (I was flying) so I thought this would be just as good considering it was the same brand and wattage. I was WRONG! This dryer has managed to completely destroy my hair within a couple weeks. It is so dry and unmanageable and falling out! I now have to spend even more money to buy the other model again. If you're in between models to buy, spend the extra $15, trust me!

postInfo: ['Reviewed in the United States on December 18, 2019']
text: Second time ordering... :: This is the second one I ve ordered from here. First one was teal second was black/silver one. As my daughters hair dryer died and she wanted a teal one and took mine. I ve had the teal one for about a yr and all is still good with it. Second go around only couple months now but it did from first use and still does, makes a rattling noise when using it. Not sure what it is but does it s job in drying. Guess we ll see how it lasts.

postInfo: ['Reviewed in the United States on September 27, 2017']
text: Dries fast :: Needed a cheap hair dryer. This does the job really well epically for this price range.

postInfo: ['Reviewed in the United States on October 16, 2019']
text: Didn t Last Long :: I was happy with the functionality of this blow dryer and would have given it four stars since it was fairly powerful and dried well but then in less than a year the blower started overheating. postInfo: ['Reviewed in the United States on January 17, 2020']
text: Looks good, light weight but weak air however quiet noise wise. :: I was surprised based on the reviews and 1875 watt rating how weak the dryer was compared to my very old dryer. Due to the lighter weight I believe I can travel with this dryer better but large size may be an issue for some trips.

postInfo: ['Reviewed in the United States on May 7, 2020']
text: Perfect for wigs and fake hair! :: This hair dryer is perfect! I wear wigs and not all of them are heat resistant... not only does this dryer have a cold blast button, but it has a cool setting so I can wash and dry my wigs without my finger cramping from holding the little blast button!!! It also works great on the regular settings for my real hair!

postInfo: ['Reviewed in the United States on November 10, 2018']
text: JUST A BIT CHEAP LOOKING. :: I thought the materials used for this hair dryer look a bit cheap. The cold air button feels like it could break soon with use! Other than that, it is light-weight and not too loud even on the highest settings. I bought it for a gift so I hope it will last! It is a bit bigger than my own "full size" hair dryer by a couple of inches in width and length. Has a good heavy duty cord. It was labeled "mid size" in one area and full size in another. That needs to be corrected! It is not mid-size! Has good temperature variations and wind speeds.

postInfo: ['Reviewed in the United States on October 8, 2019']
text: Don t even finish reading this review, just buy it! :: I was absolutely blown away (sorry) by this hair dryer. I started off with a $9 revlon blow dryer from Walmart and it has always left my hair dry and frayed just because of how hot it got. The lower heat was still very hot and the cool was just cool. There was no in between.Look, I m just your average joe who styles a modern pompadour with Asian hair sticking up in the back. I needed a blow dryer but I was definitely not going to spend hundreds on a dyson.This one is absolutely perfect and I have no complaints whatsoever. It has a perfect warm setting which I still finish with cool air just so the style holds but my hair is never frizzy and dry anymore because it isn t constantly scorching from the heat of the blow dryer. Also, this one comes with the little flat concentrator attachment which works TREMEDOUSLY on the back of my head as it can focus on the area while not ruining the rest of the hair by blowing just on my cowlick area.

postInfo: ['Reviewed in the United States on June 5, 2019']
text: Dries hair fast :: Product came well-packaged; undamaged. Bought it a few months back and it's held together nicely up 'til now! postInfo: ['Reviewed in the United States on May 30, 2018']
text: Skip this one! :: Unfortunately, this hairdryer took 3 times as long as others (which, by the way, were cheaper!) to get my hair even remotely close to being dry. postInfo: ['Reviewed in the United States on May 7, 2020']
text: Happy Purchase :: I could not decide to buy this dryer or not based on the reviews but decided to try it. I have long hair and it does control the frizz like it says. postInfo: ['Reviewed in the United States on June 7, 2020']

I dunno why or how it works so well at what seems like a very low setting, but it does.

postInfo: ['Reviewed in the United States on January 19, 2019']
text: Good hairdryer :: The Conair 1875 watt is a very powerful hairdryer and the cool shot function works very well to set the hair.The handle is easy to hold unlike many other hairdryers. postInfo: ['Reviewed in the United States on January 9, 2019']

I would recommend it.

postInfo: ['Reviewed in the United States on May 30, 2019']
text: Good deal :: Excellent price and works efficiently enough. I like the style and it s very light weight. postInfo: ['Reviewed in the United States on October 20, 2019']

postInfo: ['Reviewed in the United States on June 25, 2019']

postInfo: ['Reviewed in the United States on March 11, 2020']

postInfo: ['Reviewed in the United States on September 28, 2019']
text: Hot Deal! :: I cannot honestly say I've used a lot of hairdryers, but I'm quite happy with this one!It's relatively light weight, very easy to use, and doesn't burn your hair like some other less expensive hairdryers tend to.Definitely well worth it for those who are looking for something a bit more basic, or who don't have a ton of hair to dry.Would buy again.

postInfo: ['Reviewed in the United States on September 17, 2019']
text: Good at first but didn t last very long. :: It lasted about 2 years before the air flow considerably decreased. You have to take it apart to really clean the lint and fuzz out of it. It seems my Conair products (curling iron too) don t last long anymore. I m going to try another brand.

postInfo: ['Reviewed in the United States on October 14, 2015']
text: What kind of crappy warranty service is that for an appliance someone uses ... :: So this dryer lasted my wife six months. The heating element quit working one morning while she was getting ready for work. Amazon only warranties it for a month while conair warranties it for 2 years. postInfo: ['Reviewed in the United States on September 18, 2019']
text: Liked it so much I bought another! :: Bought my first one in the early 2000s and was glad to see they still made it when replacement time came well after that. Dries my short hair quickly and adds plenty of volume. Also works great to dry spills and pets.

postInfo: ['Reviewed in the United States on November 7, 2019']
text: Lasted 1.5 yrs :: Bought this in April 2018. I noticed a bright spark inside of it while blow-drying my air. $15 and it lasted me a year and a half. Not bad for the price. postInfo: ['Reviewed in the United States on January 13, 2019']
text: No diffuser attachment :: This hairdryer does NOT come with a diffuser. This is a basic component of a hairdryer and it is super cheap to produce. I took it for granted when looking at hairdryers. I'm very disappointed that I picked this one. Not worth it.

postInfo: ['Reviewed in the United States on January 23, 2020']
text: Started sparking after a year and a half :: I bought this in May of 2018 and it worked fine up until a few days ago. postInfo: ['Reviewed in the United States on June 14, 2017']
text: Great dryer at an affordable price!!! :: Great dryer for the price. With the medium setting it's just perfect because it's not too hot...... I recommended for the price because it's slick, it has different settings, and it is powerful enough to dry very long hair like mine in just a few minutes...

postInfo: ['Reviewed in the United States on November 13, 2018']
text: Short-lived :: I was initially delighted with this hairdryer which handled perfectly and did a good job of drying my fine hair, however after using it maybe a dozen times in the 7 weeks I have owned it, the red reset button popped up and try as I might, the dryer won't start again. I called Conair and they are going to replace it. They don't do repairs, only replacements. I guess that's what you call good customer service in a throw away society.I really hope this is an isolated incident, but if the replacement dryer suffers a similar problem, I can guarantee I will be letting you know.

postInfo: ['Reviewed in the United States on September 1, 2019']

postInfo: ['Reviewed in the United States on May 17, 2020']
text: Almost killed me. :: I have been using this hair dryer for almost 1 year now and suddenly out of nowhere it started giving this spark from inside the hair dryer while I was blowing my hair. Luckily, I threw the hair dryer before, I was trying to pull the cord out of the socket so nothing happened to me. So, unless you want to cause serious injuries to yourself or a fire hazard, I don't recomend this product.

postInfo: ['Reviewed in the United States on July 19, 2013']
text: Conair Ionic 1875 Turbo Hair Styler is Great :: The Conair Ionic 1875 Turbo Hair Styler/Dryer is Great.The Conair is lightweight but has the power to move a good volume of air. It looks pretty in black and chrome. It has a large enough handle so that it is comfortable to hold. It has two setting switches. One switch for high or low air volume. One switch for cool, warm, or hot temperature. It also has a cool shot button.The only thing I don't like about the Conair is that the switches are a little hard to change while holding it. I have to set the dryer down to change the settings. I could switch back and forth between high and low heat with my old Conair, but I just keep my new Conair on medium heat. That works well for me.I am very happy with the Conair Ionic 1875 Turbo. It dries my hair fast and leaves it shiny and without static. Also, the price is very low compared to similar hair dryers at stores in my area.

Thankfully my hand was just far enough away from the outlet as I hadn t actually turned the dryer off yet. Piece of junk! Takes forever to dry your hair when it does work. postInfo: ['Reviewed in the United States on July 10, 2016']
text: A great hair dryer for my short hair. :: This is one powerful hair dryer that takes me from wet hair to dry hair in just a matter of minutes. Granted, I have short hair but it's still thick. The dryer doesn't weigh so much that my hand and arm become fatigued when I use it. There are two speeds and three heat settings with a separate button for the cool shot of air that is used to set curls in place. I don't have curls so that function isn't something I've tested out. The chord is not retractable, but that's not such a bad thing because that feature is what caused the cord to flex so much it finally shorted out on my previous hair dryer. The back of the dryer has a filter which you can remove for cleaning as well as a plastic ring made into the handle of the dryer so you can hang it up on a hook if you want to. The concentrator head will be useful for drying one specific segment of hair at a time.Now, this hair dryer is 1875 watts. That is very powerful so you need to be aware that any other appliance in use on the same circuit when you turn this hair dryer on can cause a 15 amp circuit (or fuse) to trip. Make sure you are using only this appliance on a circuit before you turn it on. Also, the manufacturer strongly recommends you perform an ALCI safety test - Appliance Leakage Circuit Interrupter - each time you get ready to use the hair dryer if you are operating it anywhere near water. Details for how to conduct this test are included in the information leaflet.

postInfo: ['Reviewed in the United States on July 8, 2013']
text: Pretty good hair dryer :: This hair dryer is pretty good for the price. I previously had a conair ceramic hair dryer with a retractable cord. It did a good job, but was heavy, and ultimately it was the retractable cord that caused the dryer to stop working. The Conair 256P is nice and light. I have curly hair and do not dry it completely, so I put the heat on the warm setting and the blower on high and it works great for me. It doesn't come with a diffuser, but I don't use one. It does however come with the vent attachment so you can direct the air flow. My son uses the dryer as well and likes it. The only complaint I would have is that it is noisy. Basically, it's light and does a great job and the price is right.

text: Works great :: Initially when I turned this on I thought it sounded pretty weak. However when I used it it dried my hair better then my last blow dryer, which I should mention finally took a crap on me after nearly 12 years. I believe I thought it sounded weak merely because my last one was so old, large, and LOUD. This one is petite and quiet. It dries my hair fast and really good, (I have shoulder length straight medium thickness hair) I also like the option of having the cool setting rather then having to hold the button down. Great little blow dryer for a great price!

postInfo: ['Reviewed in the United States on July 20, 2015']
text: This dryer was perfect blow speed for my long fine hair :: This dryer was perfect blow speed for my long fine hair. High blow was drying and so was low. Low allowed styling unlike my other (conair 1875 which missed class on what does High versus Low mean).. Great selections for any speed/heat you want. On this one, I give kudos to however designed the switches - probably a woman. This is light-weight and had everything I wanted Except ---> it did not appear to be truly ionic for me. My hair looked terrible. The box and inside pamphlet states ionic, but the dryer did nothing for my hair. It was a limp flyaway mess. Disappointed as the rest of it was great. This may work for you and I would recommend you give it a try.

postInfo: ['Reviewed in the United States on November 10, 2017']
text: Just so-so :: I received the Conair 1875 Watt Full Size Hair Dryer a few days ago. My first impression when I took it out of the box was that it is smaller than what I'm used to and fairly light weight. These would be beneficial features if the product actually performed the way I expected it to. It almost seems more like a travel dryer than a full size one for daily use. I also found the cord a little too short when reaching across my body. On the hot setting and low speed, the air does not really blow hot, and it is not strong enough. On hot and high, it smells like the motor is burning. About halfway through the drying process, I switched back to my old dryer (which has not been working properly) to finish drying my hair. I will be returning this model and looking for another. Summary:Pros: Small, light weight, easy to handleCons: Does not blow hot enough or strong enough on low setting, cord too short

postInfo: ['Reviewed in the United States on January 14, 2017']
text: Doesn't Move Enough Air to Dry my Fine Hair :: I have no idea how this got the good reviews it did, but I unfortunately bought based on those reviews. I have about shoulder length fine hair. I have a good amount of hair, but because it's fine, it doesn't usually take long to dry. Not the case with this dryer. There is so little volume of air, I gave up after using it two days and gave it to my daughter, who I thought might be able to use it. No dice with her either. Don't waste your money. I went back to the Conair Infiniti Pro, which is the last one I had and love. Shame on me for trying to save money.

postInfo: ['Reviewed in the United States on January 25, 2016']
text: Nice lightweight dryer. :: This has been a great hair dryer for the money. My old one was losing power, so I was in the market for a new, affordable dryer. What I really love about this is how lightweight it is. My last dryer was quite heavy in comparison. It's got 3 heat settings, a cool shot, and also two power settings, so there are lots of combinations. It is drying my hair quite quickly and not creating any damage. My only downside is that the low power setting seems REALLY low, it's not very effective at drying my hair, and my hair isn't super long or thick to begin with. I suppose it might be good for setting a style, but I'm not big in styling my hair, so I'm not the best to weigh in on that!!

postInfo: ['Reviewed in the United States on February 3, 2017']
text: Cord Issues :: The dryer itself is adequate, but sure doesn't feel like 1875 watts. My old Conair 1500 watt that I had for years was much more powerful. My main complaint about this thing is the cord. First, it is much shorter than any other blow dryer I have ever owned. Second, the plug fits so loosely in the wall socket that hardly any movement unplugs this thing. It's better when the dryer is being held higher than the wall socket, but I like to sit while I blow dry my hair. Just the act of moving the dryer from one side of your head to the other pulls it from the plug. It unplugs itself EVERY time I use it. I hate this thing.

text: Hurrah -- they still make it! :: We wanted an exact replacement, same as the old one, and here it is! postInfo: ['Reviewed in the United States on January 24, 2018']
text: Like most Conairs, a great value. :: I go through a lot of Conairs. They are very reasonably priced and tend to stand up to a lot of use. By comparison, last dryer I bought was a 3x as expensive BayblissPro and it only lasted 2 months. There are some subtle differences between models if you care- this one I wish the low temperature was a little less hot and I don t like the parallel slider switches for heat and fan speed- they are a little hard to manipulate. But nothing wrong with the unit, especially for the price.
