postInfo: ['Reviewed in the United States on May 3, 2019']
text: DECENT HAIR DRYER :: I just wanted to give it 5 stars and be done with the review, but they require a description on Amazon...so I'll post my mom's secret chocolate chip cookie recipe here instead (not so secret anymore, is it, Mom!?):4 cubes butter, softened2 heaping cups dark brown sugar (packed, then heap that shiz) cups white sugar2 tablespoons vanilla1 teaspoon salt1 teaspoons baking soda3 eggs6 cups flour1 bag chocolate chips (semi-sweet or sweet)Mix BY HAND all ingredients, except flour and chips (mixing by hand makes them taste better, trust me).Then add flour and chips and stir BY HAND. Bake @ 350 for 9-11 minutes on ungreased cookie sheet. Enjoy the preciouses.Note: makes a buttload of cookies, so you might want to halve the recipe.

postInfo: ['Reviewed in the United States on December 31, 2018']
text: Teflon-free :: I ordered this hairdryer for my parrot after finding out my previous dryer may have contained teflon, which is highly toxic to birds. I contacted several companies about various models, and Conair was the only company to affirm that none of the parts in this hairdryer (as of April 2018) contain teflon.The hairdryer itself is so-so. It's not very powerful. I mainly use it to help my bird dry off after her baths and she loooves it, but I do wish it would dry a little faster. I have short but thick hair and it's almost just as quick to let it air dry than to use this.So: safe bet to use around/on birds, but if you're not worried about Teflon, maybe look for something with a little more power!

postInfo: ['Reviewed in the United States on August 16, 2019']
text: Great for price! :: This is the 3rd one of these blow dryers I have owned since about 2015 (or earlier). I bought my 2nd one for my travel bag. My original one finally was getting very red coils, smelled at times, then, it stopped working. It was no longer as powerful either, but, I have long hair, it lasted for years, so is to be expected. The 3rd one, I recently ordered from Amazon. It is quite powerful, I don't remember my other 2 'sucking' my hair into the filter end as much, but, my hair has gotten longer too. My daughter has one, doesn't like it because of that either (her hair is longer, both have hair mid back). I like it well enough, price was awesome, so am just being aware of the power & the intake filter power, so my hair doesn't get caught in it. I plan of getting about 5" cut off soon, so the should help too. It usually happens when I bend over & dry my hair. So, other than that, I do recommend this. If you have short hair, this would dry your hair in no time. I normally use the lowest heat setting, (better on hair) & bought a separate hair diffuser that I can use on it (Sally's Beauty Supply) to 'set' my hair spray. That's a hint to try too for hair spray lovers, it helps set & hold the hair when using a low setting, heat setting on the spray. Hope this helps!

postInfo: ['Reviewed in the United States on November 28, 2019']
text: Surprisingly fast drying :: I wanted an inexpensive blow-dryer to leave at my s.o.'s apt instead of lugging mine back and forth. The attached photos show my old dryer (the beat up red one) next to the new dryer. I've had my old blowdryer for I'd say at least 5 years, but probably longer. My 1st impression of the new Conair 1875, was that the quality was cheap and probably won't last more than a year or two. It is definitely lighter weight and smaller than "Old Red," but once again, it definitely feels like it's lesser quality.That being said, my expectations for it were really low, yet I was surprised by how quickly it dried my hair. I have really thick hair that usually takes a long time to dry, but I was able to finish it in about 5 mins with the new dryer on Hot & High speed. I don't spend much time styling my hair, so I'm sure results for others will vary.There was an unpleasant smell of plastic when I first turned it on, but it quickly went away. I also felt like, as others have said, the "hot" setting wasn't really that hot, but my hair was drying so it didn't matter. It did get hotter the longer it was on though.I'm still a bit skeptical as to how long it will last, but this little dryer is so far winning me over.Pros: Fast drying, light weight, smaller than many full-size dryersCons: feels cheaply made, would be nice to have more settings, but seems fairly standard for price range.

postInfo: ['Reviewed in the United States on July 10, 2019']
text: Great Hair Dryer Features and Value. :: Item: Conair 1875 Watt Full Size Pro Hair Dryer with Ionic Conditioning, Black/Chrome.The first one arrived dead on arrival. the switch would not turn on high. I though, great, what a nice fire hazard. Not giving up yet. I Returned it and asked for a replacement. I sent it back the next day to a kiosk. The replacement arrived in a few days. Glad I gave this product a chance.I liked the features, buttons, cord length and the color. The buttons and features of this hair dryer are better than other brands in this price range. The weight and size are appropriate, too. I like the fact that this is a regular hair dryer. So functionality does not suffer to make it travel size. You can still pack it for travel. It is lightweight.Yes, I would buy it again. I gave it 5 stars because of the return process and the fact that he replacement works better than anything else in this price range with better functions. I would but this again. If something does happen, which I doubt, I will let you know.

postInfo: ['Reviewed in the United States on April 22, 2020']
text: Works well. :: The Conair 1875 hair dryer replaced my old one which I didn't realize was heavier than other hair dryers, at times I had to rest my arms, but it did last for many years. My alternative hair dryer became too hot to use. This dryer is a little less heavy and has three speeds for blowing hair so I can change it from blowing hot to warm then back again. The buttons are easy to push up and down and no problem with doing so accidentally. It doesn't bother me that it does not have a retractable cord as my old one as I have the space to store it. If not I would simply wind the cord around the handle. I do not travel with it so I can't really give it any stars pertaining to that. It performs very well and I'm sure we'll be good to go for many years to come.

postInfo: ['Reviewed in the United States on February 17, 2020']
text: What I wanted at the right price(: :: This is a full sized, straight forward hair blow drier, that s works perfectly and is reasonably priced.It has Cool, Warm, and Hot temperature settings, along with low and high airflow choice.I use it when I m too rushed to air dry my curly hair. I don t bother diffusing, just scrunch my curls and use low setting. I also use it to dry my poodle after a bath. It s pretty quiet on the low speed and she puts up with it.I was shocked to see what blow driers cost these days! This is the right price.It s full size, so I can t say about travel, but it is very Light weight. It also has an excellent surge protector plug, so you won t blow fuses.Seller shipped well and very quickly. I m totally satisfied and pleased with this purchase.

postInfo: ['Reviewed in the United States on May 4, 2016']
text: this is by far an amazing value at this price point :: I bought this to replace my Hana professional hair dryer. I was spoiled by the power and the quality. It died in flames (literally flames) after 8 years of constant use. .Hana seems to have gone out of business and I needed something quick so I thought I would try this until I decided on a new pro dryer.. , It has all the speed and heat settings of the expensive dryer, although not nearly as powerful of course, and the power cord is a bit short for my taste, having said that; this is by far an amazing value at this price point. if I wasn't in some part using my old dryer by comparison I would probably give 5 stars.

postInfo: ['Reviewed in the United States on May 6, 2020']
text: does the job, dries faster despite lower air flow :: bought this to replace my tried and true conair ive had for 10 yrs, which was still going but had started to spark on the ground element inside. first impressions is that it was much quieter and the air flow seemed less. However, it does dry faster than my old one and feels softer, if thats a thing. might be the ionized doohickey inside. I was set to not like it due to the decreased air flow but it really does dry faster. So tech improvements thru the last decade work. looks are ok, not what i care about, feels decent in hand ergonomically. cord length is adequate. many settings which i will ignore as usual, opting for full heat and flow at all times due to my huge head of hair.

postInfo: ['Reviewed in the United States on January 17, 2018']
text: Conair 1875 Watt Full Size Pro Hair Dryer :: I have owned a product like this for years. All of my hair dryers work well & last for several years. I need a work horse to dry my hair which holds water. The dryer is light & easy to hold. Dryer works best for me on high. I use mine every other day & it takes about 10 minutes to dry my shoulder length hair when I use a very large round brush. This is good time for me as I have spent 20-30 minutes drying my hair in the past.Update 4/25/18: this hair dryer died in less than 1 year. I noticed that dryer appeared to be extremely hot to the touch & it finally overheated & ceased to function. I guess that I rode this horse to death. I will not buy another dryer like this one.

postInfo: ['Reviewed in the United States on April 26, 2020']
text: The BEST!...Read a TON of reviews!! :: I read a TON of reviews and I do think this one is the best. SUPER lightweight and very professional looking. I was also happy to see that the "glitter" as seen in product photo is hardly visible in person (thought that was a little tacky, personally). Additionally the buttons which adjust for power & heat functions are ones that slide that way you aren't accidentally hitting buttons and changing the settings etc, so that's another great feature. The cord is pretty long too! And it seems to dry hair quickly with all the c burnt technology that makes a high end blow dryer!! If on the fence, I say GET IT!!

postInfo: ['Reviewed in the United States on April 8, 2020']
text: Buy it!!!!!! :: I bought this dryer to replace the exact same one that gave up on me. But why the same one when the previous one broke? Because, IT LASTED 6 YEARS!!!! 6 years for a blow dryer is awesome in my opinion.Anyway, a few things about my hair. It's THICK. So thick. I get it thinned every 3 months. And my once stick straight hair got very curly and frizzy in the back. I keep the length at about my bra strap. With this dryer, it takes about 10 minutes to dry. The dryer is also lightweight. It's awesome and for $20 you really can't go wrong!!!

postInfo: ['Reviewed in the United States on April 25, 2020']
text: Good for hair not for crafts :: We bought this dryer based on the many reviews that said the heat on this dryer is great. That IS true if you want it for your hair. We wanted it for arts and crafts. Nope! It didnt work for melting crayons. It didnt work for splashing the melted crayon across the canvas. Not even when we melted the crayons with the creme brulee torch. Wasn't enough power to splash. Back to the drawing board search for that elusive powerful dryer. We are determined to come out of this quarantine period with some kind of masterpiece...lofty goals but optimistic. Lol.

postInfo: ['Reviewed in the United States on November 22, 2017']
text: Works great :: I purchased this after my hair dryer broke the other day. It works great, much better than my old one. My hair actually does somehow feel softer with this dryer. I have fairly thick, mid-length hair and it dries it pretty quickly, though I always leave my hair in the towel for a long time first. The only downside is that the plug wiggles loose and falls out of the socket a few times every time I use it to dry my hair. Same socket as I used with my last dryer and the last one didn t have this issue- so the problem is not my socket but something with how the plug is designed. Overall a good buy that I am pleased with.

postInfo: ['Reviewed in the United States on April 20, 2020']
text: Way too gentle of a breeze, not enough drying power :: You know how hotel hair dryers suck so badly that you do whatever you can to find room in your luggage for your own personal hairdryer no matter what? Yeah, this hair dryer you'll want to leave at home. It's just like the hotel ones. Lightly blowing a gentle breeze so faint you hardly will know it's on. I've given it to my kids as a hair dryer for their Barbie hair salon and will be finding another. It was incredibly lightweight though if that's important to you and you don't need super max drying power like some of us do.

postInfo: ['Reviewed in the United States on January 10, 2020']
text: Light and Gentle :: It is a very nice dryer to replace my 10 year old Remington. I like the 'anti-frizz' features and and concentrator; it is light and easy to hold with my arthritis. The 3 heat settings plus a cool shot are preferable to 2, and they work well! The filter cover was difficult to remove at first, and there were no instructions. I took a grip cloth for opening jars and it twisted off easily, then repeated the steps to put it back on. It is a great buy for the price, and I am very happy with my purchase@

postInfo: ['Reviewed in the United States on March 5, 2020']
text: Good only for about 8 months :: I liked this hair dryer at first. It dried my hair relatively fast. However, after about 8 months of using it about 5 minutes a day it quit blowing hot air. I have kept the filter area as clean as I can, but the design of the dryer does not allow me to take off the vent and clean the inside filter. I just ordered a different dryer completely from Amazon. DO NOT BUY if you want a dryer to last more than 8 months. Very disappointed as I thought Conair was a good brand. This dryer also damaged my hair. Fortunately my hair is getting healthier since I stopped using this dryer.

postInfo: ['Reviewed in the United States on February 23, 2019']
text: Hair Dryer Works Well :: I hadn't had a new hair dryer in quite a few years, so it was quite a change when my old hair dryer finally died.This Conair hair dryer was a great replacement for my old dryer. It works much faster, and I noticed no increased damage or problems with my hair. The ability to chose various combinations of heat and air speed is great and I'm pleased with my purchase.I haven't had it long enough to say anything about long-term reliability, but so far I'm more than satisfied with my purchase.

postInfo: ['Reviewed in the United States on February 12, 2018']
text: Motor needs protection from hair that falls out while drying :: This was a Christmas gift to myself. Started using it Christmas day, today, 2/12/18 - it died. I have long hair. As hair falls out of my head while blow drying, it is sucked into the motor and keeps the motor from running full speed. I typically replace hair dryers once per year for this reason, but not usually this fast. Disappointing. I have had other hair dryers that have a sponge material in the back, to catch lint. Seems they don't suck hair in the back as much as those without. If you have long hair, this might not be the best for you.

postInfo: ['Reviewed in the United States on July 28, 2018']
text: More aggravation than its worth. :: I really hate this blow dryer. The cord is so short it constantly unplugs while I'm drying my hair and I only have it plugged in over my bathroom sink countertop so it isnt going very far. It also has less power than my $10 blow dryer from a super store. It's pretty but overall unimpressive. I used to blow dry my hair every morning but this thing is so annoying I only blow dry half now and let it air dry. I'll be looking for a better replacement blow dryer as soon as possible. Spend the extra money for something nice...its worth it.

postInfo: ['Reviewed in the United States on November 28, 2019']

After reading the great reviews, I had high hopes for this machine, but sadly I was disappointed. I'll continue my search.

text: I like this hair dryer... :: My trusty hair dryer quit on my recently and had to replace it immediately. Based on the positive reviews I went with this Conair dryer. For the most part I am pleased with it and it does the job. I appreciate the fact that it has three different heat settings, cool, medium and hot. However, I find I prefer the hot setting the best, but it feels more medium to me than hot. I found the medium setting to be more lukewarm, and the cool setting I don't use much this time of year, will more so in the warmer months.I thought it was reasonably priced, I am not one that typically goes for the expensive hair dryers so I appreciated the price point.I give this hair dryer 4 stars. If you need a basic dryer that does the job and is low priced, this is a good bet.

postInfo: ['Reviewed in the United States on September 16, 2017']
text: Conair 1875 Watt Pro Styler/Dryer with ionic conditioning :: I've been a devoted Conair user all my adult life. This is advertised as a "pro styler" but my stylist assures me it's not. The truly professional blow dryer she uses is 2500 watts, can't be purchased by non-professionals and can get mega-hot! What I'm really happy about with this dryer is it's the first Conair I've owned that has a hot setting that is actually warm instead of hot enough to steam vegetables. Far less chance of damaging the hair. I've had 80% fewer split-ends at trim time and this blow dryer is one reason. It's lightweight, dries quickly and is easy to handle. I use the concentrator that comes with it. That was my stylist's advice. The ionic conditioning feature combined with pointing the dryer, with the concentrator, in the direction of hair growth smooths the cuticle. I Conair and I'll NEVER use any other brand!

postInfo: ['Reviewed in the United States on November 6, 2015']
text: Fantastic hair dryer for the price :: I've got one main requirement for a hair dryer - that it doesn't cause immense frizz, and that it work FAST. This little jobbie does the trick. I originally bought it thinking it had a retractable cord. It does not! (Sad). I do like the multiple settings, as well as the fact that "cool" is a setting instead of just a button that you have to hold down. The body has a great look: sleek and bright. It's light, which is awesome. The "hot" setting is really very hot, while the 'warm' setting is comfortable enough that it doesn't hurt your hands. I often blow-dry my hair on hot (bad, I know!) because it goes much faster. All in all this is a good dryer if you're looking for something inexpensive for regular drying. It DOES leave my hair a bit frizzier than I might like, but I use moisturizer on the ends and am good to go.

postInfo: ['Reviewed in the United States on November 12, 2015']
text: Very happy! :: My daughter and I both have short, thick hair, but neither of us wants to be hit with super hot air that burns us as we have experienced in the past from other hair dryers. This hair dryer allows me to set it to blow a lot of warm air that still dries our short hair within about 5 minutes each. Very, very happy with this hair dryer so far. And, the best part is, when I am done, it is still cool enough that I can set it down in its proper place without worrying that it is too warm to go there, because the barrel of the hair dryer is always nice and just slightly warm to the touch. Perfectly fine to be put down on any surface without worries.

text: Quiet, and plenty powerful! :: Power is always my primary concern when it comes to selecting a hair dryer (I have long, thick hair that takes FOREVER to dry). There is plenty of power in this dryer! It is quiet for a blow dryer--a feature that I initially mistook for low strength--which is really nice. I was apprehensive about there being only two speeds, but after using this dryer for a month or so now, I don't feel that there are any features lacking. I would recommend this product.

I watched a youtube video to learn how to open up the hair dryer and clean out the hair and lint that gets stuck around the motor. It seemed straightforward- all you do is unscrew the two screws on the handle, pop it open, pull out the hair and lint, and screw it back together. I was hopeful that I could save this hairdryer, but I wasn't able to unscrew the screws because the metal screws were melted and I couldn't get any traction with the screwdriver.

text: Dangerous Dryer! :: Bad dryer. Gave out a burning smell from time to time and it started shooting burning sparks out of it ( right at my face because I was using it when it happened). Put burn marks on my carpet and there was a ton of smoke coming out of it. Granted, I did have the dryer for about a year and a half before that happened but the burning smell happened here and there since the beginning.Just be warned that when this dryer dies, it may be dangerous like with what happened to me. I've never had that happen with a dryer before! Usually they just stop heating up very much, but I've NEVER had one actually start shooting Sparks and nearly catch on fire. The top of the cord also melted and the wires were exposed.

postInfo: ['Reviewed in the United States on January 2, 2017']
text: Not so hot Tea Pot! :: nice dryer

postInfo: ['Reviewed in the United States on May 7, 2016']
text: Best bang for your buck! :: I spent WAY to much time researching blow dryers. Maybe it's because I have insanely long, thick hair, or because my blowdryer is 12 years old (insisted on buying my last one with the condition it had a 5 year warranty since I had killed two blow dryers back to back) or because I see my hair stylist using Babyliss and I thought I needed one. I was just about to throw down the funds for the Babyliss (SO frustrating because they have SO many dryers! How can you tell which one is best for your type of hair!!) and I came across the reviews for this dryer. I looked at reviews on other sites- they all said the same thing- this dryer is pretty darn good- and it AIN'T $200!! Since when did it become standard practice to feel obligated to pay $200 for a dryer!? When I saw the price after reading the reviews, I figured I couldn't lose. After all, I could always use it for a travel dryer.Summary:*SO LIGHT! (if you have long hair- BONUS!)*Short cord, so don't plan on walking all over the bathroom*Does the job in half the time of my last dryer and seems to create less frizz*feels "cheap" like if I drop it- it's over and it's trash (has not happened yet!)*I like it! Money well spent and I am happy!I have long (past bra-strap, coarse, thick caucasian hair) and it dries my hair in less than 15 minutes.

postInfo: ['Reviewed in the United States on February 26, 2018']
text: this doesn't blow as forcefully which is perfect for my short :: I have had this dryer for years and the only reason I need to replace it is I used it overseas without a converter (an adapter, but no converter) and it sparked then, and now it occasionally shoots sparks!!! My fault. I have tried other dryers but they are too heavy for me OR the switches we situated such that I constantly am turning it off because of where my hand holds it. Plus, as another reviewer said, this doesn't blow as forcefully which is perfect for my short, fine hair. It probably isn't strong enough for thicker hair. But I love the way it works for me, and the price is right. Because of styling products the chrome has worn, I may try the colored version this time. I am glad this dryer is still available!!

postInfo: ['Reviewed in the United States on July 11, 2017']
text: Amazing and indestructible! :: I was gifted this EXACT same model hairdryer, brand new, in 2000. Seriously. 17 years ago. It's still functioning and drying just the same as it did on day one out of the box with every day use. I stumbled across this on Amazon and was amazed it's still in production. That tells me it's a great product to still being made and sold! I've dropped and banged up my model more times than you can imagine and it's just fine! I travel with it, too. Add being tossed around in luggage by the airlines! The ability to clean the lunt filter, I think is one reason it's lasted so long. So, do I treat myself with a new one? Maybe at the 20 year mark. postInfo: ['Reviewed in the United States on January 9, 2017']
text: Best Hairdryer Ever! :: This is best hairdryer I've ever owned! Prior to this big purchase, I had only used drugstore hairdryers like Conair. I never could understand why anyone would pay such a premium for a hairdryer, especially because I would still use my straightener after drying my hair. Enter the Bio Ionic. I do not have to use my straightener any longer! It takes 5 minutes tops to dry my hair, which is half the time it used to take. The dryer is powerful but light. My hair is shiny and straight and there is no reason to go over it with a straightener. I would order this product again and again, and I recommend anyone upgrade to this. It makes a world of difference.

postInfo: ['Reviewed in the United States on September 1, 2016']
text: The most amazing hair dryer on the market :: This new dryer is amazing. It is extremely light (less than a pound) and actually much lighter than my old bio ionic powerlight. The nozzle is very easy to take on and off and it's great because the dryer itself does not overheat. My hair normally takes 15-25 minutes with a typical dryer. I have very long, thick, curly and easily frizzy hair. The 10x takes me between 9-12 minutes but the result is much better with the 10x than my old powerlight. This dryer makes my hair feel exceptionally soft, light, defrizzed, and smooth, without the need for a flat iron--definitely the best blow out I've had in a long time! The cold button is great and I think the variety of settings is more than enough for me. The bio ionic powerlight would take me between 10-14 minutes depending on the humidity outside and how conditioned my hair is, so in terms of time, I found the 10x to definitely be faster overall with a better overall result. My stylist recommended the bio ionic brand in 2012. I bought the bio ionic powerlight 4 years ago and it does a great job at reducing styling time and smoothing out my hair. However, I find the new 10x to be more effective at not drying out my hair as much. The 10x definitely gives more shine and reduces frizz substantially. The dryer still works great but I wanted to try a new dryer. I will keep the powerlight as a travel/back up dryer. By the way, I have burned out three T3 dryers in less than a year so having a ten year motor warranty is a big deal for me. Bio ionic is hands down one of the best brands on the market for blow dryers and I find it to be well worth the money!

Normally it takes me 30-40 plus I have to go over some spots again or with a flat iron. I know it's expensive but damn. Life changing. Do yourself a favor and order the bio ionic bristle brush as well it's really nice.

postInfo: ['Reviewed in the United States on June 22, 2017']
text: Nothing's going to pry this out of my hands. :: From the very first time I used this hair dryer, I noticed the difference. I've had it for over a year now, and when I travel and have to use a standard hair dryer, that's when I REALLY appreciate how great this one is. I have fine, straight hair, so nothing too difficult, but it really does help cut down on frizz and makes my hair so soft and smooth. I also love that the "cool" option stays on and works on all levels, it isn't just a blast like on most dryers. In the summer it's so nice to not have to use hot air at all! So much less damaging, too. It is a hair dryer, so it is never going to be silent, but I find it less screechy/high pitched than other dryers. I also can use it on a lower level and it still dries pretty fast. Yes, it is expensive, but considering the crummy cheap hair dryers I've gone through over the years, this one just blows them out of the water. If they made a travel version, I'd be thrilled.

postInfo: ['Reviewed in the United States on September 15, 2016']
text: Impressive presentation, outrageous price, passable results :: This Bio Ionic dryer did a a great job, so why only three stars? Because I believe that value is just as important as results. I would have given this blow dryer a higher rating but the price was just too much. I compared this with two other dryers, one costing $30, the other $100. At three times the price, this baby just didn't stand out for three times the performance. If your gifting this, the packaging will impress; heavy weight box, expensive paper, and a satiny storage bag. The instructions (English, Spanish, & French) cover just the basics, no mention of how or when to use the included diffuser or how the attachment changes the end drying result. The dryer IS very lightweight. It has a removable filter, a cool shot button and three settings; low, medium, and high. There are no independent settings for air flow and heat -- even my cheapo $30 dryer has that! It's a must for flexibility for different types of hair or styles. Since I have fine hair, I'm limited to the medium setting with this Bio Ionic because the high setting has too much heat. It did seem to dry it a little bit faster, but not dramatically so. The dryer isn't excessively loud or high pitched. The cool shot button had an improved feature. Usually you have to hold the cool shot button down, but with this dryer, you just hit it once and it stays cool til you hit it again. Nice! The Velcro strap to tie up loose power cord is also nice. In summary, this is a nice lightweight dryer that performs well but with so many others on the market, even with ionic features, that I didn't find anything this one did to justify the price. I'd pass on this and spend those extra bucks elsewhere.

postInfo: ['Reviewed in the United States on August 3, 2016']
text: Five Stars :: We love it.

postInfo: ['Reviewed in the United States on September 2, 2016']
text: The most simple and fantastic hairdryer I have ever owned :: This is hands down the best hairdryer I have owned. I have not previously ever been able to find one that checks all the boxes until now.Its quiet! I hadn't even said anything to my husband and he almost immediately noticed how quiet it was. We all hate loud hairdryers and this is a standout in quietness. I like the low setting as I like to do whatever I can to avoid more frizz than I already have.Its simple. Which I love. It has speed controls on a sliding switch and a cool down button and thats it! The cool down switch is a pop in button so it stays on and serves as a way to moderate the temperature.It dries quickly. I always use it on low speed with my brush (it also has lovely grooved slats in the removable cone which coincide nicely with my brush bristles), and my hair somehow dries in about half the time as my old T3. I feel less of a need to use additional serums as straighteners as a result.I cant say enough good things about this bad boy.

postInfo: ['Reviewed in the United States on January 12, 2019']
text: Wow - Best dryer I ve ever owned. Hands down! :: Wow - such a difference! So, I m a researcher by nature, especially when making purchases. I was about to purchase a used Dyson on eBay and ended up hearing about this brand throughout my process. It s not easy going through mixed ratings & opinions for different products, but I decided to give this a go when I came across what seemed-to-me a great deal (not on Amazon). I do not typically review products often since it s just time-consuming, but I felt compelled to review this item, to hopefully benefit others. I just used my new dryer and am blown away (pun intended). I am choosey with hair products and believe that better tools do make a difference. I thought I was happy with my current dryer, but knew it was a matter of time before I would need a new one. I also did not love the weight of it, having a bulging disc in my neck, along with chronic neck/shoulder pain. I love a decent self-blowout, but dread having to go about it myself. I have never had an easier time blowing out my hair. It was definitely faster, probably twice as fast, and a much more pleasant experience. This dryer is light and feels very professional. It is definitely not as loud and its sound does remind me of professional dryers when I have my hair cut and styled, though not quiet, a more muted sound somehow. I hope that my opinion/review holds up. I am excited, look forward to styling my hair with this Bio Ionic dryer and REALLY look forward to a new cut, knowing that I will actually have a better chance of being able to replicate the professional blowout style on my own now. Less frizz was also a plus (I do use hair product, but my routine was unchanged from using my former dryer)! In case it helps, I have med-long length, wavy, med texture ,and a lot of hair.I don t think you will be disappointed. Definitely consider this Bio Ionic 10x dryer!

postInfo: ['Reviewed in the United States on September 5, 2016']
text: Comfortably Lightweight with Efficient Drying Power :: An exceptionally engineered and well balanced ionic hair dryer, the powerful Bio Ionic 10x expediently yields professional quality results.I appreciate the accessible control layout, and the contoured design. The easy to maneuver handle minimizes wrist fatigue, while its three-level power switch smoothly slides along the contoured handle for speed selection, softly clicking into place at each stop.The "Cool" button necessitates that extra little bit of pressing distance to click into engagement, which avoids inadvertent toggling between hot and cool. Disengagement of the button produces the cool air. The unit promptly transitions between temperatures for precisely controlled, gentle styling.The dryer includes an attractive, large, protective storage bag that is big enough to hold both the unit, and its included speed dry nozzle. It has a twisted rope style of drawstring. The bag is beautifully embroidered with the Bio Ionic 10x logo, as well.I am impressed with the quality of the product. Its easily removable filters makes it simple to clean the air passage in order to maintain motor performance. At a little bit more than eight-foot in length, its thick, flexible cord is well reinforced at both ends, and is equipped with circuit protecting test and reset buttons on its compact block plug. It boasts zero EMF, zero ozone, and zero carbon micro-particle emissions. An incredible 10-year motor life warranty completes this remarkable package.If an amazing dryer with advanced technology that results in an average of seventy-five percent less energy use appeals to you, it is but one reason among the many to go with the Bio Ionic 10x. It's just an outstanding product.

postInfo: ['Reviewed in the United States on November 16, 2017']
text: Great Hair Dryer :: I wanted a new hair dryer and wanted something smaller than my last one. This works very well for my fine, shoulder length hair. Much faster than my old, worn out dryer and much more comfortable to use with a round brush because of its small size. I love that it was so affordable. I also like that it takes up much less room in my bathroom drawer.My favorite things about it:-Three heat settings (hot, warm, and cool)-Two fan settings independent of heat setting-Very small and comfortable to use-Cold shot button in addition to cool heat setting-Very inexpensive for a really great little dryer-Good switch placement for the way I hold it so I'm not accidentally bumping them and changing settings while I do my hair

postInfo: ['Reviewed in the United States on August 10, 2019']
text: Powerful compact Ionic hair dryer. :: This CONAIR Mini Pro Plus Hair Dryer hairdryer is lightweight, ergonomic, and surprisingly powerful. It uses Ionic Technology, so it dries my waist-length, hair quickly without as much damaging heat. My hair has suffered from years of coloring and abuse, so I am thrilled to find a blow dryer that doesn't need to produce scorching heat to dry my hair in less than 10 minutes.To give you some idea of how strong the airflow its, I've included a pic of a macaw feather that the air had split. That's pretty strong.I recently replaced my old full-size dryer when I noticed the plug got extremely hot and burned my fingers. The dryer was a fire hazard, and after ten plus years, it was time. It was also bulky and took up space in the cabinetI replaced it with a compact blow dryer, not for travel, it just takes up less space. It produced a lot of heat but lacked strong airflow. I prefer stronger airflow to heat.About the only time, I would prefer high heat is if my A/C coil freezes up and I need to defrost the evaporator coil quickly so the technician can diagnose and repair my air conditioner. My hair is an entirely different matter because there is a lot of old-growth with dried out ends. I'll keep that other dryer in the air handler closet for air conditioning emergencies.The switches are conveniently located on the front of the handle and I find it easier to use than the side controls on my other hair dryer because I am left-handed. I usually just use the highest setting, but now I don't need to fumble for the controls while I am using it if I want to switch to another setting.I glanced at the enclosed warranty and safety pamphlet and couldn't believe it has a 48-month warranty. I don't think I have ever seen that before on any appliance, large or small. Conair must be pretty confident in the quality of this product because that's amazing.I checked out their website to find out if the ion technology could be turned on and off. This model does not have that option. I copied the following information:NFINITI MINI PRO PLUS 1600 watts Compact and full power Powerful, lightweight AC motor 3 heat / 2 speed settings Ionic technology for smooth and shiny hair True cold shot button to lock style in place Removable filter for easy cleaning to extend motor life Hanging ring Concentrator for pinpoint stylingAbout the only thing that would make it perfect would be a high heat option should I want to use it for any application that requires heat. Things like shrink wrap and defrosting my air conditioner. Overall, I am very impressed with this hairdryer and highly recommend it.** If you found this review to be helpful at all, please take a moment and click the button below to let Amazon know. Thank you **

postInfo: ['Reviewed in the United States on July 30, 2019']
text: Lightweight and fits Xtava black orchid :: I bought this dryer based on reviews that it is lightweight and fits the massive Xtava black orchid diffuser. I was previously using a full size dryer that the orchid didn t really fit on, so it was a heavy balancing act every time I dried my hair. I m happy to report that this dryer probably weighs the same amount as the diffuser itself, and with the shorter barrel, the center of gravity is much closer to my head, making it easy to maneuver. It dried my layered, shoulder length 2c waves in about 12 minutes. Great price and well worth it!

postInfo: ['Reviewed in the United States on August 16, 2019']
text: Awesome Dryer a true smaller version of its bigger unit :: If you like the original size Infiniti pro (reddish ) ,you like the smaller version (black).I find the dryer power to be fairly much the same and the lighter version is good for travel.This isn t a travel dryer (no folding handle or voltage change ability) but if you are traveling within a 120v country and want a great dryer this is an excellent choice.This dryer would be good for a hair stylist who would enjoy the lighter weight over a long time period cutting hair.It is very well built,the controls (flip switches) are of high quality and easy to manage.I did find that being in a bag sometimes the switch like to turn on either high or low because off is in the middle.So when you plug it in ,it is already on.Same thing will happen if you wrap cord around handle,just something to keep in mind no big deal.Great for people who have limited space in a drawer or bathroom area to store.

postInfo: ['Reviewed in the United States on August 15, 2019']
text: Great little dryer with a lot of power and variety of settings. :: This is a great little blow dryer with a lot of power! I ve used all the settings, and love the reducing nozzle for my bangs and for finishing off on the rare occasions when I blow-dry my hair straight. It s a bit heavier than I expected, but the weight is well balanced so it s not a problem when I m using it.I was really surprised to find that my favorite diffuser, (the Segbeauty Hair Diffuser for Curly Wavy Hair Fitting Most Blow Dryer Professional Salon Frizz-free Diffuser Attachment for Blower with 1.57"-1.97" Nozzle) fits it perfectly so I can just add it to my bag when traveling and be able to dry my wavy hair quickly too! WIN!

postInfo: ['Reviewed in the United States on January 8, 2019']
text: The Mighty Mini Travel / Gym Hair Dryer :: This Mighty Mini Conair Hair Dryer is easy to hold, It gets Hot, It Blows Powerful..... and best of all it is easy to throw in a small Travel / Gym bag.It is 1600 Watts of powerSize is 6" long by 3" wide by 7-1/2" tall (not including the rubber that protects the electrical cord)Electrical Cord is 67" this measurement is from the plastic handle to the very end of the plug. The actual exposed cord is 60-1/2" long (the rubber is 3-1/2" and the plug is 3")It has a removable Intake screen (rear of the dryer where the fan is)They say in the AD that it is 40% smaller than it's Full size cousin (and this is correct)..... But it sure is NOT 40% less powerful.I looked through HUNDREDS of "small" hair dryers, trying to find one that would be the best (for me) to domestic Travel with. What I wanted was the "smallest" dryer that was able to have high velocity blowing on all temperatures High, Medium, Low (Hot, Warm, Cool). The Mini Pro does this..... and few others will.The Conair Mini Pro Plus is NOT a dual voltage dryer.... Below is why a dual voltage dryer is not so good.Here is the deal with these dual voltage Travel dryers (125V - 250V) is they have HOT / High velocity but because they are able to be used in other countries that use 250V..... what they do is make the Warm / Low velocity ONE HALF of the wattage..... So let's use A typical travel dryers highest Wattage = 1600-watts on HOT/ High velocity..... then they cut it in HALF for the Warm / Low velocity..... so the Warm / Low = 800 watts.... IE: Not too warm and not too much velocity..... In other words it will take a long time to dry your hair on the Warm / Low setting..... (and if you are in the 250V country you have only 1 speed/temp = HOT/High).The Andis 1600-Watt MicroTurbo Dual Voltage Hair Dryer.... is almost the perfect travel dryer, the problem with it is what I just wrote above..... And the HOT is really Hot on that micro dryer (not even good for your hair).... The other problem with it is because it has such a short nozzle.... It does not concentrate the blowing air very good.I have attached many pictures that should give you an idea on the size.... So you will have an idea on how it "sizes" up to others.Pictured included in this review, are:* INFINITIPRO BY CONAIR 1875 Watt Salon Performance AC Motor Styling Tool/Hair Dryer; Soft Touch Black (Full Size Dryer).* INFINITIPRO BY CONAIR Mini Pro Plus Hair Dryer/Styler with AC Motor, Black (Mini Size Dryer).* Andis 1600-Watt MicroTurbo Dual Voltage Hair Dryer; White (Micro Size Dryer).

postInfo: ['Reviewed in the United States on November 3, 2018']
text: Lots of air and the right amount of heat :: This little thing is amazing! I have always purchased larger sized hair dryers with large fans because I want to get the drying job done quickly without using excessive heat and without waiting for low air flow. However, they do take up a little more space when traveling, especially when making shorter trips and wanting to carry necessities in a carry-on without checking luggage. When the cord of my previous dryer started to become loose at the handle from a few years of use, it was time to start looking again to check out the current batch of available dryers. The task was a bit more difficult because I also require separate speed and heat switches, as well as switches that are designed so that settings are not easily changed inadvertently when in use.After reading many reviews and comparing products, I decided to give this really compact dryer a try without setting my expectations too high. To my surprise, this little dryer produces an amazing amount of air, comparable to and actually exceeding many larger dryers that I've used over the years! It heats the air to either warm or very warm, but not so hot as to be uncomfortable or maybe damage hair. The switches are ideal as they are easy to set and almost impossible to change by accident. The grip is really comfortable, based upon use by both me (over 6' with larger hands) and CINC House (5-5 with smaller hands), and you don't have to worry about flipping a switch when changing your grip which I really appreciate.While it's immediately obvious that most hair dryer reviews are written by women, I felt compelled to write this one up while taking a break from my normal activities of chopping wood with my shirt off, digging huge ditches with my CAT backhoe, tossing hay bails and huge logs for fun, and arm wrestling at the pub for the affections of some other hair drier reviewer. The bottom line: I believe this little hair dryer is my favorite of all time and I highly recommend it!

This is a really great one! The size is also so perfect. Small enough to travel with but still gets the job done. I couldn't be happier with this purchase!

postInfo: ['Reviewed in the United States on June 12, 2020']

postInfo: ['Reviewed in the United States on September 7, 2019']
text: Perfect gym hair dryer, I love it! :: I work teaching swim lessons and have struggled to find a dryer small enough to fit my bag, having enough ooomph to dry my hair, yet quiet enough to not drive everyone else out of the locker room. This dryer fits the bill and is a delight to boot.They describe it as a "mini pro". It is larger than the travel dryers I've used in the past -- both the folding and just micro mini styles. But it also has more power -- those other dryers either never get warm, don't have enough air flow to dry your hair, or have incredibly short lives due to the bendable/movable parts. This dryer is also smaller than my normal home dryer but it certainly could suffice as one, especially if you have arm strength issues or just want to have a lighter dryer. There are two air speeds -- down for low and up for high. The low has a subtle rumble/hum to it, the high is quieter than my full size dryer. Both give the air flow I would expect. The temperature control is on the handle above that and I find it a bit odd -- cold in the middle, warm down and high up. I don't know why they didn't just do cold - warm - cool like most other dryers. The temperatures were also as I would expect. There is a cold blast button . . . I did try it and it worked fine although I don't usually use it. Just as easy to move the heat switch.Care is normal for hair dryers - keep it clean and keep the vents clear.I am just thrilled with this dyer and it is a great little workhorse which has a permanent position in my gym bag. If it lasts as long as my other Conair dryers I will be thrilled!

postInfo: ['Reviewed in the United States on August 18, 2019']
text: powerful beauty tool :: I was surprised at how small it was when I opened the box, but I was even more surprised at the heftiness of this powerful little tool. It may be small in size, but it weighs about the same as my normal size hair dryers. However, if you're not looking for super light-weight hair dryers for traveling, this would be a good choice as well. Keep in mind, though, it doesn't fold. The weight is very ergonomically distributed, too, so that when I am using it I can move it very comfortably in every position.The setting variety is quite impressive. Normally, hair dryers at this price suffer the unfortunate lack of features, such as only having a high medium low setting and no temperature, or not having a cold blow button. This dryer has it ALL: cold button, three temperature settings, and two fan settings. What more can you ask for? The hot is hot enough but won't burn you unless you keep it at one single spot. The warm setting is really all you need to dry your hair without any risk of over-dryer. The "cool" setting is about the same as the cold button, so if you just want cold air you no longer need to hold the cold button the whole time.Even on the low fan setting it's powerful enough for me to dry my shoulder length hair, especially if you don't use the air concentrater. I personally prefer to use the dryer on low, warm, without the concentrater. But even with the attachment on, the overall size is small enough that it's really easy to maneuver the dryer.The fan has a nice hum and I don't personally think it's super loud. It's not a "quiet" dryer, but it's really reasonable. The buttons are placed nicely and they are stiff enough (but not hard to move and change settings) they do not at all interfere or get accidentally moved during use.Highly recommended! I think it's going to be my new go-to dryer.

postInfo: ['Reviewed in the United States on January 19, 2019']
text: Speed too high/strong for Wavy medium hair :: Fits the Xtava black orchid diffuser perfectly without any alterations. If you have short arms or are a short person in general, this is great because you wont be left with a monstrous equipment to diffuse your hair. However... I have wavy medium 2B low porosity hair. That blow dryer makes me loose my shape bc its lowest setting is very high. I'm happy with the cool temp and never have to use the cool shot button. If you can stand harsher speed bc your curl/wave shape is not as fragile, then go for it. Such a shame, I loved the size for daily use and travel.

postInfo: ['Reviewed in the United States on August 13, 2019']
text: Mini Size, Maxi Power :: I have short hair and use a blow dryer every day of the week. Every. Day.This is the smallest hair dryer I've ever used, but don't let its size fool you. It is powerful. I just received it yesterday and couldn't wait to use it this morning before work. I have also never used a hair dryer that had a concentrator. I had no idea how useful that little accessory could be! I turned the dryer on full speed on warm and using the concentrator it nearly dried my hair in seconds. That's my MO. I dry my hair almost fully, then use my brush and the dryer to give it body and a bit of a curl. Just a bit. The concentrator is my new best friend when it comes to getting ready in the morning.Having a removable filter that can be cleaned is a nice touch, too. I've had to use a Q-Tip and tweezers to clean out previous dryers. This will be so much easier.This also won't take up much space in my luggage. I definitely recommend this tiny Titan.

postInfo: ['Reviewed in the United States on April 14, 2020']
text: Less Likely to Hit the Switches Accidentally... :: ...unlike most of the hair-dryers I see these days. Makes no sense to me putting rocker switches in the place that the hand grips. My last new hair-dryer was a total PITA because I was constantly turning off or changing the setting accidentally mid-dry because the rocker switches were right under my fingers. This dryer puts them on the back of the hand-grip and they are RECESSED, which means I only very occasionally hit the rockers when using the dryer. I still hit them, but not as often. But I'd like to ask the manufacturers what the heck is wrong with SLIDING switches that almost never, ever get accidentally hit? I have a 25 year old panasonic dryer that has slide switches and in all the time I used it, it got switched off or changed the heat setting like *maybe* half a dozen times because the switches were placed in a great place that you just almost couldn't hit them accidentally, AND they were sliders. WORKED GREAT. And now everything seems to be rockers. I really, really dislike rocker switches on hair-dryers.PMO. Ok, now that little rant is over, this dryer is decent - not great, but ok enough.Lightweight in the hand and has all the heat settings you might need, from no heat (via a separate button) up to singe ur hair.The fan is a bit weaker than I might like - with only two settings the highest setting isn't very high (and why everyone is saying it is "quiet" because there is no true "high" setting which tends to be louder) and the husband says "It Sucks". It takes a bit longer to dry our hair then it did with the old dryer....The handle is at a weird and not totally comfortable angle to the rest of the dryer. If I had long hair that took a really long time to dry this might be an issue, but we have short hair so it isn't so bad for us.I don't like how short the front, discharging "barrel" is - the only way to make it a bit longer is to use one of the two, almost identical added extension pieces, and they didn't include just a plain, round barrel end which makes no sense to me. The heating element is just an inch or so from your hair because of this, unless you use one of the two extension pieces, neither of which I like.And as far as the "ionic" claim, well, I literally can't tell the difference between the way my hair feels after using this and after using the 25 year old dryer which I know didn't have any "fancy sounding" tech in it. I think it is simply a buzz-word that lets them tack a few more dollars on the price-tag.So yeah, not bad but not great either. The only thing I really *like* is the switch placement, and that only because they are recessed, not because of what they are or where they put them.And the slick white surface is nice as it is easy to keep clean, unlike matte surfaces that grab grime and crap.Low-down is, I probably wouldn't buy this again if I needed a dryer in the near future, I would look for something else. There is no pricing info available at the time I write this, but I, personally, wouldn't pay more than $35 for this dryer. I have the HOT TOOLS Signature Series Professional 1875W Ionic Ac Motor Hair Dryer and even though it's rocker switches are more annoying, we prefer using it.If my experience changes, or I have issues with the dryer in an unreasonable period of time, I will be sure to update this review.I do hope you found my opinion useful.

postInfo: ['Reviewed in the United States on March 31, 2020']
text: Great dryer for my fine straight hair :: I have fine very straight hair. I sometimes have issues with frizz and/or static but thankfully it's a seasonal thing when they air is dry. If you want to treat yourself to a very fine hairdryer without going all the way to the SUPER expensive, this might be your machine. I realize it would be cost prohibitive to a lot of people at $250, but if it's in your price range and you are considering this machine I am here to say it will not disappoint you.The T3 Micro Featherweight 3i Ionic dryer is gorgeous. As this brand usually does it comes in a nice presentation box and has 2 concentrators (1 for drying 1 for styling), these both fit very snug to the machine. You have an off/low/high toggle switch, and a low medium and high toggle switch at the back of the handle. A nice feature you don't see on less expensive machines at the front of the handle you have a push button, *locking*, cool air option. The dryer is indeed lightweight, quiet, sleek looking and dries for my purposes VERY fast. My hair is soft and smooth. On the day I received this machine I actually spilt some water on my jeans- soaking my thigh- so I used the dryer with the concentrator to dry my jeans. Within minutes I was dry again- it's super fast and I didn't burn myself with too high a heat. The cord is a super long length with a velcro keeper for easy storage, but it's so pretty you may want to find a way to keep it out in the open.It's a very nice dryer and I will enjoy using it.

postInfo: ['Reviewed in the United States on April 3, 2020']
text: lightweight and quiet :: This hair dryer is very lightweight and quiet. It has a super long, heavy duty cord. The settings are adequate to do everything I need. The heat and air levels are perfect. It does dry my hair faster than other hair dryers, but not quite as fast as my Dyson. This one seems more gentle on my hair though. The heat gets hot enough without being too hot and causing damage. My hair doesnt feel dried out or rough after using it. I love that it is much more quiet than pretty much any dryer ive ever used. Im not constantly turning it off because I think I heard something, or heard a kid yelling for me etc., and it was really nothing. With this dryer I can hear over it. It is a nice manageable size, comfortable to use, the rocker style power and heat settings are placed very well and they do not get accidentally hit while drying my hair. I just wish it came with a diffuser. Thats the only minor complaint I have. I am sure I can get one somewhere, so its not a big deal, but definitely nice to have one come with it. The concentrators are great for getting lift and volume at roots, as well as for straightening your hair.

postInfo: ['Reviewed in the United States on April 17, 2020']
text: Almost the full the package :: I think the overall appearance of the hair dryer is very nice. The pure white color with the gold accents is simple and polished.Like other more expensive hair dryers this uses Ion technology which helps hair to stay healthy, shiny and dry quicker. It s very quiet. As far as speeds- this has two- one that is very low and the other that is high. The low would probably be good for bangs. I plan to use the high speed the majority of the time. The temp gets warm enough to dry my hair without getting hot to the touch. There wasn t a chemical smell when I first used it or after more frequent use. There also wasn t any flickering or power issues.The hair dryer almost feels like it s weighted a certain way. When I first picked it up it felt heavy. Then, when I tilted it back the weight distributed to the back of the hair dryer and it seemed much lighter. It s actually really easy to hold this- not at all tough on my wrist or my arms.The cool shot switch is probably one of my favorite things. It doesn t need to be held down. When you press it down it stays locked until you press it again. I was also pleasantly surprised by how cool it got. I kept catching myself going back to it while drying my hair. I even made my fianc come in the room to feel how good the cold air felt. My only concern, the cool shot switch felt like it was loosening the more I used it.I would have liked if this hair dryer was a little less expensive, but this might be a case where you re getting what you pay for. I should mention, I ve used other hair dryers that were either hotter or faster (none with a better cool shot), but this hair dryer is just the full package.

postInfo: ['Reviewed in the United States on April 18, 2020']
text: Lovely dryer :: There are a lot of settings on this hair dryer, a few more than your standard dryer. This is a really nice machine, though. It feels smooth and the airflow is nice and strong, very even. My only real problem with it is that if you want to use a silicone collapsible diffuser on it, the barrel is pretty wide, so you really will have to wrestle it on. I ended up taking the plastic screen off the diffuser and stretching it from the other way, and then putting the screen back on. I feel like I have to be very careful so it won't come back off. It comes with two different concentrators, but no dedicated diffuser of any type. I was able to dry my curls in a short time with the diffuser attachment I bought separately, but I have curly hair and I don't know how well the concentrators would work for that.

postInfo: ['Reviewed in the United States on April 19, 2020']
text: quiet, light, and fast :: This is a great compact dryer with few of the compromises you expect when you go small. While quiet, it delivers a blast of air that quickly dries my thick hair.One of the features of this is that the attachments can lock into either a horizontal or vertical alignment. You snap them in and then they rotate freely until they hit a catch point either straight up an down or straight side to side. The penalty for this is the attachments require quite a bit of muscle to snap on and off. You have to stop whatever you're doing to focus on snapping on the attachment you need. If you never change attachments, this won't matter but if you do take the attachments sometimes, you may find this annoying.I like that all of the controls are toggle switches that are recessed so you don't ever bump them while using the dryer. I love that the cool mode toggles either on or off so you don't have to hold down the button forever.One concern is the rear air inlet is not removable. Instead they tell you to wipe it with a cloth to remove dust. I know sometimes the dirt that builds up gets inside of my dryers and since you can't get to the inside of this one I concern that it will clog up over time. I guess I'll have to see how it does.

postInfo: ['Reviewed in the United States on May 18, 2020']
text: All around thumbs up, but hefty price tag! :: Thumbs up for the lightweight dryer and the sleek designThumbs up for the heat levels and how fast it changes from hot to coolThumbs up for the button to activate cooling rather than having to press down on it continuously and I like the switch design, they are comfortable and not in the way when I hold it in my hand.I have noticed that my hair does dry faster and I am not sweating after drying my hair. Unfortunately, I have not noticed any drastic difference in smoothing the cuticles of my hair as it claims. But the 2 concentrator helps style my hair quicker with target heat/cool air. I usually let my hair air dry, perhaps I will use this more often and may notice the difference after a while. The dryer could have included a 360 rotating base for the cord. The price is quite steep, so I really hope I'll notice less frizz and shinier hair soon...

postInfo: ['Reviewed in the United States on April 4, 2020']
text: Love this blow dryer :: The T3 Micro Featherweight dryer is beautifully crafted and works great. This is my second dryer from T3. I have used an older model for about 5 years now and haven't had an issues with it. I decided to give this dryer a try because of its small size. It works just as well as the larger hair dryer and the controls work just as well too. I expect to get many years of use out of the 3i. What I love about the T3 dryers is that in my experience, they last a long time without any issues. To me, the higher cost is worth it because I don't have to buy replacements every few years. I have fine hair and this dryer cuts back on the frizz without making my hair look too flat.

postInfo: ['Reviewed in the United States on April 2, 2020']
text: Simple, Elegant, Works Well :: The T3 Micro Featherweight is a gorgeous, high-end hair dryer.The packaging is sophisticated and a joy to open up.The product is very simple and straight forward. One is slightly wider than the other. They lock in well to the dryer. It makes a loud sound when clicking into place and requires a little bit of force and patience.I have fine, thin hair and have not had any issues with frizziness while using this dryer.

postInfo: ['Reviewed in the United States on June 14, 2020']

postInfo: ['Reviewed in the United States on March 15, 2018']
text: Hot Mess....No More!!! :: I never really thought a hair dryer would make that big of a difference on my hair. However, I was recently telling my stylist how long it takes me to blow dry my hair, and he told me that I do not have a "sufficient" blow dryer. He never said the one I had was bad, just that no matter how long or thick your hair is, a good dryer should not take that long to get your hair dry. He showed me the hair dryer he uses, and has used the same brand for the past 12 years. He said he would recommend the TwinTurbo to anyone who asks. So I bit the bullet and bought one. Holy moly, this thing is AMAZEBALLS!!!! What normally took me 20+ minutes to dry my hair, was now done in almost 5. My hair wasn't frizzy or pissed off at me afterwards. Literally just flipped my head over and ran my fingers through my hair while blowdrying till I was complete. I flipped my head over, and my hair looked incredible. I am totally enamored with my hair dryer (as weird as that is to say, its even weirder to write). However, I am sure you will be too. And the dryer is totally worth the money!!!

postInfo: ['Reviewed in the United States on April 15, 2015']
text: New-found Life in Hair! (Med-length wavy hair) :: I realized a bit too late in my adult life that a good blow-dryer makes all the difference in the look and feel of your hair. I simply could not figure out why my hair was always kind of "sticky" and not quite fully dry when I got out of the shower and tried to dry my hair with my 5+ year old Conair that I bought at CVS very inexpensively.I did some research online and scoffed at the $150+ dryers that were being promoted. This one was on the list, and honestly, given the relatively lower price point versus the other professional dryers, I was willing to try it out.WOW. I have used it now about 3 times, and it is hard to believe what a significant difference I see in my hair. I styled it myself for a formal Gala event, and was able to achieve the shiny look, feel, and volume in my hair that any professional stylist could achieve. It was unreal. Even on a work day I feel so much better about myself having simply styled my hair with this blow dryer. It targets the hot hair wonderfully and leaves my hair so dry, shiny and healthy.I went back and ordered one to send to my mom! She is also a victim of ignorance-to-bad-dryer-itis, so I went ahead and sent her the cure.Happy Drying!

postInfo: ['Reviewed in the United States on July 11, 2011']
text: LOVE this blowdryer! :: This is the best blow dryer ever! I have long, thick hair and I was able to dry all of my hair (without styling) in 60 seconds! I typically spend 5 minutes though since I like to diffuse it at the end with a round brush. My hair has never looked so good. It's always sleek and smooth and shiny and bouncy. I never thought I could get a flat ironed look from just a blow dryer but I've been able to cut out having to use a flat iron or curling iron when in a rush. Since I've dyed my hair for the last 15 years and style it frequently my air-dryed hair is frazzled and with this blow dryer you'd think I was a hair model!Before purchasing this blowdryer I spent a lot of time researching different kinds of blow dryers. I thought I had to have ionized or tourmaline or ceramic or whatever other fancy word to make my hair shiny, but this one works WONDERS! Very long cord too and so light! I've had mine for over a year now and use it 2-3 times per week without any problems. Only thing is the back has come unscrewed a few times and the screen filter falls out then. But it's easy to put back on. No idea how or why it comes unscrewed cause it's kinda hard to take apart on purpose.

postInfo: ['Reviewed in the United States on November 10, 2016']
text: Extremely disappointed :: I have to say I'm very disappointed in this blowdryer. Years ago I had a twin turbo and LOVED IT! So when I had to purchase a new one for work I decided to give it another go. This dryer does not get hot and it takes me way to long to do a blowout. The nozzle constantly flies off and hits the client unless I literally pound it on with my hand. And the worst part is the filter cover in the back also just pops off at the worst times like I'm the middle of a blowout! I have had 2 of my clients hair get stuck. This is completely unacceptable. I have decided to bring my personal Elchim from home to work and will keep the turbo for my personal use (and risk my hair getting stuck) until I decided on a better blowdyer for work. I would not recommend this product unless you don't mind constantly apologizing to clients. Total waste of money! I have had this dryer for less then 2 months. No reason for any of this to be happening.

postInfo: ['Reviewed in the United States on November 10, 2019']
text: Wow. My hair never looked better. :: I have thinning super frizzy gray hair. Yes, it's as awful as it sounds. However, I rented an Air BNB 2 weeks ago where they had this hair dryer for guests. It worked so well I ordered it online and it arrived the same day I returned from my trip. I never realized how much a hair dryer could help with styling. This thing worked magic on notoriously difficult hair. People have been commented on how good my hair looks and I am very happy with the results. Unfortunately the high humid of summer is past us now so I'm not sure how well it will work under those conditions, but the improvement with my fall hair is amazing. Just an FYI - my previous hairdryer was more expensive than this one and didn't work 1/2 as well.

postInfo: ['Reviewed in the United States on August 17, 2015']
text: Not amazed. :: I really wanted to love this dryer as it comes highly recommended by professional stylists. I used it twice, it dried my hair quickly and somewhat smooth using a ceramic ion brush. I was pleased with the results, after all this was a big step up from the half broken one I purchased from Sally's years ago. Then I visited my mother who recently purchased a new drier, the rusk w8less. She told me I should try it. When I used the rusk I was amazed at how fast it dried my hair and how smooth and silky my hair felt. I was in LOVE!!! It was a huge step up from the twinturbo. I had to have the rusk, so I returned the twinturbo. I could not be happier w the customer service. Refund was super smooth. So for the drier 3 stars customer service via Amazon and the seller 5 stars.Pros: Dries fast, smooth results, nice button position.Cons: Heavy, the wind screen on the back has no cover, just flimsy screen. On both occasions I used the drier my long hair was sucked into the screen, causing it to tangle and burn. In my opinion this is a design flaw. The hole in the back of the dryer is the circumference of my fist!Look to the rusk w8less! It's an outstanding dryer!

text: beefy :: I know the gun is for professional hairstyling.When throwing large porcelain, and airbrushing glaze you need to apply a little hot air here and there, as a professional trick of the trade.This beefy gun is easy to hold; the buttons are intuitive and the step- up feature is helpful.Well built solid construction throughout.Have used it regularly for a few years now, and I like it.

postInfo: ['Reviewed in the United States on January 26, 2013']
text: OK to me! :: I needed an inexpensive hairdryer. When it arrived, it was not as large as I thought it would be...that's a good thing when you're tight on storage space. I would say this is a mid-size hairdryer. Not the full gigantic salon-sized version nor the mini travel version. It doesn't seem too noisy when on and the volume of air it blows is pretty decent.The overall construction is as you would expect for the price...a glossy smooth plastic outer shell surrounding the internal heating/electrical/mechanical workings. The switch is easy to manipulate into the desired setting: down for low and up for high. The cool shot button allows the hairdryer to ramp up into the high mode but blow out cool air. The filter cover on the end of the hairdryer is easy to remove by twisting off. I prefer this type of filter cover over the hinged version that you cannot run under the sink for a good cleaning. If you ever rinse the filter cover, make sure it is absolutely dry before putting it back on the hairdryer as water and electricity do not mix! On the topic of electricity, the hairdryer also features a GFCI plug in case your bathroom doesn't have a GFCI outlet. This feature trips the power off to your hairdryer in case it comes into contact with water, preventing electrocution.The weight is decent and lightweight, not too heavy to hold while drying your hair. The handle could be a bit more comfortable, but for the money I cannot complain that much.I don't know about durability, but I think it was a decent purchase and very utilitarian.

postInfo: ['Reviewed in the United States on January 11, 2020']
text: Perfect medium sized hair dryer! :: Hope this new Revlon hair dryer lasts as long as my previous one that I had for over 15 years. Recommend and will update should anything change...UPDATE May 29th, 2020:My wife used the blow dryer for the first time as she usually does her hair in our other bathroom and her hair got sucked into the blow dryer! She said it didnt cause any damage as she pulled her hair out immediately but it could have. I looked at her blow dryer that she normally uses and it looks to have 2 screens at the intake vs the one screen that this dryer has. So if you have long hair, please be careful...

postInfo: ['Reviewed in the United States on July 1, 2019']
text: Good value for money :: This is a great little hair dryer! It doesn't have any bells or whistles, but it has really strong power. My only complaint is that there isn't a protective foam material at the air intake end like my previous dryer had. So if you end up accidentally getting your hair sucked in, it goes way in and gets stuck. The first time I used the dryer I had to literally pull my hair out, breaking it off inside. For this reason, I highly advise against purchasing this hair dryer for a child. But for adults who can be more careful of the angles you're holding the dryer, it's great!

postInfo: ['Reviewed in the United States on December 6, 2019']
text: It it loud,cold button use my held down to use cold air setting, short cable, and sucked in my hair :: If you are looking for something that isnt loud this isnt for you. Its loud enough where I have to stop a conversation because I cant hear the other person. In terms of buttons there is a "cold" setting, however I do need to hold it down for cold air. But I will say when blow drying holding the "cold button " isn't so bad because the design makes your hand feel snug when you want cold air and holding it down. In terms of light weight and travel I would use it. It is light weight and petty small comparing to my old hair dryer. The back of the hair dryer sucks air in so fast and hard that It sucked in my hair! Ultimately my hair did get caught in the back of the hair dryer and I did have to be extra careful but does it do its job? Yes. The cable isnt long enough when plugging it to an ankels height outlet and bending over is a must. I am 5'2 and it doesn't go passed my head. Luckily I don't have back probelms or else this would be a huge issue. So I would recommend a higher outlet and making sure the back of the hair dryer isnt facing your long hair or it will get caught. But if you dont mind holding down on the cold setting,making sure the back of the hair dryer isnt facing your hair (because it will suck in your hair),bending over or agusting to a higher outlet (the cable is a little short) and the loud noice and you are looking for a cheap bolw dryer that gets the job done with it your best bet.

postInfo: ['Reviewed in the United States on May 22, 2020']

postInfo: ['Reviewed in the United States on May 20, 2017']
text: great dryer, great price :: Nice little dryer for a very low price. Love that it is all black. What is up with all the neon colors in hairstyling tools? text: A good hair dryer :: Good hair dryer for the money. The only thing that I don't like about it: The part that plugs into the wall outlet is bulky and the chord is short, so if you have an outlet close to the floor and you stand up to dry your hair, it will come out of the wall.

postInfo: ['Reviewed in the United States on June 8, 2019']
text: Works great! :: I used my 20-year-old dryer and noticed the plug was super hot when I unplugged it. It works great but doesn't move as much air as my older blow dryer. Knowing what I know now, I am glad I wasn't quick to throw it out, but now I am afraid to use either of them. My home is older and so it the wiring so I will need to be very careful with anything that uses that much power.

postInfo: ['Reviewed in the United States on April 23, 2019']

postInfo: ['Reviewed in the United States on April 7, 2015']
text: Buying a hair dryer "YOU GET WHAT YOU PAY FOR" ,Cheap isn't always good and Good is not always cheap. :: A Cheap, Hairdryer ! I got what I paid for. Do yourself a favor and open your wallet and pull out about another $5-$15 for a quality hair dryer, that will arrive fast and free and last a few years of faithful service . Don't be a like me and be a cheap skate and buy a dryer that will be lucky if it lasts 4 months. Because of it's terrible design, if you buy this Revlon Rvdr5034 and are under the assumtion that the dryer has power, stability, easy use, sturdy and years of uninteruptive service. You are purchasing the wrong item.After the first week of dealing with the above 1875 watt hair dryer, I through it away. It had the power of a quick breeze, not 1875 watt hair dryer.The lesson I had lerned from this mistake is just because a hair dryer is backed by a "quality" company at a good or cheap price. Does NOT mean you are purchasing a "quality" hair dryer. Look at others that are few dollars more, and always check the reveiws of prevoius purchasers.
